text: I'm having some joint and skin issues that could be hyaluronic acid related.  So I found this product and it is well reviewed.However, you may want to search "hyaluronic acid cancer".  It doesn't cause cancer, but it may help it spread.  Wikipedia has a somewhat technical explanation.  I'm nowhere near the expert.So what to do?  Certainly if you have cancer, it would not be a good idea to take this stuff.  I don't so, so far so good.Treat this like Vitamin A: your body produces it, but your body regulates the production of it: it only makes what it needs.  If you have enough, your body won't make more.  But if you take vitamin A supplements, your body can't avoid it and it can build up to a toxic level.If this helps you, then stop taking it and make sure you are eating the right foods to allow your body to make it.  Beans, spinach and sweet potatoes are good sources of food to help your body make what it needs.I'm not an expert but I think that taking this for a long time is probably not worth the risk unless you are in serious trouble without it.  I don't want to alarm anyone, nor do I have an opinion (heck, even I'm going to try it) but I don't think it's a good idea long term unless nothing else works and you are in bad shape without it.On the other hand, it isn't clear that if you take it in a pill form and digest it, it remains as hyaluronic acid, so who really knows!  I'm not trying to pass judgment, just to alert people to something they may not have thought about.UPDATE: After receiving the bottle and researching it further, I've decided that no one should take any of this stuff unless you are in very serious and continuous pain for which no relief is possible.  If it survives digested, it's like pouring gasoline on a fire to try to put it out.  It might work for your joints, but the dangers cannot possibly be worth the risk.  It's proven to help cause cancers to spread, and it is *not* proven to help joint pain.  I decided not to take it and urge you to do the search for "hyaluronic acid cancer" and make up your own mind.  Again, it doesn't cause cancer but it helps it grow and spread.  Who needs that?

The fabric is like silk, so it slips and slides once you start to sweat.  The back rides up.These are no replacement for the Cotton Bike Active Brief that stayed in place.  I wish I could tell you what was!

I bought this product with two Seagate Barracuda 7200 1 TB 7200RPM SATA 3Gb/s 32MB Cache 3.5 Inch Internal Hard Drive ST31000528AS-Bare Drive.  You need at least one drive to make it work and the drive you can buy with the thing is not very good.  Buy it bare and then add two of the drives like I did.All screws were included with the drives.  Some people report that their drives don't come with screws.  If that's the case, use the screws from an old computer or buy Link Depot Accessory Computer Screws Kit 68Pcs or cheaper still StarTech 15SCREW6_32  632 x 1/4-Inch Long Screws (15 Pack).You can access your files remotely and the backups are automatic once you set them up.  As soon as the file changes, it is automatically backed up.  If you plug a laptop in to your network and log on, any files changed while the laptop was unplugged will get uploaded into the thing.If your disks have problems, you get an e-mail from the device.  If the thing stops working (because it gets unplugged, for example), your computers will tell you.The product works as expected.  I had previously used a seagate Mirra, which is no longer available.  In comparison to the mirra, the downside is that you have to add the disks in yourself (took about ten minutes - no special skills required, just a screwdriver), and you have to log into the computer for the software to back up your files.  The mirra would back them up if you turned on the computer but had not yet logged on.  The other big gotcha is that if power is cut and then restored, the Mirra would automatically reboot itself, this device stays off until you turn it back on.The upside is that the system has two disks, configured so that if one fails the other has a copy.  And, most importantly, your computer will tell you if it can't connect to the device.  My big complaint with the Mirra was that it did not tell you when there was a failure.  So as you can guess, there was a failure and I just charged happily along for 6 months without knowing that I had no backup.  When I needed it, I discovered it hadn't been working for 6 months.  The software for this device added to every computer it backs up tells you within a minute if the device is off.I've had it for about a year and a half and I'm happy with it.  It backs everything up from several different computers and I don't have to think about it.  If someone on my staff accidentally deletes a file, we can get it back.  If a disk on my server fails, I can get everything back.

This seller is selling these for an outrageous price and you should look elsewhere.  Bicycle Source US refused to cancel my order when I realized how ridiculous their price was and insists on charging a huge fee for a return.Please go elsewhere.

I saw the reviews, but decided to give the unit a try.  I had no problems with it at all.  I used it on a Motorola Droid 2 and a Veho 360 rechargeable speaker and it did exactly what it said it would do: it charged both of them to 100% at the same time, and shut off a few minutes after the last one was charged.Most chargers draw a small amount of current when plugged in, even when you unplug the device they were charging.  This device charges your rechargeable devices, detects the devices are full, waits a few minutes, then shuts off, drawing no power from that point on.  So if you charge your devices at night, the charger won't be drawing power all day doing nothing.You could get the same effect by unplugging the charger, but I never did, so this was ideal.It is also conveniently designed, with three USB plugs (which only supply power, there is no connection to a computer), two short cords to use, each of a slightly different style.  Or you can plug in your own USB cords, and they provide a cord management system to store the unused length of cord if you use your own.  If you can use their plugs, you can take your charge to work and store it in your desk to use for emergencies.Like a lot of "green" products, the energy savings won't make up for the cost, but if you like the idea of not wasting energy, thereby reducing pollution and saving the planet, and would like a clutter free way to charge your devices, this product is for you.  The earlier models sound like they had some bugs, but I experienced none of them so its possible they redesigned it.I'm pretty energy savings obsessed: you can see the first review for the Bunn NHBX-B Contemporary 10-Cup Home Coffee Brewer, Black (mine is the first review), to get an idea of the analysis I typically go through.  I would recommend this product, it's convenient and it saves wasted energy, but just remember that you won't save enough in electricity bills to offset the purchase price, but the energy savings, plus being able to use your existing charger as an emergency charger elsewhere, makes this product's purchase price worthwhile.

This product really works.  I've been having problems with my right knee for a while and certain activities made it much worse.  I put this one and did the worst of them, and felt better afterwards than I did when I started.  I just ordered 2 more of the same product.Amazon thankfully ships it in a plain envelope - the retail package is large and a waste of trees.  Unfortunately, there are no instructions on the envelope.  Here are the instructions (I've edited them from the retail package):Center the pressure pad under the kneecap (i.e. the little hard tube goes in front of your knee, aimed backwards, the logo is in front, just under your kneecap, like in the photo).Use the shorter velcro strap to wrap the thing around your knee, just under your kneecap, then use the longer strap to tighten it.  (You basically use the shorter strap just to hold it on your knee and then the longer strap to make it tighter while it's held on your knee with the other strap.  There is a little groove right under your kneecap, it fits in that groove.)Hand wash cold, air dry.Update: I just ordered 5 more so I can have a clean pair whenever I need them.  That's right: I now have 8 of them.  They are that good.Uh oh, update II: After just under two months, one of them fell completely apart!  Both straps came off.  Realize that I have 4 pairs of these, and I rotate through them, so this was like two weeks of use.  Sewing them back together isn't the most fun thing but it's possible.  Just recognize that they might fall apart just when you need them!To sew them, take the two elastic velcro pieces and start with the longest one.  On the main piece, there is a little pouch three inches to the right of the logo.  Shove the non velcro end of the longest elastic piece into that pouch, with the velcro facing backwards (if the logo is the front).  Hold it there.  On the back side of the main piece, find the other pouch and shove non-velcro end of the shorter strap in that pouch, with the velcro facing the same direction as the long strap, towards the back side, the side with the beads in the tube.  Now sew through both pouches and both straps.  Cut away any of the old thread, it won't hold if you try to tie it off, just cut it away.  It should last.  The others have lasted for over a year.

I saw someone using one of these about a mile away in the daytime!  When I saw that it runs on 4 AAA batteries (think - cheap rechargeables), I had to have one.  Or two.  So I bought two, LOVED them and bought two more.  Three months later, they have all broken.  They are made out of thin, brittle plastic.  If you drop it once, it's gone, shattered into a million pieces.  If something crushes it in your backpack -- Crunch.  Think handblown glass.  They are that bad.I started wrapping them with electrical tape to keep them from breaking, but even the handlebar mount is made of brittle thin plastic.  I broke two of them in one week.  You can't tape the mount.  I don't manhandle anything, but these are simply unsuitable for outdoor use.And this seller's price is ridiculous.  I've been paying about $6.50.I hope the manufacturer sees this and makes them out of a less brittle plastic.  The light output is outstanding and battery life is great.  You can actually see with them.  But the build quality is a catastrophe.
Quite disastrously calibrated, we had the same problems the other had but fiddled with it enough that we're keeping it.  It takes a long time to get it to look right.

Some advice if you are thinking of buying one of these:First, go buy a bag of ice at the store for $2, see how long it lasts, and ask yourself if you really need an icemaker for $200.  That's a lot of bags of ice, and you still have to pay for electricity and fill it up and clean it!  If you can get by with a $2 bag once or twice a month for 5 months out of the year, this may not be the product for you!We decided on this one because it looked like the best one after looking at the comments of other reviewers.  We noted that ice makers in general have a pretty high breakdown rate, and so for the first time in my life, I actually bought an extended warranty that all consumer magazines tell you are a waste of money.  We'll see.If you buy it, while it's on its way, go buy a quart size container of vinegar.  The plastic smell this thing generates when you first get it is pretty strong.  That's just the smell AROUND the unit when it's on, I didn't even bother tasting the ice.Dump the vinegar and an equal amount of water in it and press the self clean button.  Run it twice then as it makes ice, throw the ice out.Now you have a second problem: the vinegar will smell even though you got rid of all the ice.  That's because there is 4 cups of water left in the thing when it looks empty.  The only way to get rid of the 4 cups of vinegar-smelling water is to drain it using the drain on the lower left.  Fill it again, run it, toss out the ice, drain and repeat until the ice stops smelling like vinegar.  We had to run it through several times.  It took several days.And then: it makes ice.  Enough to fill 5 large ice tea glasses in about 3 hours.  As another reviewer noted, the ice stays in an insulated bucket with holes in it that sits above the water reservoir.  When the ice melts, the melted ice drips into the reservoir.  When the level of ice is less than full, it makes more.The reviewer stating that he can't tell when it's on is absolutely nuts.  It sounds like a modestly quiet dishwasher in the rinse cycle.  You can tell when its on from 20 feet away.  It runs continuously until the ice bucket is full then stops and then it is silent until enough ice melts for another batch to be made to refill it.It's a fairly large appliance, but most of its size is dedicated to insulation that you WANT, so it's large in a good way.  13" wide by 16" high by 16" deep.  About the size of a big office printer.It's more energy efficient than you'd expect.  It uses 2.4 amps to make the ice and 3.5 amps for the minute it takes when it's pushing the ice from where it gets made into the bucket.  2.4 amps x 120 volts means it uses about .290 kilowatts.  If you figure it runs about 4 hours per day, that's about 1.152 kilowatt hours per day, about 12 cents per day or $3.60 per month.A child can operate it.  Once it's set up, you just fill the tank with water (about 10 cups max), push a power button and it will run all day by itself, stopping and starting as needed to make more ice until you shut it off or it runs out of water.  They give you a shovel to scoop ice out of the basket, and the basket has handles s that you can lift the whole thing out and dump it into another container.The interior is made out of the same stuff any cooler is made out of and is easy to clean.We're happy with it.  If it breaks, I'll be back to report it and I'll also report whether the extended warranty was worth it or not.Edit: 4 years later, did it break?  No, because we never used it.  Arrrgh!  At least I didn't pay for it.  I rent extra office spaces and one of my tenants bought this thing after he said my ice tasted funny.  Never ever used it though. I think they thought it would be like an ice maker you get with a fridge.  This one takes actual effort: you have to fill it, drain it, clean it, etc. so they never used it after all my work cleaning it.Let me give you some good advice: buy 4 ice cube trays and put them in the freezer every night instead of cleaning this thing.  Then, in the morning, dump them into a gallon freezer zip lock bag and repeat.  It's easier, cheaper, costs little to do and you'll thank me in the end.  This was a complete waste.

I have three of the higher quality Klean Kanteen (KK) bottles, but decided to purchase one of these on sale at a local store to use as a bike bottle.  Klean Kanteen bottles are five times as expensive, so I figured I just wanted something I could beat up and potentially lose without worries and this fit the bill.The difference between the two products is pretty large.  The KK bottles are twice as thick, and are made out of a single piece of stainless steel.  This allows the bottoms of the KK bottles to be rounded at the edges (they are still flat at the bottoms) and not leak because it is a single piece.The Green Canteen (GC) bottles are made from thinner stainless, and the bottom edge is squared off, though it isn't remotely sharp and not "razor sharp" as one reviewer mentioned.  The practical effect of the difference between the two bottles is nothing.  I also note that a lot of the KK reviewers say their bottle tops leak, though I don't have this problem with my KK bottles or with this bottle.My GC bottle arrived with an oily, metallic smell that washing with normal dish soap and airing out for several weeks did not get rid of.  It took soaking overnight in automatic dish detergent and scrubbing with a brush to get rid of it.  It still imparts a slightly metallic taste.  I suspect they use a less expensive grade of stainless steel that you can taste or at least smell.  I had no such problems with any of the KK bottles.  I noticed that some KK reviewers mentioned the same problem with their bottles, and that none of the other GC reviewers have mentioned this problem, so it may be something that different people are sensitive to, or it could be that I just got a batch with some leftover polishing chemicals and the KK batches can sometimes have that happen too.Once I got rid of the metallic oily taste, I'd say I got what I paid for - a cheaper bottle that probably won't last forever, which I'm OK with.  If you want a cheaper, less well-built product, buy this one.  If you want something that will last a long time, and uses a higher quality stainless, buy the KK.  I'd buy each brand again without hesitation.

Next to Walter Kennedy, John Roberts seemed as tall as a giant. Usually both men worked companionably side by side swabbing decks on the slave transport ship Princess. One day when they are not being as friendly towards each other, Roberts is sent below deck and we learn of his friendship with a captured slave. The Negro slave asks John, an unabashed Christian, how God views the slave trade.Before John can decide how to answer, the Princess is overtaken by pirates.John feels his captain would give the slaves a better chance at a good life than pirates; after all, aren't pirates greedy, self centered criminals? When the pirate captain declares they are there to free the slaves and return them to their home, John has doubts. This is how he joined the pirate crew.The first thing John learns as a pirate is that the ships are run under a very unusual set of rules.The second thing he notices is that the pirates are a mixed bunch. He begins to question his beliefs.Not long after joining the pirate crew, along with Kennedy, they experience a naval cannon battle.This time the pirates are after gold, which is what the sailors expect of pirates.Again, Roberts faith and belief are tested, as are his friendships.Kennedy becomes jealous and spiteful. John tries to do him a favor but true nature prevails.When it becomes necessary to name a new pirate captain and set new plans in action, vengeance rears its ugly head.This brief story sets the scene and tone for future volumes in this series.I was drawn into the telling and did not know how things would turn out.The characters are not complex but filled out enough to be interesting.The idea of pirates not being the evilest option was enticing.

I read this hearing voices similar to Dr. Ruth and Judge Judy in my head.Sort of a New York Jewish accent, wisdom mixed with humor.Normally, the Julius and Rebecca Cohen Home for Jewish Seniors was a routine place for elderly folks to live. There was a consistent pattern and rhythm to each day. Seeing as the population consists of elderly people with medical problems and no place else to live, the occasional death was expected.As in any setting where people coexist, now and then there will be conflict and drama.Sometimes a death came about by means of unnatural cause. Mrs. K. seemed to find herself in the middle of those odd deaths. Not long ago she even found herself a suspect in a murder investigation.The story is narrated by Ida, best friend of Rose Kaplan, the aforementioned Mrs. K. Now, gossip and the spreading thereof, is seriously frowned upon by the Jewish religion. Ida does her best to stick to facts but as she tells us, it gets complicated.Vera Gold was not well liked within the community. She often stuck her nose in where it didn't belong and she seemed to enjoy getting others in trouble. When she became ill, it would not have been strange if people stayed away, yet her sister and her son made sure to take extra care of Vera. As it seemed she was recovering, suddenly she died. The senior home and doctor all took it in stride. As with Jewish custom, burial was swift.It wasn't until someone close to Vera insisted her death had been helped along, and requested Mrs. I'd help, that there were any doubts. Out of her past unfortunate dealings with the police, Mrs. K. made some valuable contacts. Once they were convinced the death was not from natural cause, they set their eyes on a suspect whom Mrs. K could not accept.She could not rest without her own full investigation.I think my favorite part of the book was when the ladies discovered a new restaurant. Between the drama and investigation, the book is full of informational passages.I received this book in exchange for an honest review.

How does a band get a name like Stark Naked and the Car Thieves?Make a smart remark in the wrong place and show up for work to find your future changed.An enthralling memoir of a classic era among American rock and roll history.I did, at points, wonder if Larry's recollection of certain events was a bit revisionist, but no matter. I was caught up in his story and relationships and couldn't walk away before the end.I will pick up the second volume.Free love, cheap and plentiful drugs but tough times to break into a life altering business.Although in their 20s, these guys from Indiana were not prepared for life in California and beyond.It takes more than musical talent just to survive, to even get a chance to prove your worth.We travel along through the group's struggles with family and relationships, in-fighting between band members, crooked management and empty promises.If you were alive in the era, or if you have interest in the entertainment or music industries, you will enjoy reading about the tumultuous beginnings of Larry's music career. You will get a flash view of the seedy underbelly of the times. My parents would never have been as supportive.I do read memoirs and this one is very well written. I was glad Larry also shared his love of reading and trying new things. I am looking forward to reading the rest of this adventure.I did receive a copy to review without expectations or compensation.

Two damaged strangers sharing one magnificent house in bushfire country outside of Melbourne, Australia.Rosie, the contracted house and pet sitter, and Owen, the home owners' nomadic, adult son with no plans to settle surprise each other in the middle of the night.Each of them has a fractured relationship with their parents, ech of them is hiding deep secrets, but those seem to be the only things they have in common.Rosie has an absent boyfriend and likes to play strictly by the rules, safety and security are her goals. Owen loves freedom and change. Life is not worth living without some risk.They seem so different. Can they possibly survive together long enough to become friends?Has fate actually crossed their paths more than once?Will each discover what they truly desire?A good steady pace full of emotional upheaval, the reader can feel the tide turning before the main characters will admit it to themselves.Most novels I have read try to portray a period dialogue or fit American English protocols.  I really enjoyed the Australian English this was written in.I even discovered a new favorite word!I did receive this book in exchange for an honest review

A tender, sweet, holiday romance.Mothers always try to do the best for their children, no matter how old or mature that child is.Mothers of boys are perhaps even more protective.Dr. Timothy Martin is an educated and accomplished surgeon, or at least he was.An incident a year ago left his self confidence shattered and his dominant hand with minimal function.He had tried all the usual medical treatments to repair it. As a last resort he gives in to his mother's request to seek help from Meggie Marie. After all, this Meggie did help his mother, who considers Meggie to be almost magical.Meggie wants to help her friend Alma's son but she doesn't hold unrealistic hopes for him returning to the operating room. She and Alma share a secret which makes Meggie uncomfortable.From the moment Timothy sees Meggie he begins to understand what his mother feels is so special about her. Besides helping his hand, she energizes his whole outlook on life. Could she feel the same way?Will her secret ruin everything? Do Christmas miracles ever truly happen?Well written with a touch of mystery and romantic tension.A feel good short read to brighten your holiday.

I love this series! While the Booker series does have its dark and twisted side, even the general crime drama reader will become hooked if read in order. The characters become real and you'll get attatched. You'll worry about them and occcasionally want to smack them for decisions and actions you, the reader, know will not turn out well. At parts, I also laughed out loud.Booker was an honest cop. That sense of value got him black balled and unceremoniously TOSSED from the Dallas force. Fortunately, he still has a few trustworthy contacts from that life,or so he believes, but we are learning nothing is ever as simple or clear as it seems.When the Chief of DPD secretly hires Booker to hunt down a cop killer, you know there are enemies and danger on all sides, from ALL directions.The deeper Booker gets into the case, the more complex it becomes and it hits very close to home. The entire force is stymied but Chief Ligon puts heat on Booker for immediate results.Soon it is not only cops being killed. Is this someone on a vendetta?There definitely seems to be a masterplan and a hitlist.(Although this killer doesn't always follow the plan.)With an ending you won't see comingI received this book ine xchange for my honest review

I, Mary begins as a coming of age story which develops into an epic tale of survival.Because of the family into which she was born, Mary was given an opportunity no other female of her time, the 17th century, would be afforded. Mary was basically raised at sea and involved with aspects of the shipping business and sayling life. Before age 12 she was allowed to sign on as a crewman to continue her education and earn her raise up the ranks.Mary Critter is the granddaughter of the legendary Walter Crofter. We learn some of his history as it is told to Mary.The story begins during time of English civil war, when it was dangerous to speak about to which side one was loyal. Mary even finds herself undertaking dangerous, secret missions.As dedicated as Mary is to a life as a saylor, around age 15 she decides she also desires a life as a married woman and mother.There are numerous factual events threaded into this intriguing tale for history students and aficionados to revel in. There is a strong family drama to keep any reader saying "Just one more chapter!"Mary is amazingly strong in body, intellect and character.This book will be enjoyed by well read young readers through adults. A great choice to read with your young reader.I did receive a copy of this book in exchange for my review.

A fun read for late elementary to middle school readers.Good book about making friends and learning to work in cooperation with siblings.I enjoyed seeing how their minds worked through the problems of thinking like the missing dog.Good lesson in being open and honest when speaking to parents.I was given this book in exchange for an honest review.

This is a tale for both teens and adults. it stars two brothers, age 12 and 14 who are stolen from their family by the press gang.Forced to become pirates, although called sailors, this emotionally wrenching tale is a story of survival and brutal conditions.It  is a test of family loyalty and personal strength.The writing is amazingloy descriptive and the illustrations add much to the experience.I was given an e- copy of this book in exchange for my honest review.

Although this is written for a teenage audience, I am sure other older readers, such as myself, will also get pulled into this mystical tale. The main character, or family, are living in the midwestern US (Ohio) but the daighter and her father have Moroccan genes and all appreciate the Morrocan heritage and mythology, the values of the OLD country.When Kenza turns sixteen herm life (and dreams) begin to change. she never had overly much interest in boys before but one she meets in a dream, she can not forget. Now, the question is, was it a dream?Morroccan lore is filled with magic and genies, here referred to as jinns.Not only is Kenza visited by a protective jinn called Junny Zzaman, but she is whisked away to learn that her spirit can inhabit bodies from long ago. And her ancestor's spirit can come along in Kenza'a body for a ride.Unfortunately, some very evil spirits can also jump fprward from the past and desire to end Lenza's family.Written for teens, this is a well written, complex tale of danger, teenage angst and revenge, time travel amd Morroccan lore. It would be the perfect book to read with friends on a school break and discuss.An excellent choice for a book club.I did receive a copy in exchange for an unbiased review.

A different kind of ghost story, a different kind of love (not actually) story.It would be a friends with benefits story but Izzy doesn't do friendship.Max is a ghost hunter. What's that? He corrects me. He is a Paranormal Investigator.He hasn't actually seen any ghosts or done any deep investigating, but he believes in ghosts and spirits and wants to start a business.Izzy has a business. As the last living Grant, she inherited the family antiques store and promised her grandmother she would run it. What the translates into is sit behind the counter waiting for anyone to stop in and reading biker romance novels. This makes Izzy so desperate she tries to take her own life.That is how she meets J.D. Rye.The story contains humor, danger and barrier breaking sex (for necessity, trust me.)Izzy, who has no friends and has never had a relationship, has two very different men chasing after her, wanting to be her one and only. Can ghost hunting...oops, paranormal investigating, be what pulls Izzy's life etogether?The characters are well written and even if there is nothing overly endearing about them, the reader grows to care.The ending leads us to believe this is only the beginning.

Daisy McDare and the Deadly Art Affair is a breezy start to a clean cozy mystery series suitable for teems to adult.Daisy becomes a professional interior decorator and gets an assignment from a wealthy old friend.Daisy walks into a household torn apart by tension and selfishness.Eccentric and ill-tempered do not begin to describe Kara's reclusive artist husband.Daisy is shocked to show up for her second day on the job to find the man has been murdered.Daisy McDare has a curious mind. As an interior designer, she has an eye for details.She is not afraid to speak her mind or to ask some dangerous questions.In the second book, she takes a job working for the most hated attorney in town.After he is murdered, Daisy feels a collective sigh of relief from everyone who knew him!This makes the list of potential murderers infinitely longThis second book in the series introduces us to some intriguing secondary characters.In book three, Daisy is designing sets for a movie production.Daisy has great belief in her vision and thinks she has the sets perfect when the egotistical director, Hunter Hayworth, tells her to tear it all part and redo it in his vision, which is totally inapporpriate.It seems Hunter has made an enemy of everyone involved in this movie project.Still it comes as a shock when Daisy arrives the next day to find Hunter has been murdered.A fun, light cozy mystery series with delightful characters and interesting cases.

Daisy McDare has a curious mind. As an interior designer, she has an eye for details.She is not afraid to speak her mind or to ask some dangerous questions.When she takes a job redesigning the offices of the most hated attorney in town, she learns that his own staff can not find one nice thing to say about him ~ even after he is murdered.Daisy feels a collective sigh of relief from everyone who knew him!This makes the list of potential murderers infinitely long.When the police arrest an easy target, Angela Franklin, the night maid/cleaning woman,Daisy's gut tells her the woman is innocent.Of course she must get to work herself to clear Angela's name by finding the true murderer.Typically in cozy mysteries, the detectives do not encourage amateur sleuths tampering with their crimes.Detective Crumble is quite accomodating and appreciates the way Daisy makes deductions.This second book in the series introduces us to some intriguing secondary characters, who I know we will see develope more as the series continues.There is also a hint at future romance.I did receive an ecopy of this book from the author but the opinions are my own.I look forward to reading more and watching this series grow.

Daisy is not afraid of taking on challenging interior design projects.She will tackle residential or commercial. This time she is designing sets for a movie production.Daisy has great belief in her vision and thinks she has the sets perfect when the egotistical director, Hunter Hayworth, tells her to tear it all part and redo it in his vision, which is totally inapporpriate.It seems Hunter has made an enemy of everyone involved in this movie project.Still it comes as a shock when Daisy arrives the next day to find Hunter has been murdered. Her nemesis, Detective Chris Crumple is again assigned to the case.While he admires Daisy's talent for searching out relevant clues, he resentsher solving cases he is responsible for.This time Daisy has "help" from Granny Annie.Once again there is a long list of suspects and endless motives for murder.Daisy comes to her aha moment by figuring out why a certain phrase won't leave her mind.
Such an enchanting book, you will want to share with your exercise friends... both feline and human.The rhyming prose is purrfect and the photos show you the exact poses required.

An interesting cozy with a fresh approach; a mature amateur sleuth teamed up with the teenage daughter of a colleague, reminiscent of a pairing of Miss Marple and an aspiring Nancy Drew.Winter break at Twombly College allows an opportunity for less serious, more flexible classes. Mrs. Crawford is teaching crochet to a group of varied students, from 14 year old Madison and her mother, Amy, wife of a prestigious professor, several college students, including two male soccer players, and an adult accountant, suffering from pneumonia and boredom.Emory Crawford has adult children of her own and is beginning to feel pangs of empty nest syndrome. Fortunately she still has two cats and a golden retriever to mother. Emory also has some intuition or psychic awareness. The esteemed professor Twombly also has some extra sensory abilities, more developed than Emory's. The animals may have some intuitive intelligence, similar to Koko, the cat WHO, or it could just be Emory's desire for them to communicate with her.Strange things are happening on campus. Someone is breaking into rooms and leaving red objects. There is no explanation. It is just weird.One student who receives the mysterious red items is in the crochet class.Things escalate when she is drugged and kidnapped. Emory can not keep her nose out of the investigation.Even worse, the professor's P.A. ends up dead in his home kitchen after a loud argument with Amy. Madison can't sit back and watch her mother take the fall. She knows Amy is not guilty, but the evidence isn't clearing her.This is a quick read. The crochet talk is interesting and the food descriptions are tantalizing. I wish the incredible pot pie recipe was included, but from details given, even I can create it. Something about this author's writing encourages readers to cook.There are a lot of relationship issues discussed, some sleuthing over every dinner, and several mysteries to solve, including an ongoing curiosity about Emory's psychic intuition. Even after the main mysteries are solved, there is enough left unexplained to make readers look forward to another book.This does well as a stand alone, but some references are included to past events. I look forward to seeing the characters grow and develop.I did receive this book in exchange for an unbiased review.

Although this quick escape read is the third book about Goose Pimple Junction, the events contained occur between the first two books and is the response from the author to requests from readers who adore this quirky, small southern community. Readers fell in love with the characters and wanted details about special events in their lives. While you may enjoy it more completely if you have already been introduced to this loveable, zany cast of everyday locals, it can be read and enjoyed as a stand alone humorous read. The book begins with various shorts where you will better understand personalities and be treated to one very elaborate proposal.We are also treated to great phrases of homegrown vernacular such as absogulldarnlutely. Many others come to play as the town seniors try to discuss adult relations in clean and mixed gender phrasing.The zingers continue in "Is it Hot Enough for you." The next stories show more of the spirit and mettle of GPJ townfolk and how it gets passed down.In the long tale, during Apple Day I had to laugh out loud when Lou interrogates her older sister about a mysterious beau, using the classic question, "Who are his people?"If you enjoy small town antics and colorful southern language, you'll want to visit Goose Pimple Junction where the folk may argue amongst themselves but respect their differences and are quick to lend a helping hand... along with an opinion.I own the two other books in this series but was given this book in exchange for my review. If you like TV shows like Gilmore Girls or Hart of Dixie, if you will enjoy a more colorful Mitford, pick up Amy Metz's series.

There are shelves and shelves of self help and transformational books everywhere you turn. I bet you can buy a cheap book at the gas station or carwash with theories on positive thinking and the law of attraction.What you won't find in most of those books are the action steps necessary to improve your life or the reasoning behind why these steps work.Those other books give this genre a "woo-woo" nonsensical reputation.Author Toneka Etienne not only breaks the improvement process into understandable chunks of actionable behaviors, she gives excellent examples from her own life. This book is the result of using the process.She does not promise it will be quick or easy. It will go smoother if you trust and believe, but she even offers advice for those who are not totally convinced. She does an excellent job of covering mindset, attitude and perception.I have read more books on this subject than the average person.I've seen many that just repeat the same words as other best-selling or celebrity authors. This book is not just repetition. Toneka writes with openness and her personal style. You will get the most from this book when you follow along and do the exercises. Take her advice, go inward.I did receive a copy of this book to review. I had no obligation to rate it highly.

All Is BrightThis is a sweet story of second chances and unrecognized attractions.You may not notice at first how sweet with stalkings and attempted murder, but if you have read any of the previous books in this series you will recognize favorite characters.It is Christmas and everyone is looking forward to Elin's wedding. Love is in the air.What would a wedding be if there were not obstacles and complications while trying to make everything perfect?Poor Delilah seems to be taking the brunt of the frustration. To add to her worries, it seems someone is trying to kill her.Colleen Coble writes settings and characters so vividly and with so much appeal you want to crawl into the book and live there.All Is CalmA sweet clean read with a holiday background. Not a typical Christmas read.Lauren has a troubled past. When she feels she has nowhere else to turn she returns to Bluebird Ranch, a place that helped her before.Brendan Waddell's life was pretty much routine, if you can call being a Special Operative routine. He had his life's direction set until an injury made continuing doubtful. He had no dreams of becoming a family man although he envied his friend Rick's ability to settle down.This is a tale of lies and forgotten details. Accidents and evil deeds.Horses and puppies. With a redeeming ending.I am a fan of Colleen Coble. Her books are an enjoyable escape.I received this book in exchange for an honest review.

These are a lot of fun and great for adding to other Halloween or Zombie party treats but I got the exact same box at a local retailer (major national store) for under $3.00 Have not tasted them yet, just using as decor.

I waffled over how to rate this book. There are definitely many five star chapters and moments.I will tell you the major drawbacks for me first, as there are far FEWER of them.Conspiracy theory.I felt it detracted from the storyline and if it was used, the topics should have been more fairy tale related.The disappearance and possible murder of Janie's biological mother. I felt there should have been more clarification.Bert, how we ALL love him, needed a little more backstory explanation. Why did no one ever try to kiss him?I felt it could have been a running joke or occurence that would have added much to the book, but then again, I did not write it. Admit it, you all have had the thought, "if I had written this book, such and such would have happened or not happened."I enjoyed the sarcasm and caustic wit used in the witty dialogue.The vague references, when caught, made me smile, e.g. the stepmother's name of Evangeline Kravits Grimm.While no longer a child, Janie Grimm is still at an age where she has much to learn and her emotions are nowhere close to stable. Having lost her father just six months before and now entering law school, that is quite understandable. Finding a talking frog who claims her father was murdered by a faerie curse and having to explain to her best friend that she was NOT crazy only add to her stress, discomfort and confusion. Starting another new school one is expected to make new friends. Janie's trouble is, she can't quite tell which friends are "real" and who is magic. She has no family to turn to, as her stepmother, the "plastic Barbie doll of Botox," is quite literally evil but a necessary evil until Janie finishes law school.You will find characters from fairy tales you heard in your youth making an appearance (or a disturbance) in the storyline. Janie's life will be on the line regularly unless and until she can figure out what someone wants from her and who she can trust and count on. Oh- and not go crazy and fail law school during her first week. She may be struggling with her classes but she learns some good life lessons: "Just because you haven't heard of it doesn't mean it doesn't exist."After I read the book I thought back on passages that made more sense now and clues I might have not given enough weight to. I enjoy retellings and alternate endings. This book was a fun read that gave me a different viewpoint.I did receive this series in exchange for an honest review. I look forward to seeing where else it will take us.

The Daisy McDare series a light, clean, cozy mystery. I find it suitable for ages teen and up.Each of the murder victims is hated by a number of persons, so motives and suspects are plentiful.Daisy is not the smoothest of interrogators, so her questions often put Daisy into danger herself.I suggest she start wearing steel toes shoes.Often a random statement makes Daisy's lightbulb spark for her to solve the crime.For more information on each of the books, please see my individual reviews.In book 1 - the Deadly Art Affair, Daisy finds herself involved because the widow is an old friend.Daisy McDare, who loves to redecorate her own place, becomes a professional interior decorator, an old friend, Karam who has married wealth, asks Daisy to redo a room in her mansion. Daisy walks into a household torn apart by tension and selfishness.Eccentric and ill-tempered do not begin to describe Kara's reclusive artist husband.Daisy is shocked to show up for her second day on the job to find the man has been murdered.Along with the murder, Daisy's BFF Samantha, who owns the Sweet Tooth bakery, has an objective of her own: to find a boyfriend for Daisy.In book 2 - the Deadly Legal Affair, Daisy can not stand the injustice of the wrong person being accused.When she takes a job redesigning the offices of the most hated attorney in town, she learns that his own staff can not find one nice thing to say about him ~ even after he is murdered.  Daisy feels a collective sigh of relief from everyone who knew him! This makes the list of potential murderers infinitely long. Daisy must clear the accused woman's name by finding the true murderer.In book 3 - the Deadly Directorial Affair, well, we've all heard about what happens on movie sets!This time she is designing sets for a movie production.Daisy has great belief in her vision and thinks she has the sets perfect when the egotistical director, Hunter Hayworth, tells her to tear it all part and redo it in his vision, which is totally inapporpriate.It seems Hunter has made an enemy of everyone involved in this movie project. Still it comes as a shock when Daisy arrives the next day to find Hunter has been murdered.  Once again there is a long list of suspects and endless motives for murder. Her nemesis, Detective Chris Crumple is again assigned to the case.  This time Daisy has "help" from Granny Annie.I was pleased to receive each of these books from the author in exchange for an unbised review.

Being a Wisconsin native, familiar both with Old World Wisconsin and the Laura Ingalls Wilder books and historical sites, I wanted to take my time and enjoy every aspect of this book.Chloe and her sister Kari reminded me of my relationship with my sister, the two of us actually being a Laura and Mary pair. We even have some Norwegian blood.I loved the terms used for fans of the Little House book series including Laura Lookers.I was fascinated by the extra information about the Ingalls' family and being able to say "I knew that!"I did not expect the murders to begin so soon or hit so close to home for Chloe.This cozy was complicated and kept me working on clues.I did not feel that the sisters' romantic and family issues distracted from my enjoyment of the book.Chloe has an education and career in historical facts and preservation.When her elderly neighbor presents her with a quilt from the 1800s allegedly made by the famous Laura Ingalls, Chloe is beside herself. She was fascinated with the Little House books as a child, even preparing a college paper on them to earn her degree. Recently she has been invited to present her findings at a scholarly gathering celebrating Laura Ingalls Wilder. This is a wonderful opportunity to spend time with her sister, from whom she feels she has drifted apart. Also to use her investigative nature to discover any connections this quilt may have to the beloved author.Her investigative nature and undeveloped psychic senses get quite the workout on this trip when people around her turn up dead. She also learns things about her family and loved ones she was not expecting. She may not find exactly what she was looking for on her road trip but at the end I think we are all satisfied. The Ingalls family survived unexpected circumstances and extremely difficult times. Still, they made the best of what they had and what happened to them. Chloe tries to live up to their example, even if her life is still a work in progress.I did receive this book in exchange for an honest review.I will be reading the others in this series.

Deanna Devlin is a newspaper reporter doing puff pieces while desiring to cover more hard hitting news. Her best friend, Sabrina, runs The Perfect Scoop, ice cream parlor. Another dear friend, Andrea, plans to be married soon. Deanna attends the engagement party which is anything but festive.The major disruption is the father of the groom, who is later found murdered. Everyone who argued with him that evening is a suspect with motive. Deanna gets involved to clear her friend's name, but learns Andrea's mother, another suspect, is hiding something.Deanna calls on her septuagenarian grandmother for help solving the case.Besides the murder mystery, there are human interest elements to the story relating to finding an eligible man who is not a desert rat.A common theme and format for the story but it works.I did receive a copy from the author in exchange for an honest review.

Tyler is now a civilian contractor, but his military training and roots are a strong element of his character. Even suffering from PTSD and survivor guilt, he continues to do his best to improve life in Afghanistan. Although his girlfriend, Kelly, is pregnant with his first child, and he loves Kelly's precocious five year old daughter, Bree, as his own, his sense of duty sends him to Afghanistan to prepare his foundation project for winter. The plans are for Tyler to return home to his blossoming family before the holidays.In a war torn country, plans can not be counted on. Neither can every personNot only is the foundation project not working as designed, a massive explosion has Tyler running for his life. He cannot contact anyone to help him and the stress takes a toll on Kelly's high risk pregnancy.Bree is dealing with an identity crisis of her own. All of this as Christmas, which is supposed to be a peaceful, joyous, family time, nears. Kelly begins to doubt Tyler's true motivations.Filled with suspense, emotions, and continual challenges, this is a soul searching story of survival and strength for each of the main characters.I did receive this book in exchange for honest feedback.

This is a sweet although tumultuous love story.Kelly is not looking to complicate her life with a romantic relationship. She had enjoyed a wealthier lifestyle as a stock trader until greed and insider trading landed her in jail. She had wanted children and chose to have a daughter via insemination. Now sweet Bree is four years old and realizes some kids have father's. So Bree decides to ask Santa for a Papa of her own.Tyler Manning had a promising future ahead of him. His sense of duty changed that future when he headed off to Afghanistan for ten years. He might be there still except for injury. Now he is homeless and suffering from PTSD with flashbacks he can't control.When Bree meets Tyler at the mall, she is convinced Santa left him for her. Kelly, however, is not as trusting. She decides to get to know Tyler better when her family all seems to believe he's a great guy and a hero. Against her initial feelings, Kelly starts to acknowledge the spark between them.Tyler earns money and donates it all to charity. After listening to Bree talk about wanting a father, he approaches one charity to propose a different type of project, a sports camp in Afghanistan. They agree if he becomes the face for the project. That means a makeover for Tyler.I really like subway troubadour Sawyer McGee, Tyler's friend. He is loyal with a sense of humor. Nothing in this relationship will flow smoothly.You have to turn every page and roll with each punch to find out what happens. I know you'll want to read the next exciting book after this.NOT your typical holiday romance.I did receive this book in exchange for honest feedback.

This debut mystery novel has so many wonderful elements that keep cozy readers coming back for more.Abigail Mackenzie was a strong, independent police officer working for a micro managing power hungry boss. He would string her along with promises of promotion but after seven years she was still a beat cop. She enjoyed knowing the people in her community. When an injury finally made her choose retirement, Abby stayed in the area, retreating to a neglected farm and her chickens and bees.Early one morning when she is delivering honey in town she discovers the body of a pastry chef who has not been accepted by everyone in town.When the police chief rules it suicide, the handsome, moody yet sexy brother of the chef hires Abby to look into the death.Abby agrees that there is more to the death. As she investigates there are plenty of people who wish she would mind her own business. The book is filled with characters we will appreciate spending time with in future books. The mechanics of the murder itself could have been more precise. I liked that Abby fought her attraction to her client for as long as she could and that someone else seems to be interested in her, complicating things.At the beginning of each chapter are tips and advice, with recipes included to tempt us. I did receive the book in exchange for an honest review.

WARNING: once you begin, you will be hooked and lose sleep.You will not want to do anything else until you know what happens next.From America, a bad break up, and basically a bribe, send Elena off to Scotland to heal her wounds. She has "inherited" a farm. There she meets Faelin, a man with dark secrets of his own and many suspicions about the new landowner. Thus begins this steamy erotic series which is a combination of paranormal, magical, shifter time travel romance and magical, cursed, fantasy thriller.There are innumerable elements and levels to the plot twists which flow well into each other.Well developed charters, both primary and secondary. This first novel is a race between survival and breaking a moon-tied curse.You will be glad to be able to jump directly into the second book. This time rushing from Scotland to New Orleans, U.S. to compare Alysone's story with his own, and memories of a different time, Dr.Gabhran MacLachlan has no idea what will be in store for him. His druid past comes up against New Orleans witchcraft, voodoo, and the dark spirit we all feel as we are engrossed in the story.Detective Miranda Close grew up with New Orleans voodoo culture and has psychic powers of her own. Something about Dr. Gab, her landlord, triggers her senses. Good at her job, Randi also shows vulnerability.In the third selection, it is not just country hopping. It is real forward time travel to save the Druids. Again the characters are well developed and the plot threads flow together extremely well. The story is complex, dangerous. And exciting.By book four this series turns into all out fantasy adventure.It continues to be emotional, complex and thrilling. You can't stop reading until the final page. At times it is hard to tell who is good or evil.A great ending...or is it?

This is an excellent book for mature middle school age and high school students.It comes across religious in tone but not preachy. It covers extremely important issues about self esteem, trust, and sense of belonging.Mayah Lewis is fourteen years old. In her school system that means a new school and once again being low in status. Usually that affects any person's confidence. Recently Mayah also discovered facts about her adoption that made her question her whole life. She withdrew from her friends and even moved out of her adoptive parents home. Her story is about identity and support.A new student begins school with more going against her than just not knowing anyone. Despite that, Celeste Daniels is a positive force to be reckoned with. Her energy affects all she comes in contact with.The popular cheerleader, Kitty, seems to have it all together. Looks, money, cool friends, but she may have more secrets than anyone else. Mayah is shocked and suspicious when Kitty acts friendly.The story moved along steadily but a bit slowly for me at the beginning.I appreciated the important values and messages included in the book.I cared about the characters and wanted them to figure out how to relate and help each other. There are some very tense and sad moments. It would be a good book to discuss with younger readers and ask if they know anyone struggling with similar thoughts and problems.There are several excellent passages I had to highlight in my eBook.If you read an e-dition I believe you can see them.Passages about life being made up of different aspects, not all one thing, and life not waiting for ideal circumstances and acceptance by others.I was provided with an advance copy of this book in exchange for an honest review. It would make a tremendous addition to a church library or youth group reading.

Marley had nothing Toby couldn't top.Charmaine and Chris are a loving couple who had experience with dogs.Their beloved Dooks had passed away and time had also passed. The time was right to fill the void in their lives. Deciding to look for a dog needing a better life, they perused the online rescue listings.Have you ever done that and fallen in love with a photo? The expression on a face or something in an animal's eyes? It seemed to be love at first sight with Char and Toby's photo.Perhaps they did not ask the right questions or get as much information as they should have, but once the deal was sealed, Toby and his eccentricities were now part of the family. You do not give up on family.Chris does think about it from time to time, but time diffuses the anger and frustration of the moment.Fortunately they recruit the advice and help from an accomplished and patient animal behaviorist. It is not a quick fix or a magical cure.It is a fresh start for Toby and allows him to use his natural talents.Not having Toby's destructive behaviors happening to us, as a reader we can chuckle about them. It takes very special people to be patient and understanding as their home is destroyed.Watching Toby's world change is heartwarming and gives me hope.Being a memoir, I was prepared to cry at the end. His final hours are treated with dignity and love. I am happy to report the book does not end on that sad note. I hope someday I get to meet this dynamic threesome.I was honored to receive this book in exchange for an unbiased review.It now sits on my favorites shelf.

This little camo toiletry bag - DALIX Camouflage Hanging Travel Toiletry Kit Accessories Bagfrom DALIX  is a good product and addresses my requirements for my vacation trips. It is well-designed bag for storing Toiletry items for a trip .It's bigger than the usual once and can store a lot more personal items. Because it has multiple compartments, you can separate items to keep them dry and prevents accidents as its also waterproof.It has a small ring at the back for hanging the bag in the bathroom hook.Besides the large main compartment, there is also an additional zippered front compartment for holding small items which i would use for my hair clips or accessories;).The material is god and well stitched.Overall i am very impressed by the product except that i have one concern with the elastic band in th einner compartment there may be a room for improvement on this .Rest am happy and have been using this for my trips already.Received this for free in exchange for my unbiased reviews.

I found that these bunion pads slipped on my toes easily, and they are made of extremely soft and flexible material allowing them to fit different sized feet. I had no problems wearing these bunion pads with socks, I simply put the bunion pads on, and then put my socks on, and then put on my shoes.  I also appreciate the way these bunion pads are designed. They are soft against the skin, they do not rub, they do not move under my socks, and they do not have any kind of adhesive. Another thing that I liked is that each bunion protector will go on either foot, so there is no left or right, just position in the right position, and you are ready to go.  It does take some time to get used to, but I find it reasonably comfortable to have them on all through the day. You do need shoes that have a little bit of room to wear them in, get used to the feel of it, and eventually you wont notice the difference. I will certainlycontinue to wear these pads as long as they seem to be helping. I also found that these bunion pads do not absorb odor, and that they were easy to clean in the sink with mild soap and water to dry naturally, and that they do not retain the foot odor once you wash them. Its a well made product and seems durable. I would certainly recommend it.Received for discount/free price to provide my unbiased reviews.

I came across this product when I was looking for some solution to take care of my problem of big toes beginning to angle slowly. I have been pleasantly surprised to see that these spacers help keep my toe from being pushed inward without any pain.  They provide just enough material to push the big toes to the right and straighten them a bit. The super soft gel material that does not rub or feel uncomfortable at all easily stays in place. It seems a bit wide and awkward, so it does take some time to get used to, but I find it reasonably comfortable to have on all through the day. You do need shoes that have a little bit of room to wear them in, get used to the feel of it, and eventually you wont notice the difference. I will certainly continue to wear it as I dont want to have surgery. The pack comes with 2 deluxe spacers, and they are easily cleaned with a mild soap and water and dry naturally. Its a well made product and I would certainly recommend it.received sample for discount to test and provide my unbiased reviews.

I received this SET of 3 CUTTING BOARDS by Bellissima Kitchen- Large is 13.75 by 8.75 inches. Medium is 11.4 inches by 7 inches and  Small is 10 inches by 6.3 inches two weeks back and have been using them since then, Each is 3/8 of an inch thick, making them very easy to manoeuvre and store. I cook for 3 everyday and am always in need of cutting boards!Apart from this i also have frequent diner parties at home and these are handy. I find the sizes of the cutting board little different from the once i have .The small one is really small and perfect to use when i need to cut something really small or less in quantity.The boards are  dishwasher safe,solid  which make it  great to chop on,good grooves to catch all those liquids, rubbery parts to grip the counter well which prevents it from slipping  and the reasonable price!Only concern i have  narrow board shape, I would prefer it to be more wider specially the medium and large once.I received this product for free in exchange of my unbiased reviews.
The description is accurate.used it for my humidifier and it fit perfect!

Erayco Wine Stopper Set - Red Wine Aerating Pourer Decanter Spout, Vacuum Pump Preserver Bottle Stopper and Foil Cutter Bar Accessory is a amazing set of accessories for wine lovers like me.The package contains Wine Bottle Stopper,Foil Cutter , Wine Pourer  and Black Gift Box. Have been waiting to get such a back back for my 5k runs and cycling trips to keep myself always hydrated .This  Running and Cycling Backpack Aerolife with Lifetime Guarantee Also Great As a Bike Hydration Backpack and or for Any Other Sports - Waterproof with 1.5 Liter TPU & Free Bladder is of great quality and wish i had this earlier.It can be easily used and is fully adjustable for every adventure; with shoulder and side straps to fit your body perfectly.The bag is lighter than i expected and dont feel it at all  when i use it.The straps have a great cushioning.The bag is waterproof  which is amazing to use during obstacles races.The bag has some velcro compartments, some zippered, some magnetic.Another impressive feature is the LIFETIME WARRANTY.Sample product for impartial review

0:45 Mins I have been looking for a Ottoman that could store some toys that my son could use in the family room.I was looking for a light weight ottaman with storage and at the same time something that can be used as a stoll during parties .Initially i had my own doubts about the Songmics 15" Upholstered Storage Ottoman Cube Folding Footrest Coffee Table Faux Leather Brown  as it is a collapsible piece hence was wondering if it would be study enough.  The reasons i love this  -It is nice because it is attractive and serves it purpose as an ottoman.  -its very  functional for storage for an toys, cushions, extra blanket.  -Since Its collapsible it is great that it folds up too if you want to get it out of the way. can also be carried easily.  -I also like that it is the faux leather, which is much easier to clean than fabric.  -Can be used to sit on as its sturdy to take my weight easily and with comfort. I am 5.3' and weight 120 lb.  - its study and strong and holds up nicely.  -Light weight which is amazing for my son to use for his toys.  -The brown color matched with my furniture set  -Well designed and give a stylish look to my family room.I find  this Ottoman perfect for my need.I measured it again when I set it up because I was surprised at it's size. I just may order the 15" as well as it will fit better into the space I am using it in.Its an amazing piece and would totally recommend it.Sample provided by seller to test and provide my unbiased reviews.

I have frizzy long hair which looks really shabby if they aren't straightened out. The  Grace Professional Hair ceramic flat iron is ideal for transforming my frizzy hair into perfectly straight, neat look. The straightener came in a box with 4 salon clips which are so helpful while straightening hair.The reason i would want to recommend this Grace Professional Hair ceramic flat iron1.  It is very easy to use as the irons to glide through hair smoothly2.It has a ergonomic design for easy grip and is of high quality.3. the four salon clips are great .4.The advanced ceramic heater technology disperses heat evenly for safe styling, as well as allowing the hair to be smoothed more quickly.5.Ceramic plates will seal the cuticles in hair to lock in moisture and leave hair smooth, shiny and frizz-free, with minimal damage.6.The plates help to preserve natural oils and seal the hair cuticle for improved moisture retention.7.The heat is perfect for my hair and the temperature can be controlled.the heating up is within seconds so no more waiting for the iron to heat.The straightening iron has dual voltage (110-240V) and an on/off switch.8.Its safe as  the sleep mode automatically switches it off if not used for 60 minutes.9 it is easy to carry when traveling.I would definitely  recommend this product to my family and friends.overall am happy to have a great style every week at work.Sample received from seller to evaluate and provide my unbiased feedback.

I am very excited to receive the Diamond Dew - Metal Wall Art by Fab Habitat.It is square size 18" x 18" x 1" .The  fabulous Metal wall  Wall Art is a beautiful way to add classic style to your home. Made of light Metal alloy  with each metal, swirving stem topped with a shining crystal accent, making this wall art shine and glisten as it catches the light. Its imposing size and design will make it the centerpiece of the room, and its open, airy design allows the wall to show through. Use one for a beautiful showpiece, or a pair for a truly outstanding look.The degisn is layered stalks cross-sect one another to invoke layers of intrigue. The wall art has a contemporary unique design style which stands out in the wall giving the room a classy look.The package was very well packed and shipped promptly.I was provided a sample for review and  provide my unbiased reviews.

My husband and i have recently started playing tennis few times a week .Since we are beginners i was looking for a racket that's not very expensive but at the same time a good one. Its a challenge to find  one with will cover both the requirements  and i found both of these in this racket. This racket is a great starter racket for the total beginner . I bought it a few weeks back  on Amazon for my husband to play and learn with minimal investment. We use this four times a week and my husband finds this racket a great one to play with.The oversize head size provides you with a larger sweet spot for a more forgiving racket which is  perfect as it is very encouraging for a beginners like us.The racket weighs in at 11.5oz strung (326g). Unstrung that would be around 10.9oz (309g) so it may be a bit heavier but works fine with him as a beginner. Steam those hard boiled eggs and they will peel easily!  Start with eggs at room temp.  Place in this unit atop a pot of rolling boiling water for 20 minutes.  Cover.  After 20 mins, remove top basket and submerse in tepid (room temp) water to cool the eggs enough to handle.  Put cooked eggs in bowl or fill up the Styrofoam egg carrier and refrigerate.  Bob's your uncle!  Fewer cracked eggs too!  Handles 8 LARGE eggs at a time.  Great for any type of steamed veggies.

As a newbie member of the 'unplugged' generation, I purchased this with the sole purpose of watching HBO NOW on my plasma 1080p TV with digital surround sound instead of just on my PC. Which is a GOOD THING.  Why make monster boxes to take up space in our entertainment centers?  Simple hook up, took maybe 2 minutes to plug in and go.  Can handle wireless or hard-wired Internet.  Has HDMI jack and additionally has optical audio output for high-end sound amps.

Considering what ignoring your teeth will cost you, a "sonic" toothbrush (which removes plaque up to 2x better than a 'regular' toothbrush) is worth every dime.  Remember to change heads (they have a blue wear-indicator... when you can no longer see the blue bristles on the brush, it's time to swap out for a new brush head).Combine this 2x a day with regular flossing- and chances are you will avoid severe dental problems.  I get my teeth cleaned 3x a year for that reason... like a car, if you take car of your teeth, you can avoid serious and painful visits to the dentist or oral surgeon.

I grew up in the 60's and was in a garage band.  Anyone who ever played in a pickup band will love this movie for the memories it evokes, and even if you didn't, you will enjoy the music and the filmmaking, both of which are STELLAR.  David Chase (of "The Sopranos") makes his directorial debut here, and the late James Gandolfini is effective as a disapproving father of a rocker who is convinced that he can 'make it big' in music.Riveting and memorable...a comfortable salute to the golden age of rock and roll - worth renting or buying.  I purchased it Blu-Ray, worth every penny.

Heavy-duty professional headset for real airplanes.  Noise-cancelling works like a dream in the noisiest of GA aircraft e.g. Cessna 172, 182, etc.  Bluetooth means you can phone the ground on your smartphone AND hear them!  Crazy expensive, but very high quality.  Boom microphone and down-cable can be switched from left ear (default) to right ear by unscrewing 2 phillips screws.  The unit 'plugs in' to the earpiece, simple to swap sides.  Bose support is for five years and it's 5 star support Monday through Friday.  The quality that RW pilots expect and deserve.  Also can work with a PC (for flight sim enthusiasts) with a third party USB to GA converter available from a company in Nova Scotia (about 79 USD street plus ship).  The "side tone" feature works well - you can clearly hear yourself.  The noise-cancelling earphones and mic are both head and shoulders above any other headset I've ever tried.  Given the fact that not missing a critical call to or from ATC could save your life - this is a "must buy" for anyone flying real aircraft.  Some have said the noise cancelling is 'too good' meaning it kills all the racket from the engine - so if the engine is mis-firing or other sounds are present indicating problems in the plane, you might not hear them.  To that I say - I'll take that over the annoying DIN of a roaring aircraft engine 4 feet away from me in a small GA aircraft.
If you use a lot of mice in your PC setup, this extra big mousing surface is a wonderful replacement for the many odd mouse pads you might currently use.
