I almost hope that there might be a sequel down the road because I feel like the story of this family isn't quite done yet. Maybe even a story from Frank's perspective. I sincerely hope that Sophie writes more YA novels, in addition to her adult ones because I would definitely read them.

These are really pretty earrings. For me, they are the perfect size. I really dislike huge earrings that are heavier and these earrings are really light and comfortable to wear. My ears also tend to sensitive where I can't wear lower quality earrings because they tend to irritate my ears. But these haven't bugged my ears at all.I really like the combination of the silver along with the blue and white diamond pieces. The blue and white diamonds are very pretty and should go with a variety of outfit color combinations.And while these are not the most expensive earrings, I think that they could go with either casual or dressed up outfits.I'm happy with these earrings and I think you will be too.

This is an extremely informative guide for anyone looking at information on multitudes of different careers. I definitely wished something like this was available when I was a teenager taking career classes in high school and not having any idea on what I wanted to do.In the introduction, it asks you to think about things like: What interests do you have, the subjects that you are good at, what are your personal qualities, etc. It then lists just about every career that you can think of. Obviously not every single career option is mentioned. But it should help anyone who knows what field they want to go into. The careers are color-coded for easier access. For example, any career in Health and Medicine is in the Pink section of the book. For each career, the pages list things like: Job description, Expected Salary, Necessary Skills, Related Careers.One thing that I wish the book had was maybe some website links to explore careers further online or even links to Career Path quizzes, if those still exist. But overall, I think this is a great book for pre-teens, teens, and even adults who are looking for information on careers they might want.

I've read a few of Debbie Macomber's Christmas books but I haven't really read much of her non-Christmas books. I really enjoyed reading "Last One Home".There are lots of other reviews that recount the plot so I won't do another re-hash of the story. But Cassie is one awesome book heroine. I found her story to be completely inspirational. I liked that she was able to go through hardships like an abusive husband, unwelcoming sisters, and being poor and be able to come out the way she did. Even though this book was fiction, I would like to think that it would give hope to any woman that may be going through some of the things that Cassie had to go through. There is a romance but it's definitely not the cliche, roll your eyes type of romance novel. I really liked the romance in "Last One Home".I really enjoyed this book and I would say it would be a must read for Debbie Macomber fans.

"Thirteen Chairs" is a quick, fun, and slightly spooky book. I had a lot of fun reading this book and enjoyed the slight chills that I got reading it.Jack is a curious boy. He enters this dark house where only one room is lit by 12 candles and inhabited by 12 people at a table. His candle becomes the 13th candle and then the storytelling begins. One by one, each person tells a story that is very much spooky, and even sinister in tone. After each person is done, they blow their candle out and it becomes the next turn. What will Jack discover at the end of the night? You'll have to read the book to find out.The thirteen stories in this book are all pretty great. "Let Me Sleep", "The Girl in the Red Coat", and "Unputdownable" were probably my favorite stories. I'm not really the age the audience is going for but this book really reminded me of the R.L. Stine and other ghost story books that I used to read when I was younger.This would be a great book for reading around a campfire, during a sleepover, or during "a dark and stormy night".

I've heard a lot about Sarah J. Maas around the YA community, so I decided that "A Court of Thorns and Roses" would be my first book by her. This is a fantasy book and while I've only read a few books in the high fantasy genre but I do think that even a newbie to the genre, like me, will enjoy this book.The story is really well done. Like others have pointed it out, it's a twist on the Beauty and the Beast story. Sarah J. Maas did a really great job on this. Her writing is really beautiful and draws a reader in.  Feyre is the main character and I really liked her. She's a strong character and really gets the reader to root for her. Tamlin is the male in this book and I guarantee that every reader will be in love with him at the end of the book. The love story is so good. The world that "A Court of Thorns and Roses" is set is built is so unbelievably good. Fantastic world building by Sarah J. Maas.If you've read any of Sarah's other books, you're going to like this one. Fans of high fantasy novels will really like this one too. Highly recommended!

This is a great toaster! I really love the stainless steel look. It doesn't matter what your kitchen looks like, this will look great in any kitchen design.This toaster is really easy to use. For the first use, the directions recommend that you set the dial to the level 4 but after that, you can turn it to whatever is your toasted preference. The levels go from 1 to 7. I actually think level is pretty good for getting done but not black toast. There are buttons for when you either put a bagel or frozen food (like waffles or toasted pastries). There is also a 'cancel' button just in case you need your food out immediately. There is a crumb catcher down in the bottom of the toaster, don't forget to empty that!!I'm really happy with this toaster and I would definitely recommended this Black & Decker one

This is my first Dyson and I absolutely love it. Let me tell you, the price might be a little scary but this Dyson vacuum is totally worthy of all the hype that Dyson products receive.When you open the package, the vacuum will need to be put together. But it's super easy and should take you no more than 10 minutes. The directions are in pictures but I didn't find it hard to understand at all. First I used the Dyson to vacuum out a winters worth of salt and other junk in my car. I used one of the brush attachments and it was so easy to clean. It was easy to get into the corners and hard to reach parts of the car. Then I used the Dyson to vacuum the house and was amazed on what I was able to pick up even though I had vacuumed the week before.This is really easy to carry around. I was able to vacuum the stairs without having to lug around a heavy thing like I used to. To empty the canister is super easy. Just a click of a button to detach it, another click of a button to empty the canister over a trash, and then it's a cinch to click it back into place. So easy.I'm really happy with this Dyson. I'm not really into vacuuming (it's one of my least favorite chores) but with this Dyson, it makes vacuuming a lot easier and maybe a little more fun. Highly recommended!

It's always been a dream of mine to visit Paris and with this guide, if I do go, sight-seeing will be so easy. Lonely Planet has some of the best books on travel and this Paris version is no exception. The pocket size is perfect so you can either put it in your pocket or a purse. It's small size is discreet too, so you won't end up looking really touristy if you have it out on the street.For such a small book, it has a ton of information. It covers the things that all visitors do-like visit places like the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame etc. but it also tries to cover places that where more Parisians go instead of tourists. I like this book because it presents little tidbits of history along with other information in talking about certain places. It also has lists like "Best Drinking", "Best for Kids", "Best History", so the lists will help if you're not sure where to go. There is lots more information than just that but it would take forever to go over it all.Overall, this is an awesome guide and I would definitely recommend it if you are considering a trip to Paris.
Great build.  I gave this to my 5 year old nephew who had a blast putting it together for a few hours.. now it sits on his shelf as a source of pride and accomplishment.

Wheels don't really spin. As you can imagine it's not ergonomic to write with (I didn't take any stars off for this) the ink is ok, the pen retraction mechanism works well.  The colors are rather disappointing.I bought these for a giveaway at my demo booth.  People seemed to be attracted to them but then again people are attracted to free stuff.  The biggest and the most annoying thing about these pens are the giant manufacturer sticker on the bottom off each car. It's in paper and it doesn't peel off easily!

Over all impression of this platform?  Jack of some trades, master of none... some of its faults are from Pioneer, some from physical shortcomings of using touch while driving, some from the implementation of AppRadio, some from CarPlay, some from Android's shortcomings and in general lack of focus from one entity that should have made its ecosystem work together cohesively.I am chopping my review into  4 sections:1. Using touch screen and multitouch while driving:The Pioneer GUI is not optimized for driving.  Its touch screen buttons are small in comparison and require driver focus for proper operation.  Unlike physical buttons, the small buttons (i.e. volume up/down/ mode) are way too small for driving purposes.  Smallest bumps in the road will make your fingers miss its intended target. I often find that I need to anchor my hand with my other fingers on the dash before completing routine tasks like raising or lowering the volume.2. Pioneer GUI.This unit's GUI is designed by an amateur who is not concerned about driver safety.  The screen is generally cluttered with graphical nonsense at the expense of using small fonts to display important information you need at a glance!  Sometimes there is this vast field of emptiness being underutilized at the expense of functionality! For instance, when you're in AM/FM mode and the screen shows 6 preset station buttons that are about the size of dime with the rest of the screen being wasted on nothing!  The tune buttons are also hysterically small but perhaps the biggest issues are with the way the information is displayed on the screen... For the life of me, I can't fathom why with the big screen, there is such a wide use of small fonts while a big portion of the screen remains unused!While you're not moving this is not an issue, but how about making these buttons bigger for operations while driving... the GUI is filled with an incomplete approach to Graphical user interface.  As a Programmer and a tech heavy person, this unit lacks a fundamental approach to user interface.There are little bugs all over the place:  For instance, if you want to mute this device, you have to press the volume buttons first, then you have to look below the screen to see a small mute button which already has an X on it.  (it should get the x after you press it not before or at least change colors)  You'll never really quite know if the device is muted by just looking at the screen and worse, you can't just un-mute it if you simply pressed the volume up/down buttons automatically!  It stays muted until you press the mute button again a second time!  The system is completely inundated with poor user interaction, once you factor in that most of what you need to do requires your attention while driving, your blood pressure and heart rate goes up!3. CarPlayApple's CarPlay has promise but its frustrating on its own accord.  There are apps that I don't use.. but I can't remove/reorder these apps and I must have these apps on my screen even if I will never use them.  I can't add my own apps, Apple's Maps continues to play catch up to other platforms.  It's GUI is also subject to inconsistencies. For instance, I could be listening to a playlist in iTunes; you might think it would default to the playlist or the last place I was in iTunes when I left the car, but instead it defaults to iTunes Radio proudly emphasizing "network not available" because I am not an iTunes Radio subscriber!  Now I ask you, shouldn't Apple be smart enough to eliminate this option from my choices while I am in the car?  So in short, while CarPlay is probably one of the best Car OSes out there, it's simply like asking who is the most kind mass murderer in history!  And yes while you can stomach Siri's refusal to work when you need it most while you are not on the road, there is a whole new level of frustration dealing with siri while youre on the road.... oh and you lose "hey siri" so in order for you to use your phone handsfree, first you have to use your hands to press the home button!4. Android:If you are going to buy this for your Android phone and you are going to use it with MirrorPlay... let me just tell you to drop any ambitions of using this with an Android phone using any Android feature unless you're simply going to use the bluetooth basics to answer incoming calls or making outgoing calls....In conclusion: the most frustrating part of this is that it could be so much more but no one has really taken the time to look at this system holistically, it's simply a hodgepodge of functions thrown together from different manufacturers that are barely competent enough to deliver on some of their promises.  Frustration is considered a virtue here!(I purchased my unit at PC Richards because they install for free)

Pros:  Extremely easy to install on a 2010 Honda CRVCons:  Leaves streaks behind.  (I made sure the rear window was cleaned prior to installation)I went to an auto parts store and bought another one from a different manufacturer (same price) ... no streaks.I am surprised because Bosch generally makes really good wipers!

I got this for my car, if I feel drowsy in the car, I start squeezing these things!  It works to keep me awake and Alert!Pros:Great design, ergonomic, the rubber grips make it comfortable, the tension adjuster actually works. fits several different hand sizes (I am Medium)Cons:Quality, Quality, Quality.. the spring makes a clanking noise like it's about to fly out of the housing.  I don't expect this to last that long...I am sort of concerned because I don't want this to go flying off while I am driving!

I can't tell if the pictures are actually representative of the propellers I received. the ones I received seem to have less curves in the props.  The little cone that covers the tip of the propellers didn't fit either.  However you should know that the what I received was high quality plastic, straight, balanced and functional.  They just don't appear to be an efficient design for generating trust.Ships from China, could take  a month for you to get it! It's also rigid plastic so I don't know how well they weather crashes.

The good:1. Unlike my previous self retracting cables, this comes with a nice wide tangle free cable which makes the retraction process much less of a production.2. It blends with my car's interior well3. High quality cable4. Good retraction mechanism. (Feels like it should last a while)The Bad.1. You will lose the iPhone tip... it's a matter of time!  the tip should have been connected to the cable via a dongle so it won't get misplaced.The Ugly1. Although the tip snaps securely to the lightening adapter, the lightening adapter seems to come loose from the device end rather easily.2. The retraction process is not precise.3. It's hard reaching the desired cable length with 1 attempt.4. This thing comes with 4 separable parts. You will lose most of them... guaranteed!As long as you resign yourself that this thing is a great micro USB cable then this is a 5 star product....otherwise it's a 3 star product.  I bought this thinking that I will reduce the clutter in my glove compartment.  I now realize that having so many little parts makes this a liability.  I will be buying a dedicated retractable Lightening cable  alongside this one.

It takes serious force to open this case.  And when you close it, it feels like it is going to snap your fingers off... (it doesn't, but it definitely closes with force and serious speed.. making a loud bang)The construction is OK, you should know that most of this is a glue and laminate production (inevitably will yield a short life)  If I get 3 years out of it, I will consider it a success.  The brown is also lighter than what I expected but it's still a nice color. it's also bigger than my expectations.

Very few people here could actually tell you if the device's radar capability is any good as compared to other devices.  I am not versed enough in all detectors out there to know where this matches up too!  Unless you actually set up a real life testing criteria where you try several detectors against various radar traps, no one can tell you if the premium you're paying for this is actually worth the claim the manufacturer makes.I purchased this 7 months ago. The lighter power adapter shorted about 2 months ago. It actually disabled my car. The battery light came on and I had to pull in to a station, remove the extremely hot adapter from the cigaret lighter, get a jump start to my car and go on my way.  I haven't called Escort to see how well they support their product. As  Waze (phone app)  is proving pretty sufficient for my needs.This product's industrial design is sorely lacking.  If you like the minimalist look, this device fails at basic design.  It doesn't complement the interior of my car at all.  I don't know why units like these can't just be small little black boxes?  Why does this thing have to look like a 1970's movie director's idea of a spaceship? As far as ergonomics go;  forget about using the control buttons without actually removing the device from the suction cup!The GPS is basic.  In that it doesn't recognize where you are,  It simply feeds the GPS coordinates to a database and if there is a match for a camera, it will alert you.  It doesn't take in to count where you were to know if the Camera is on your path or above you in an overpass.  Often it can't distinguish between the service road or the highway, so you get a lot of false camera alerts all the time.I find Apps like Waze do a far more effective job at registering police units on the road.  I was also quiet concerned while this unit was working, there were many-many instances where I passed by police cars and were not alerted at all... as if they didn't have their radar guns aimed at me!  Now I don't know if they were not tracking me by radar or the detector failed!The suction cup mount is worthless!  For ~$500 this thing should have a quality mount!I'll be calling Escort to repair this device.  Hopefully they won't make the experience hell!

I am 5' 10" the handle doesn't extend enough to accommodate my height. It will be even worse if you are taller.  Because the handle does not extend as long as ideal, back of your foot constantly bumps in to case while walking.The wheels have a horrid mount,  for units like these, look for a wheel base that is as close to the edge of the case as possible,  the physics make it very difficult to tilt over.  this one tilts easily.This is also a LOUD case but when you walk with it in hallways, the sound amplifies a great deal disrupting what people do.The construction is acceptable, the locks are virtually useless (can be broken in to easily) It looks tougher than it is.

I own each tool here, I am going to review this in 3 parts, first I will give my feelings about this bundle, then I will give my feelings about the company and the tools.This Bundle:I am currently looking at the Amazon special for $169 (75% off). At first glance this price is tremendously attractive, however when you purchase these tools separately, they do come with more accessories and tool bits, therefore this is probably not as great of a deal as it appears to be. I think the person who should buy this bundle should be the person who is set to buy the most expensive tool in this bundle (the Saw max), otherwise skip it and move on and buy the tool you need individually. the soft carry case is also useless for this products category. As you know, these tools become useful with attachments and specialized bits. Can you imagine having to store these tiny bits for three different tools in one case? Neither can I! Purchasing these separately gives you the hard-cover-case and each is thoughtfully designed to store bits appropriate for the tool in its own compartment. So in conclusion, there are less attachments and tool bits and there is little value for the carry case. Therefore this makes the price in my opinion as not attractive but deceptive. I am giving this price bundle a 2 out of 5 stars but if you need the SawMax then bump the rating to 3 out of 5 stars (but only if you don't need to buy the non-included bits and pieces)Dremel the Company:Look, every company has to make money to survive, Dremel is no exception so what I am saying below is not a mark against Dremel. You just need to be comfortable with what you get. The company's business is similar to the inkjet printer model where you buy a printer (think these tools) at a reasonable cost but pay dearly for ink (think tool bits). Since most if not all of these tools have non-standardized tool bits, then you're not going to enjoy the benefit of having other manufacturers compete for your tool-bit dollar.The Tools:these tools excel at niche projects, they are not for everything or everyone. they are surprisingly versatile and effective for certain projects. In my opinion people who cut these tools down did not correctly assess these tools for the applied projects and simply made uninformed decision in purchasing these tools.Most of these these tools are great for one-offs.. for example, you can probably use the SawMax's masonry bit to cut a kitchen-flooring tile or replace a broken tile in the bathroom...but if you're gonna cut enough titles to do two bathrooms a kitchen and then need to cut some granite, then don't bother with this tool for tiling purposes... The basic formula for these tools are applications where finesse is more important than brute force, they're simply not continuous-use tools (as in don't go cutting 20 2x4s in one pass) maybe cut 2 or 3, rev-down your saw for a bit and then move on to the next batch...SawMax:If you're doing engineered wood flooring, I highly recommend the SawMax as it traces alongside the wall perfectly and cuts pieces to match the wall's curvature, corners and (most importantly) imperfections without any measurements whatsoever. This is the only single use niche reason I find for the Sawmax to exist on its own and it's a big one in my opinion. Otherwise there are more robust tools out there. (FYI, this is a horrible tool for cutting 2x4s even with the special attachment)... this tool also comes in handy for cutting plywood, counter tops or in general where you would need to use a jig saw in stright lines (think cutting out sink blueprints on laminate counter-tops). What I don't like about it is the smell of a burning electric motor/plastic when it's revving for too long.. especially when you're cutting a few porcelain tiles or granite.... (do buy the vacuum cleaner attachment, it works great....now this is a $4 piece of rubber that you buy for around $15 and it's the only one that fits your tool!.. see what I mean? That's how Dremel makes money)Multi-Max:I think this is probably the least likely case for buying this bundle. If this is what you need, move on to another manufacturer, something more robust and less costly tool bits. I found myself buying another tool after this one and now my multi-max hardly ever gets used. I just think there are better solutions out there, not that this tool is useless.3000-rotary tool.Chances are you already have this tool, if not then buy this tool regardless, it is by far one of the most versatile tools in my arsenal. At around $65 this individual bundle (Dremel 3000-1/24 1 Attachment/24 Accessories Rotary Tool) gives you a much better deal than what you see with this bundle.I hope you found this review useful, generally speaking; "marketing" tool bundles like this is rarely as good as a price they make it out to be especially if the business is centered around selling you tool bits.Special Message for Dremel Sales Employees:If you're reading this, in future, please consider bundling your existing kits instead of this kind of bundle.  Your engineers already spent a lot of time thinking about the tool and its uses and create these great cases and include the most useful attachments and bits upfront.  This little advantage was not forwarded to this bundle making its value sub-par. You're a quality name because you sell solutions to problems.  the only thing this bundle solves is your problem at the bank ! :-)

Greetings,I am going to use Apple's ear-buds as a point of reference, the score is as compared to Apple's.I am breaking down my rating in to the following subcategories:* Design: 3 stars (the cable is uber-white, the speakers are tiny and unobtrusive)* Construction: 1 star, you have to turn the earbuds jack in the socket and fish around for a sweet spot to be able to get clear sound.* Sound Quality: 2 stars (sound is flat, terrible is low, Bass is dull and the range is just ordinary)* Quality: 2 stars: unfortunately the quality of the cable is poor and it is prone to getting tangled.* Noise cancelling: 4 stars (I can't believe that at $12-$13 this actually worked)* Fit: 3 stars (this is subjective, but it does come with 3 sets of silicon-cones to fit your ear)I bought these to use on the treadmill at my Gym, when I connect these to my shuffle, they work as intended, but it seems connecting them to something with a little more power produces crackling and sporadic electric shock!  Not sure if that's because I was sweating or the buds themselves, in either case I do not recommend these for anything beyond an MP3 player use.I hope this helped you make a decision, unfortunately the hassle of returning these makes the purchase final for me.  I would not buy these again.  I am looking for something I can run with and I would like to be able to forgive myself for leaving them behind in the gym, so if you know of a pair that would fit my requirement, please chime in with your advice...I know there are some really great ones at $70-$100 but I couldn't forgive myself for leaving them behind in the gym!Thanks

The quality of this tool is abysmal. The only thing going for it is the concept.  It is a nice thought but implemented horridly. The tool's storage compartment is worthless, some bits fit the bit-corral in the handle, some fall out and some are in there so tight that you need pliers to pull them out (or reinsert them back in).  The cocking action to raise the corral out of the handle is wobbly and feels like it will break....I do think this is a re-branded Stanley tool, they're just trying to get a premium for the Dewalt name.  Stanley Tools has a bad habit of ruining the reputation of the companies they takeover by producing cheap Chinese made gear and passing it under the pedigree of marquee brands... what a shame!

This product is useable, the sound quality is OK, certainly well worth the price at $12.  However, in my opinion and for my use, it is inadequate.  I bought these because my stock Apple Headphone for my shuffle keeps falling out of my ears when I run.  The good news for me is that these fit my ears perfectly, the bad news?  I can't believe an engineer would make a product with such thick cords.  The cables are obscenely thick... as in 1/4" wide!  (think of wearing extension cords on your body!) and when I run, the weight of the cord flopping around inevitably  yanks the buds out of my ear.I would have never made the purchase if I saw these at a store..  if you're an active person, you should consider something else!

I bought these shoes unseen, I never saw it at a retail store before ordering them, it was an impulse buy (Amazon special). Upon arrival, at first I thought the quality was lacking just from touching the material but that is somewhat misleading because the focus is obviously on making this shoe light.  I do find the fit to be somewhat lacking but fit is no reason to discredit the design of any shoe because it is highly subjective.  My feet (although not wide) are having a snugger than normal fit inside the housing.  So if your foot is on the smaller size for your measurement, you should do very well. It has a nice wide platform which distributes the impact shock very nicely to the right spots on your foot.  I took them for a 10 mile run, they performed well.So why did I give it 4 stars?Because for the money, you get a lot of performance.  Of course at this point I am not sure how long the shoes will last.Compared to my Nike Air /Air max 2012/2013 it falls short in comfort and versatility; these aren't necessarily great for cross training so for the days I plan to run in the gym and cross train, I take 2 pairs of shoes with me.The colors are surprisingly stylish (Navy/Silver/Orange) combo works well, the silver is a little too shinny but I can live with that.  I have not used them at night so I dont know how good they reflect headlights.Take a gamble on these, they're good enough. Probably one of the best in the low-price category for running.
Good product if you're looking for an Iron supplement.  The capsules are the perfect size.  180 tablets is enough to get you through 6 months.

This is a great product and simplifies what your body needs (It's not complete so you still have to know what other supplements to take)  I do recommend you see a nutritionist before self diagnosing what you should take.1. There are two very annoying properties that take it down to a 4 star product. (instead of 5)the pills are coated with a  blue dye which does make your tongue blue (not for too long).  But I cant help think this food coloring stains your teeth!2. The size of the pills are disturbing.  I think Solgar should make these pills smaller. (think horse pills)

This is installed in a Honda CRV; the speaker is in a constant battle with road-noise specially if you're on the highway.  The microphone works well, the problem is that you can't hear the person you're talking to half the time.  I have come to the conclusion that unless the bluetooth device is automatically pairing with your phone when you first get in, it's not worth getting these types of devices because you will forget  to pair your phone 1/2 the time before you start driving. (By that I mean you have to turn on the device which could be while receiving a phone call)  I have other IOGEAR stuff and generally like the build quality and the thoughtfulness behind its designs. This one misses the mark, while good looking with the benefit of the solar charger which actually works, it misses with actual usage and the cheap plugin charger that takes a lot of finagling to work in the cigarette lighter socket.

I like Lock&Lock, the products are solid and the containers are made to last... HOWEVER, this package is a waste of material and money unless you eat like a mouse or have a lot of babies and need to store tiny amounts  of different foods... think of going to the deli and ordering 1/4 pound containers of 15 different kinds of potato salad!  That's what you can store in these containers.. lots of tiny amounts of different kinds of food!I should have paid more attention to the actual sizes instead of getting duped by the picture.  Only 4 of these containers are used to store food, the others are being used to store nails, screws, buttons.. stuff like that!  Know what you're getting.

This little guy gave Hurricane Sandy a licking!  My gas powered saw was on the fritz so I ordered this from Amazon as two trees fell near my house (40' feet high and about 16" in diameter).  This saw was a godsend.  Within 5 hours, I had both trees and every limb chopped in 3-foot sections.  (Needless to say the cutting was the easy part.)This Saw is stingy with oil; it used the proper amount and matched what the manufacturer had claimed.  The tool-free chain tightening is extremely handy.  I was also impressed with the quality of the chain. Cleaning the unit is very easy and I liked the safety kickback on/off lever.The only complaint I have is the storage-sleeve for the blade when not in use.  I think the quality could have been better, this is the only piece where the cheap feel showed through to match the price.  But honestly, it is not a big deal.  If you're looking for a great alternative to gas-powered saw for quick jobs, this is a great candidate.  It served me well.  I am certainly going to go to this little guy before hassling with my gas powered monster.  Buy it, you wont regret it.I read a few reviews here which I do not agree with so here is my take;1. Someone complained that the chain-rotating gear is plastic.  This is not true, it is a metal piece.2. If you actually bother to read the instructions, the manufacturer explicitly states that this is not a Saw for constant use.  In other words, don't daydream about being a logger.  Some reviewers had expected something more.  So have your expectations match the engineering-intent behind  the tool's tolerance.  Understand that for $60, you're getting a disposable saw, in other words, I don't expect anyone to be able to fix this at a reasonable price after it breaks down.  It's probably cheaper to just go ahead and buy another one.  I will again, in a heartbeat.

This versions should have been included with Remembrance Day and Forever Running.  Unfortunately the currently included version with both albums does the song a huge disservice.  If you're planning to buy the albums just for this song, you are going to be sorely disappointed.

I made this purchase 5 months ago; Awesome buy.  Both units have surpassed my expectations.  The hammerdrill's torque is awesome, great clutch and I can not say enough impressive comments about the battery and the chuck assembly.  The settings are customizable in a logical and productive manner.I think the Impact driver is just beautiful.  It knows when and where to stop forcing the screw in like magic.  Much better than my other XXXXXXX brand Impact driver.Before buying this, my only concern was a comment I saw about the Nano batteries... there was a complaint about how the units stop working once the power is drained instead of just winding down gradually... well it turns out these batteries never go to Empty/Full on any charge/discharge cycle.  That means, the battery decides to stop working once its charge depletes down to a certain mark (I don't know what).  It does this for one reason... Longevity... it turns out this is one reason why these last 2000 charge cycles... while it would have been nice to have an indicator telling you how much charge you have left, I really don't see it as a deal breaker.Great drills, I became a fan in no-time.

I opened the box only to get sick of the chemical smell which refuses to go away.  I am not sure what they used to rub around the casing of this flash light.It looks great, has a long list of functions but that's where the good ends.Here is the ugly;It takes forever to charge,It's heavy because it uses a lead acid battery and here is where the design fails.  Lead Acid batteries don't last long... on flashlight mode, the juice runs out in 10 minutes... and just in case you don't know this about LA batteries, they're only good for about 300 cycles before the battery's ability to hold full charge goes down.What's worse is that this unit doesn't hold the charge for a long time.  Meaning, if you have a full charge and don't use it for a couple of months, you might not have any juice left to turn it on.This was a pathetic purchase for me. It wasn't worth the $10 I paid for it to send it back for a refund.

This unit's specifications is the reasons why I bought it.  Having had no experience with Gateway/Acer, I decided to take the plunge head-first.The unit arrived with panels not installed properly.. ie when the DVD tray would open, various panels would pop out of its housing... Obviously quality control prior to packaging was lacking to say the least.......And then there was no video!  Nothing at all.... I tried the HDMI and the DVI ports.  The V.card was certainly getting power as the fan on the card was spitting out plenty of hot air.Next I noticed that the USB bus would only power up randomly no matter what port I used.. obviously something was drastically wrong somewhere.. perhaps a faulty motherboard...I was able to overlook all of these as an innocent oversight, however after contacting Gateway's support it became clear that the culture of delivering lousy products didn't end with lousy quality control.For its part, Amazon promptly refunded my money with no hassles and paid for me to ship this junk back.Buyer beware.NEVER AGAIN will I buy anything Acer or Gateway.

We found the KIND bars at our local store, but they only had 2 different flavors. When I saw the The KIND Cube, Gift Variety, I immediately had to purchase it to try the other flavors. This box contains the following:3 Peanut Butter Dark Chocolate + Protein3  Blueberry Pecan + Fiber3 Cranberry Almond + Antioxidants3 Almond Cashew + Flax2 Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt2 Almond & Coconut2 Fruit & Nut Delight2 Madagascar Vanilla AlmondThe box itself is nice enough for gift giving. It opens up with each side splaying out and each holding 5 bars. Very nice, but somewhat expensive. However, it was worth it to try each bar to see if we'd like to purchase them again.Our favorites were Blueberry Pecan. Peanut Butter Dark Chocolate and Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt. Some of the flavors are a bit on the sweet side but these are still a much healthier choice than a regular candy bar for those days you want something sweet.

We have used a gas powered interchangeable system that is a true powerhouse, however, for the ladies of the house that want to go out and do trimming, it's just too heavy and cumbersome for them. The OREGON 40 Volt MAX HT250-E6 Hedge Trimmer Kit is perfect for light trimming and the gals love it. It is quiet, trims decently and is quite light which makes it easy to handle and with a nice long bar, it has a good long reach. The battery powered unit is so easy to start - just a touch of the button and you're off. The pack has indicator lights to show how much power is left.We had some snow damaged junipers that needed a serious trim back. This trimmer did a decent job, but I'm going to disagree with the statement that it can cut up to a 3/4" branch since a half inch gave it a workout and lugged it right down and gave it some problems. It doesn't cut branches very cleanly, instead it shreds them (see photo). But for light work and quick trimming jobs, you can't beat this trimmer. We just wanted to hack off most of the problems on the junipers and will go back and clean them up by hand.One issue we seem to have with this trimmer is the trimmer doesn't always turn on. You need to push the safety button back then you can turn it on, but when the button is pushed, it doesn't always start. This has been consistent with everyone in the household, so I know it's not just me doing something incorrectly.The gals give it two thumbs up since it made their work much easier!

I like to keep my gardening notes filed so that I can find them and access them as soon as I need them. Keeping them in notebooks is fine, but I found that the Avery Big Tab Write-On Dividers for Classification File Folders with 5-Side Tabs works so much better. I can now put my previous months notes away and categorized and be able to find them so much quicker!  The Write-on tabs are wonderful! They are reinforced and easy to use with a nice large space to put exactly what I need on each tab. No abbreviations, room for dates, etc. Besides that, no longer am I dropping papers - I just top punch them and I can flip through them quickly and easily using this system.I didn't know I needed the Avery Big Tab Write-On Dividers for Classification File Folders with 5-Side Tabs until I tried them out. Now I wonder how I ever lived without them! The have made my gardening life so much simpler.

First let me state, if you wear glasses, the Jackson Safety 25675 V50 Calico Polycarbonate Anti Fog Safety Eyewear in Smoke won't work for you. These safety glasses were designed for someone who either wears contacts or no corrective eyewear at all. With that said, these glasses are adjustable and will work for both female and male. Our son and daughter as well as each of us tried them on and found they fit everyone - although not all the same way. They are quite comfortable and have padding all around the eyepieces so that nothing can easily fall into the eyes. They are much like wearing goggles in that aspect. They go on easily, pull off easily and do not fog. So far, I've not had any problem with fogging, so the anti-fog seems to work well. As for being impact-resistant, I cannot attest to that first hand.The glasses come with a band that is interchangeable with the arms. The arms have tabs that push in so they can be removed and then the band snaps into their place. The tabs aren't the easiest to push to remove the arms or band. The band can only fit one way - with a definite left/right insertion. This turns the glasses into goggles for the times you really need it.The insert says these are 99% effective against UV rays. There are other listings of telling the type of protection as well as how they meet OSHA's standards.Glasses can only be cleaned with water and a soft cloth. If you need to clean them off with something else or disinfect them, you will need to contact the manufacturer. There is a place listed on the insert to do so.Overall the Jackson Safety 25675 V50 Calico Polycarbonate Anti Fog Safety Eyewear in Smoke are really nice glasses and seem to do the job well. Sadly they don't list they will not go over glasses which won't work for 2 of the 4 members of our family.

I am very pleased with the performance of the Hefty Slider Storage Bags in the Quart size. These bags are strong and quite tough for just being storage bags. The seal seals very well, however I have found that I get a little air leakage around the zipper pull where it meets up with the bag edge. For just storing things like fruit, cookies, sandwiches, etc., I really don't see a problem. They do seal better than the Ziploc bags and the seal is much more dependable, especially when using liquids. We've filled the Hefty and a Ziploc with just air and pressed down on them hard - the Ziploc failed before the Hefty. That's quite impressive. It tells me that when certain hands are digging through the fridge and drop one of these bags, I'm not going to have a huge mess to clean up!Would I recommend the Hefty Slider Storage Bags in the Quart size to family and friends? You bet! In fact, they have found a permanent place on my shelves!

When one opens the AllerEase Hot Water Washable Allergy Protection Mattress Pad the first thing that is noticed is the nice feel of the fabric and the weight. This is not one of those cheap covers that claim they protect from allergens. This one is well made, nice fabric topper with a padded/quilted side and does not make the user suffer with night sweats because it doesn't breathe.The pad truly does go from a scalding hot wash to the dryer and doesn't shrink or look like it had just been abused by hot water. It comes out clean and fresh and fits nicely on the bed. I have a 10" deep mattress and this fits wonderfully on it! It seems to protect both the allergy sufferer as well as the mattress.I'm very impressed with the AllerEase Hot Water Washable Allergy Protection Mattress Pad and would most definitely recommend it to my family and friends. This is the nicest pad I've had yet!

The Flatworld Kite - Large Easy Flyer - Series Premium Quality Nylon Stunt Kite is not only eye-catching and beautiful, but it flies nicely. The kite itself is made of brightly colored nylon and comes partially assembled. You have to install the upper and lower spreaders and attach the kite string, but that's it. The kite does not come with any instructions, but a quick search on the net should help the beginner if there are any questions on putting it together or how to fly.The Flatworld Kite - Large Easy Flyer - Series Premium Quality Nylon Stunt Kite comes in a nylon storage bag. This is great for keeping your kite clean and together - no more lost or broken pieces and keeps it ready to go at a moment's notice. We haven't flown kites since the kids were little and let me say, we had a LOT of fun with this kite. Much easier to use than standard kite - and much more fun!Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

The Cootree QCY Bluetooth 4.1 Portable Mini Lightweight Wireless Sports Headphone has an interesting design. The black/yellow colorscheme is bright and easy to see (and find if you by chance misplace it).These angled buds tuck into the ear canal and stay in place with soft silicone tips. There is also an ear ring/clip that tucks into the fold of your ear for a more secure placement. There is only one correct way to place these in your ear. If you look carefully on the black earpiece, you will find a very small R and L that is on the inside of the piece at the bottom just above where the earpiece joins to the wire. This will insure a correct and comfortable placement.Bluetooth pairing is quick and easy. I'm pleased with how quickly these paired with my devices. The left earpiece has a very well covered USB charging jack that is well designed to keep water/sweat out. On the right earpiece is the volume control, pairing button and a microphone. The volume control takes a little getting used to, however once you do, it is easy to use.The The Cootree QCY Bluetooth 4.1 Portable Mini Lightweight Wireless Sports Headphone are good sounding phones. They have decent range, fit well in the ear and don't fall out, are comfortable and block out outside noise. I have not had any problem with ear pain or with the buds falling out when doing my morning routines. These are a nice set of wireless earphones that are perfect for workouts as well as just wearing around when you don't want to be attached to anything.Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

Never in a million years would I have thought I'd own a Selfie Stick - especially at my age. However, when my first child graduated, I discovered how difficult it was to find a place to set a camera, set the timer and get a good group photo. If that's not an option, it also can be difficult finding someone else to take the group photo. It means handing your camera to a stranger or having someone not in the photo. That's when I knew we had to find another option for the next big event.The Cootree KS-01 Extendable Bluetooth Wireless Handheld Selfie Pole has been the answer to that problem for us. This monopole is well constructed with a metal swivel and it extends out without bowing from the weight of the camera at the end being too heavy for the length. The pole has bluetooth so it allows for easy thumb control to take your photos. It also has a wrist strap for easy carrying. The clamp is adjustable and can be used with numerous brands of phones. I have a BLU phone and it works wonderfully with it!The Cootree KS-01 Extendable Bluetooth Wireless Handheld Selfie Pole is definitely a product that I would recommend to my family and friends. It is well made, sturdy, fits many phones and has bluetooth and is easy to use.Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

The Cootree BE318 3.5mm In-ear earphones have a very modern look to them that would appeal to both male and female listeners. The metal looking ear buds are a sharp addition to the black and red ribbon type cord. The jack is a straight connection that has a tapered and reinforced transition from the jack to the cord. Where the cord splits is a metal/plastic reinforcement that will prevent these from pulling/splitting apart easily. The buds are covered with silicone sleeves/tips that are comfortable to wear for long periods of time. They fit into the canal and do a great job blocking out outside noise.So they look great, but what about sound? The Cootree BE318 3.5mm In-ear earphones sound quite amazing. They have a nice wide range with decent highs, a good mid-range and a bumping base that you can feel - even at very low volume levels. I can't wear most buds because they become painful from fit as well as well as the sound. These are really comfortable and they don't cause ear pain since I can listen to the music on very low levels and still not be distracted by outside noise. The cord is flat, so there is no cord sound when you move.Would I recommend the Cootree BE318 3.5mm In-ear earphones to family and friends? YES! These are really nice earphones - especially in the price range they are listed in. They've beaten out some of the more expensive earphones I've purchased in the past. I'm very pleased with their performance!Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

The Avery Index Maker Clear Pocket Clear Label Plastic Dividers, 8-Tab Set is perfect for the student as well as anyone who needs pockets to place their additional papers that cannot be punched or for someone who likes to store and file all at once. For me, it's the former. I get many handouts that don't have the margin space to allow me to punch and I don't like using protectors because they stick out from the rest of the papers, so I end up with them all in the back of the binder. This system is perfect for me, as I can just pop them in the pocket of the corresponding tab. Each pocket is supposed to hold up to 70 sheets of standard weight paper, but I didn't get that many in.The labels are easy to create by going to the online template found at Avery's website. Since each printer prints just a bit differently, I would suggest printing out a test sheet before doing the actual printing on the labels. Then it's easy going from there. Just align the labels with the divider tabs (all of them at once) and as easy as a swipe of the finger, they are all adhered!The Avery Index Maker Clear Pocket Clear Label Plastic Dividers, 8-Tab Set is just another fine example of the wonderful office and school products Avery has to offer!

I'm always game to try new products, so when I stumbled upon the M&M's White Chocolate Carrot Cake at our local store, I grabbed a package and took them home with high hopes. The candies are a little fatter and larger than regular M&M's and they are in pretty spring colors. The center looks like white chocolate but the flavor is of a very strong cinnamon. I've never had any carrot cake that has come close in flavor to these candies. Instead, they have more of a cinnamon roll taste - and a strong cinnamon roll at that.The M&M's White Chocolate Carrot Cake is interesting, but nothing I'd buy again. Would I recommend it to family and friends - not this flavor. I don't know anyone that likes that strong of a cinnamon flavor.

The attractive real wood design of the Symphonized NRG Premium Genuine Wood In-ear Noise-isolating Headphones with Mic caught my eye right away. From the gorgeous wood earpieces to the bright yellow woven cord covered wires, these look very stylish. But any audiophile knows when it comes to sound, stylish looks don't mean anything - the sound is what matters. With these lovely headphones - sound is not sacrificed for beauty in any way!Much though appears to have been given when these headphones were designed. The wood give a full rich sound and when it comes to deep base, I swear I can feel these move just a bit when those tones are hit. The cording gives extra protection and strength to the wires. Where the wires attach to the plugs, merge into one wire (or split into two) as well as at the jack, there is a rubber reinforcement at these stress points. The jack comes out of your device at a 45 degree angle which is different than any other set of phones that I have. They also come with 6 pair of silicone ear bud covers - 3 clear and 3 brown so you can find the ones that fit your ears as well as the ones that fit your taste. These make the headphones extremely comfortable as well as cancels out the noise for a peaceful listening experience. One thing I'll note though, it appears these are not soundless to others around you. According to family, they can hear a little bleed-through when I'm listening to them. Also included is a nice pull-string linen bag to store everything in.I am very impressed with the Symphonized NRG Premium Genuine Wood In-ear Noise-isolating Headphones with Mic in all aspects, but the of course, the best part is that they sound great!Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

With these lovely headphones - sound is not sacrificed for beauty in any way!Much though appears to have been given when these headphones were designed. The wood give a full rich sound and when it comes to deep base, I swear I can feel these move just a bit when those tones are hit. The cording gives extra protection and strength to the wires. Where the wires attach to the plugs, merge into one wire (or split into two) as well as at the jack, there is a rubber reinforcement at these stress points. The jack comes out of your device at a 45 degree angle which is different than any other set of phones that I have. They also come with 6 pair of silicone ear bud covers - 3 clear and 3 brown so you can find the ones that fit your ears as well as the ones that fit your taste. These make the headphones extremely comfortable as well as cancels out the noise for a peaceful listening experience. One thing I'll note though, it appears these are not soundless to others around you. According to family, they can hear a little bleed-through when I'm listening to them. Also included is a nice pull-string linen bag to store everything in.I am very impressed with the Symphonized NRG Premium Genuine Wood In-ear Noise-isolating Headphones with Mic in all aspects, but the of course, the best part is that they sound great!Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

The attractive real wood design of the Symphonized NRG Premium Genuine Wood In-ear Noise-isolating Headphones with Mic caught my eye right away. From the gorgeous wood earpieces to the brightly colored woven cord covered wires, these look very stylish. However, any audiophile knows when it comes to sound, stylish looks don't mean anything - the sound is what matters. With these lovely headphones - sound is not sacrificed for beauty in any way!Much thought appears to have been given when these headphones were designed. The wood give a full rich sound and when it comes to deep base, I swear I can feel these move just a bit when those tones are hit. The cording gives extra protection and strength to the wires. Where the wires attach to the plugs, merge into one wire (or split into two) as well as at the jack, there is a rubber reinforcement at these stress points. The jack comes out of your device at a 45 degree angle which is different than any other set of phones that I have. They also come with extra pairs of silicone ear bud covers so that you can find the ones that fit your ears well. These make the headphones extremely comfortable as well as cancels out the noise for a peaceful listening experience. One thing I'll note though, it appears these are not soundless to others around you. According to family, they can hear a little bleed-through when I'm listening to them. Also included is a nice pull-string linen bag to store everything in.I am very impressed with the Symphonized NRG Premium Genuine Wood In-ear Noise-isolating Headphones with Mic in all aspects, but the of course, the best part is that they sound great!Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

Chinese Turkestan: A Photographic Journey Through an Ancient Civilization could have been a remarkable book instead of just good. All photos are in black and white and set a mood that enhances the photographs. Color photos would have been stunning, but the black and white format turned these into something much more amazing. Ryan Pyle is a true artist that can create many emotions through his photos. Sadly, sometimes this was lost because of the way the book was bound. Here is a book that NEEDS to be a coffee table type - one where you can gaze at the clear and well laid out pictures. Unfortunately, this book is much smaller and there was nothing that allowed for the 2 page photographs to be nicely viewed. The photos were ruined by the seams of the book. I would have expected that there be wider margins so that the photo would not be destroyed by a seam. One example is a photo of a livestock trader where the seam runs right through the middle of his face creating a cyclopes looking form instead of being able to see the man's face. This person is the center of attention and we cannot view him easily.Here's a book that I give 5 stars to the gorgeous photography yet only a 1 star for the binding.Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.

The DII 100% Polyester, Machine Washable, Tonal Bordered Fabric Tablecloth, 60 x 84 is a very versatile tablecloth. The color scheme and the fabric can be used formally as well as informally.The linen look weave complete with slubs and uneven thread sizes makes it look much more expensive but is so much easier to clean than linen.All seams were neat and tidy and there were no loose threads. The cream color top is separated from the tan bottom by a decorative weave, giving a nice touch of elegance. The corner squares are a darker tan and would be an elegant place for embroidered initials or other decorative stitches. I have a wood table that shows through the cream some. Personally, I'm not fond of that look, so I usually put a liner of some sort (usually white) underneath to keep the colors true.This cloth washes up nicely. I did notice a small dark spot on the cream straight out of the package. I washed it, but it didn't come out during the first washing. It appears to be a grease stain instead of dirt. It's in an inconspicuous spot, so I'm not overly worried about it, but I'm not thrilled to find something like this straight out of the package. Hence the reason for 4 stars instead of a 5 star rating that it would have received if that spot hadn't been there.

I use cheesecloth in both kitchen and herbal applications for years and haven't been completely satisfied with the cloth I've been using. When I was asked if I'd like to test the Unbleached Cheesecloth Fabric Food Grade 90, I jumped at the chance. This cloth is just what I have been wanting. It has a close weave and one doesn't have to use as much as the "other stuff" to get a good result. I've used it to strain jelly, nut milk, bouquet garni, straining yogurt to make yogurt cheese as well as other cheeses and to strain my herbal infusions and tinctures.The weave, size of the cloth as well as being unbleached makes the Unbleached Cheesecloth Fabric Food Grade 90 an absolute favorite of mine. It washes up nicely, strains well and because of the size, will last a long time. This workhorse of a cloth is a must for any kitchen! You'll be surprised how many uses you'll be able to find for it.Disclosure: This is an HONEST review regarding a sample I received for testing purposes. I was not asked nor was I required to write a favorable review.
