I have the hardest time keeping cables from being destroyed--not only from 3 little kids, but I am tough on them. I love these cables. AmazonBasics makes good quality, solid cables that hold up to my dropping, pulling, yanking, and more. I keep trying different brands that are cheap cheap, but these are a good price and good quality that last.

My kids love playing with balls and would use the whole house as a ball pit if they could. Before getting this, I already had about 200 balls that I used with the kids in different things, but not well enough contained. They love trains, so I thought this would be good. It is really cute and a nice size. It fits all 3 of my kids (average sized 4-year-old and 2.5-year-old twins) sitting in it and climbing in and out.I would give this 3.5 stars if I could, but I am rounding it up to 4 stars because it is cute and fun. It gets deductions because the 50 balls that it comes with are not even close to enough. It doesn't even come close to covering the bottom of the train. I added 200 more balls and that would good. Then the problem because the huge hole in the back of the train. The kids kick the balls around and they all go flying out the back. I ended up putting a blanket over the back to try and hold them in (the kids will throw that off, though).Super cute and fun for the kids, but get more balls and cover the back up!

I have a 4-year-old and 2.5-year-old twins. They all like trains and superheros and my oldest loves Batman, so this is right up their alley. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. There really isn't much track--it is just a small oval (my oldest said that he wished it were longer). The trains are nice a big, but the trains and cars don't link together and stay together--they are just "open hooks" and if the kids pick them up, then they come apart. My 2.5-year-old boy was screaming at me over and over to put them back together because he likes playing with them away from the track. It was a huge frustration to me.The kids like carrying the trains around and playing with them around the house, but the track is too small and they don't really like it. For the price, this really is a disappointment.

My kids love cars and the 4-year-old has really gotten crazy about Hot Wheels lately. When I opened the box with this in it, he was so excited that it was Hot Wheels (he can't quite read, but he knows his logos). I have 3 kids, so it is perfect that this comes with 3 monster trucks...each kid was able to get their own without any fighting.Putting it together is fairly easy, but I find that the dragon is difficult to keep in place. The tail and head both come off way to easily. But, to get the truck to fly up the ramp and through the dragon's mouth, it takes a lot of force. I had a really hard time getting it moving enough to get it caught in the mouth. My 4-year-old was really slamming on the thing and had a hard time. So, the execution of the toy isn't perfect.Overall, my kids had a lot of fun with it. My almost 3-year-old twins had a hard time with it and were bugging my 4-year-old who did really well with it. I wouldn't recommend this for younger kids unless they are good about not tearing things apart (mine love to take things apart and figure out how they work). It is a fun toy for the kids that is simple and not too expensive.

I don't have a go pro, but we had another brand that was lower quality, but did just enough.My son is getting into bike riding and skiing, so I wanted a camera that would work well for him.I really like this camera. It is lightweight enough to fit in my pocket if I want to carry it around. It takes excellent videos and has a simple setup.Super easy to use and control via the app.I am disappointed it did not come with a manual and you need to go online to TomTom to get the digital version.

I'm pretty impressed with this "food jar" so far. It is essentially are very large thermos with a wide mouth. It appears to be much larger than its capacity because it is thickly lined and well insulated. I did a quick test on it with hot water and not only was it leakproof, but it stayed hot even though I opened it every so often to check on it. So, after 3-4 hours it was still hot even after being opened at least 3 times.This is going to be perfect for going to potlucks since my food always seems to be cold when I get there. Three quarts isn't huge, but it is enough to hold a pot of chili, chicken wings, and a lot of other goodies.

My nearly 13-year-old pug has a thing about peeing on the carpet. We moved into our house a year ago and he picked a spot a marks it every day no matter what we do to clean it up. We've cleaned up multiple times and practically before the carpet is dry he has peed on it again. Our house smells like a zoo when you walk in because he happened to pick a spot in the entryway.I've had a lot of people in and out of the house recently and I have been so frustrated with the smell, so I decided to give this a try. We cleaned up the carpet and first, it doesn't smell bad or too strong at all. Second, it did a great job getting out the dog stains. The house smelled so much better right away. And most important, more than 24 hours later and the dog hasn't peed on the floor again! My house doesn't smell like a zoo.So far I am totally sold on this carpet cleaner. I'm hoping that the dog will stop marking in the house for good. I don't want to live in a zoo.

I'm not a big diet soda drinker because I'm not a fan of the aftertaste and I don't like artificial sweeteners. I do try the less sugar versions (like Coke Zero) and am interested in finding a better alternative. I do really like Ginger Ale mostly because I like the strong "bite" that it gives you. I grew up on Vernors (I went to high school in the same city as the plant) and have never found anything better.I thought I would give this a try since it is more "natural" and I like ginger ale. It really didn't do much for me. It doesn't have any bite and more or less tastes like a lemon-lime soda. Ginger is not even listed as an ingredient (there are "natural flavors," but I would think ginger would be listed if it were actually in it). There is an aftertaste, but it doesn't bother me too much.Overall, it is a decent soda, but not a great ginger ale.

My daughter was in need of a new chest of drawers, so this will be a nice addition to her room.It arrived packed very compactly in a heavy box that I just used our dolly to move into the house because it was too heavy for me to lift alone to move even just the 4-5 feet into the house.My mom and I did the assembly as a team. I tried to get started on my own and was able to get through some things without help, but it is necessary to have someone hold a few of the pieces to be able to screw them in more easily. It took us a little over an hour to put it together and I did get out the drill to get the drawers together because hand screwing in the screws was not working for me. Putting the sides and the back of the drawers together was the most difficult part for me because the holes didn't quite line up. I also didn't use the nails provided to nail down the drawer bottoms because the nails were too large and I couldn't get them straight enough so they went through the sides of the particle board. We always have plenty of small finishing nails on hand, so I found smaller ones that worked just fine.Once finished, this is a very nice looking chest of drawers. The simple hardware is pretty and classy looking. The quality is decent, though not high end since it is particle board. It feels very sturdy and is pretty darn heavy. Good quality for a reasonable price. I also like that this is made in North America (USA & Canada) and not coming from overseas.

This Bose machine has a beautiful design and the sound quality is excellent just as expected from Bose. I like that there are no visible buttons and just a tap to the top of the machine will turn it on. It was simple to set up the time and has nice reception for the radio.This is "old school" style. No bluetooth, no wi-fi, no USB. You can play the radio or a CD. There is an AUX connection, so it is possible to hook up your phone using an aux cable. No bluetooth does tie you down to the machine, though. You have a couple of different options. You can either upgrade to the next model for an extra $100 Bose Wave SoundTouch music system IV - Platinum Silver and it includes both bluetooth and wi-fi. Or you can purchase a bluetooth receiver to attach to the aux port. I opted to purchase a bluetooth receiver (Mpow Streambot 2-In-1 Wireless Bluetooth Audio Music Streaming Switchable Transmitter and Receiver With 3.5mm Stereo Output - Connect Your PC, iPhone, iPod, iPad, Tablets Or MP3 Player To Speakers And Entertainment Systems, Home Or Car) that works great. I can stream my Amazon Prime music and it sounds excellent. Bose also has a Bluetooth adapter, but I wanted a simple solution.So, if you are looking for a CD player or radio, then this is an excellent choice. If you want more versatility with newer technology, I suggest upgrading.

I got a 5/6 for my little guy who is just starting to fit into size 5. It fits a little big, but works for him with room to grow. I like the 2 shirt style options. Nice and breathable for my very active child. Green is super neon bright, so I won't miss him from a distance. Good value that I expect will last a while for my oldest and  he can pass it down to his younger brother.

My father-in-law is a former garage door opener installer, so I asked his professional opinion of the Ultra-quiet operation before selecting this model (he doesn't care about the wi-fi option, but I'm automating most of the house operations). He loves how quiet and smooth these work, so I was excited to get this one. Our older model garage door opener is a chain model and loud thus wakes the kids from their naps. I enlisted my father-in-law's help (okay, he did it all) to install the opener and he said it was an average installation that didn't take more than an hour. I did the wi-fi installation and it took me about 3 minutes to get it all set up (you need to push buttons on the opener, so don't put your ladder away before finishing setting up the wi-fi).I love, love, love how quiet this thing is!!!  I can open or close the garage door and not even hear it when in the house just one room away. If I am upstairs directly above the garage, I can hear a hum, but it is not loud at all--the old one practically shook the upstairs. I went into my son's bedroom and could barely hear anything, so the garage door isn't going to wake him anymore! Woo-hoo! The app tells me how long the garage has been open or closed, so no more worrying about if the door is left open or not.One big thing to note that is on the box, but not on the description page...if your garage door is more than 7ft, you will need the extension kit. Chamberlain 8808CB 8-Feet Belt Drive Extension Kit. My father-in-law informed me of this before I got the opener, so I ordered the kit right away and they arrived the same day.

I don't like to be hot. I also have central air in my house, but the thermostat is in a "cool" spot and it doesn't reflect the room temperature in my bedroom. I wanted a way to keep my bedroom cool without running the a/c for the whole house when my room is the only one that "needs" it. We also have a large playroom for the kids that tends to be warmer than the other rooms because it gets all the afternoon sun and heats up easily. I wanted the ability to cool off either my bedroom or the playroom without running the a/c on the whole house and over cooling some of the other rooms. And we arrive at the portable a/c...First thing, this unit is fairly large and heavy. Getting it out of the box is pretty easy, though, since the top of the box lifts off the bottom and leaves you with the unit sitting on strong piece of heavyweight cardboard. Once you get it moved to the floor you want it on (we moved it upstairs), then it is a breeze to move around because of the wheels on the bottom. Even being heavy, it moves easily.Next up, installation. The instructions say that it takes 5 minutes. Well, not so for me. We have side opening windows, so it seems like it should be easy. The problem is that our windows are longer than the provided insert with one extension. Adding the second extension piece put the vent up higher and makes it difficult to get to. Even with it installed completely, there is a small gap between the insert and the window (because the extension goes inside the main piece making it so it is not the same width, so a little extra insulation is necessary for a seal. I ended up using one extension and filling in the extra space on the top with a temporary fix of cardboard. This makes moving the unit from room to room a bit more difficult since the included window blocker cannot be moved if I need to add insulation to seal the window closed.So, does it work? Yes, yes it does. My room can be kept at a comfortable 68 when the rest of the house is 10 warmer. I can't say that the temp sensor on the unit is perfect because my room temp sensor is off by a degree or two, but it is close enough that it is still comfortable. It is loud even on the lowest fan speed, which is normal for an a/c unit. From my use, the fan cannot be turned off if you want the a/c to run. So, it is always loud. Overall, I am happy with the unit. It won't be as easy to move around as I would like, but it does keep me a lot more comfortable in the heat (and it worked great as the day after I got it installed the temps went into the 90s). If you can't use a window a/c unit or want to be able to put one away when not needed, this is a great unit.

The green apple scent is very light on these bags, I didn't really notice it too much until I pulled a bag out and the scent wafted out. I'm not sure that it really helped contain any odors in the bag too much, but we had lots of odorous items in the trash and I didn't smell it outside the can as much as I usually do with our standard Kirkland brand bags.A solid bag that hold the trash well and hasn't torn or leak on us. We have lots of diapers and other stinky stuff, so I'm happy with them.

My kids love Play-Doh. They go crazy to play with it any time I bring it out (I have to put it away or it would be out all the time and it can make a little mess with 3 kids ages 4, 2.5, and 2.5. When this arrived they all got very excited. There are just enough different things to keep them interested. I'm not sure I would call this the "ultimate creativity tub," but it is a nice starter set for Play-Doh. My only nit with the toys is the roller--it is open on both ends and one of my kids immediately stuffed a bunch of Play-Doh into it and I had to find a stick to get it out--we have other rollers that have closed ends that are much better.It isn't a large tub -- the description says 4.8 x 8 x 8, but I measured it and it is more 4.5" (deep) x 7-7.5" (width--it is tapered) x 8. I do like the size because it isn't too big and I love that everything fits back into the tub when the kids are done.This comes with the small containers of Play-Doh, so each one is a nice size for a smaller child, but bigger kids will like more.Overall, this is a winner since it is not too large, fits all back together, and has enough variety for plenty of creativity.

This is a good quality cable at a good price. I love the AmazonBasics items because they work just as well as the name brand items for a lot less. This works well for both my iPad and the hubby's iPhone.

I've had upright vacuums for a while since I like them a bit better most of the time and I had a single story house, so I didn't need to worry about vacuuming stairs or getting a vacuum up and down stairs. Well, a year ago I moved into a 2-story house with carpeted stairs. Needless to say, the stairs have been neglected quite a bit and gotten a bit dirty. I've been trying to find either a good handheld vac or a canister vac to get the stairs better.The Jetforce canister works wonderfully! It is light and easy to maneuver around and it has a strong suction. I was able to vacuum the stairs easily and they were finally clean after a year of 3 kids going up and down dropping all kinds of crumbs. The canister will hold a lot of dirt and dog fuzz (we have a fuzzy pug that sheds a lot). It is easy to empty out as well.My mom is a bit of a vacuum expert (okay, just a housewife that vacuums on a daily basis and has for nearly 50 years) and loves canister vacuums. She loves this one and wants to take it home with her! I'm not letting her take it because I like it too much!

This thing is HUGE. My kids love cars, so this is a lot of fun for them. There are lots of different things they can do and play in so many ways. It is big, so storage is difficult. You can take the long track off, so it can be put away a little easier. It fits in our playroom closet, which is not very large, but deeper than the average bedroom closet.Setup on this thing will take a while. My brother (Uncle Bob to my kids) put it together and it took a little less than an hour. He put it together downstairs and when he was done took it upstairs to the playroom after removing the long race track, so it can be moved around pretty easy (as long as it isn't filled with cars).This is a great gift for any kid who loves cars. Perfect for Christmas morning.

While I have had Brenda Novak books on my TBR list for a while, I've never actually read one until now. The book description was just enough to pique my interest and get me to read the book. A well written description is important and this one did its job. It was also backed by a very good book.Maisey returns home to Fairham Island to help her brother and his messed up life as well as try to heal her broken life. In her path she meets Rafe who finds a way to reach her soul. Maisey also needs to work through her strained relationship with her mother while trying to figure out how to help her brother. Maisey is a very well developed character that grows throughout the book.The story moves along at a nice and steady pace that was enough to keep me interested and reading every chance I had. While I cannot say the end was a shock, it wasn't totally expected either. There was just enough mystery that developed well.I look forward to reading more Brenda Novak books in the future.

I am an Android girl. I have had Android phones for 3 years and nearly switched to an iPhone last year, but couldn't bring myself to do it. I am so glad that I didn't switch. I have an iPad (bought for me as a gift--an original mini) and it frustrates me to no end because it doesn't have enough memory with each iOS update. I have never been able to justify buying one for myself since they are so expensive and have no expandability. I've wanted an Android tablet, but didn't know which one to get, but when I was given the opportunity to review this one, I jumped at it. I have had ASUS products in the past (I had a netbook years ago) and liked the quality.What I use my tablet for most of the time: surfing the web, email, and watching videos on Netflix, Plex, Tablo, or Amazon. I also want to watch videos on-the-go so I need plenty of storage space. I will also stream music through my phone or tablet to Bluetooth speakers.I've been using this tablet for over a week and am very happy with it so far. It is thin, light, has a bright screen, is fast, and sets up just like my phone. I downloaded all my apps--like Netflix, Amazon photos, Amazon music, Tablo, and more. It runs fast and has a beautiful screen. Videos look great as the screen is clear and bright. I was disappointed at first because Netflix kept hanging and splitting the screen...I wondered if it was the app or the tablet. Turns out it was the tablet because the split screen continued outside of the app (once I was able to get out of it which didn't happen every time Netflix failed). I had to do a system update which fixed the issue. I haven't had any issues with Netflix or any of the other apps.My one complaint about the tablet is the battery life. It just doesn't seem to hold up as well as I expected. It isn't terrible, but it does seem to drain quicker than my iPad. I need to charge it on a daily basis with any use where the iPad can go at least 2-3 days without charging.

With the introduction of the LeapPad Platinum, LeapFrog also introduced new games with Imagicards. The player needs to take pictures of the cards during the game to continue. I got this game for my 4-year-old who loves Ninja Turtles. He loves the game and had a lot of fun playing it. He did need a little help figuring out how to get a picture of the card, but played independently for the most part. Taking pictures of the cards is fairly easy as all you need to do is get the card fully in the screen and the game will recognize the card. We even had pretty low light and it worked.My only problem with the Imagicard games (not even this one in particular) is that it is difficult to take them on the go. You need a surface to put the cards on to be able to get a good shot of the card. Also, I am concerned about losing a card and then not being able to play the game properly.

This fits the LeapPad 3 with extra room to spare inside for the charger or games. The outside pocket also has plenty of room for the charger or games or any extras to carry with the LeapPad.I also have the LeapPad Platinum which is larger than the LP3 and it fits in the case, but there is no room to spare. If you are just looking for a carry case for the LPP and don't care to carry much else with it, then this will also work. I can still fit the charger in the front pocket if needed.

We have been using the older version of this bottle (the Striker) that was good, but could be frustrating with the straw mostly (it would come loose or it detached and would go missing). The Gizmo is a big upgrade from the older bottle. The inside straw is plastic and a solid piece (you can disconnect it to wash) that is on a angle so that when my son tips the bottle toward him he will still get the last drops of water. The opening is wider than the older ones as well. They are shorter, wider, and the handle is lower profile and more rubberized so it moves a little easier and is less likely to break.I bought a set from Costco like this (it also included an insulated one that does not have a straw) and use them with my 2-yr-old and 4-yr-old. I love these so much more than the old ones and the kids love them, too. They use them every day for preschool (as do many of the other kids).

I admit that I have gotten on the reusable bag train. I hate throwing away so many plastic bags and would rather just reuse bags for my kids lunches than keep buying more toss away bags. I have a few of the planetwise bags which are really cute and work fairly well, but aren't nearly as thick and sturdy as these BlueAvocado bags. These are the highest quality reusable bags that I have tried. They have 2 layers of seals making them leak-proof plus the top closure works very well.These are a bit high priced making me think twice about getting more, but I will probably get some more of the smaller snack sized ones for my kids' lunches. I don't need to wash them out on a daily basis for most stuff for them (maybe just a wipe or rinse if needed).The bags are also strong enough to be used for lots of other items that are not food and may be heavier. These will be great for travel items or anything that could leak in a bag. I know a few moms use these in their diaper bags for some of the diapering necessities.Very high quality. A little pricey. Lots of uses.

I'm not a hunter, but I do have quite a few wild animals in my backyard. I'm trying to figure out where all the pesky rabbits are coming from, so this is very helpful in catching them in motion. My in-laws are borrowing it to who has been sneaking around the neighborhood cutting trees and bushes. They can easily strap it into their tree to get a good view of the person chopping their tree without the camera being noticeable.It does not come with an SD card, but an 8GB card will get you plenty of pictures or video and they are pretty cheap these days. I had an extra 8GB laying around, so I used that one. It also takes 8 AA batteries that are also not included. A lot of batteries, but it allows the camera to work for longer periods of time.Daytime pictures turn out very nice and nighttime are pretty good as well, but remember that they are at night, so not as good as day.A nice camera that is good for quite a few different uses and not just for hunting. I have hunters in the family who I am pretty sure will want to borrow the camera.

A first look at these sponges look like they aren't going to work very well, but they surprised me and actually do a decent job. The "scrubby" side is much softer than the older style (I usually use the blue ones) and doesn't get the grease stuck in it so easily. I do think that for some things the blue scrubbing sponge (or the yellow/green) will work a little better. I do like these for everyday use.

This is a nice size grill that will easily cook plenty of food for a family of four all at one time.It arrives packed very well in the box. It was so well packed that I had a difficult time getting the darn thing out. I swear I can practically hear the people packing it up laughing at those of us trying to open the box. Once I was able to get it out of the box, it was easy to assemble. It requires a screwdriver, but only to screw on the handle to the the lid. Everything else just snaps into place. The grill itself is nice and sturdy, but the stand wobbles a little bit. Not enough that it is going to fall over, but enough to make you wonder.I used the grill to make up some chicken skewers and zucchini. I did use a little bit of oil sprayed on the grill to make it easier to clean up. Chicken notoriously sticks to the grill, so I felt it was a good idea. Cleanup was easy as I just took a wet rag and wiped it down when the grill was still hot. I had no problem wiping any of the residue and the grill looks good as new.This really is a great alternative for people who live in places that don't allow charcoal or gas grills (specifically apartments). I like it because it doesn't require that we have enough gas to fire it up and it is easy cleanup, but we still get the benefit of being able to cook outside. We live in a hot climate in the summer, so there are many days when I don't want to cook into the house and heat it up and this will be a great way to easily cook outside without a lot of prep work. Our gas grill also just recently was eradicated of a mouse family, so I'm still a little leery of using it before I give it a good clean.It is quite large, so I really have no idea where I am going to store it. It is a little too large for me to store in the house in my kitchen. I'll probably keep it outside for the summer, but it snows here in the winter, so I would rather keep it in the house and I will need to find a place to store it.

I don't wear headphones too often as a stay at home mom, but there are times when I just need to block the world out and go to my own place. From the moment I put the headphones on, the world starts to calm down and turn inward. They aren't noise canceling, but they do quiet the sounds of 3 preschoolers yelling at each other. And once the music starts playing, I don't hear anything else. Ahhh....bliss.The headphones are very comfortable. I wore them for a couple of hours with no discomfort and could have worn them longer, but I can't shut out the world forever.The sounds were amazing. I have listened to a few songs many many times and never heard some of the small quiet sounds in them. I had no idea! I am no audiophile, but I do love listening to music and really hearing all the nuances.Great headphones that are a little pricey, but worth it if you wear headphones for long periods of time and want to block out other noises around you. These would have been awesome in my days at my desk job as a systems engineer.

I make a lot of grilled cheese sandwiches, but usually do it on a flat pan with no lid and end up using a lid from another pan that just smushes the sandwich and gets dirty. I have been thinking of getting an alternative to help melt the cheese better for a while so when I had the opportunity to try out this melting dome, I jumped on it. This is exactly what I have been looking for. It works great to melt the cheese in my sandwich (one sandwich fits under it) or for putting over eggs, hashbrowns, and other breakfast foods. We don't make burgers too often, but this works great for cheese on the burgers (2 fit under the dome).

I have used a similar version of this in the past and about 4 months ago it quit working properly. I had a backup plan (not one I really liked) to make my setup continue to work, but I have been thinking about getting one of these for a while.I set this up to make all my TV setup wired as well as keeping a few extra things wired in that don't fit directly into the wi-fi router (I have a few things that need a wired connection and the router has 4 connections that are all taken).  I plugged the one end in the wall socket in the room with the router and the other end a couple of rooms away into the wall socket by the TV setup. I connected a switch to the port since I have 4 things I am connected to the network in one location. I watch everything on TV through the internet (I do not have a cable box, just a Roku connected to the TV and my local channels I get through my Tablo that is connected through the internet). All my shows are coming through without any glitches and streaming perfectly.This is a very simple way to add to the network without having everything wi-fi and slowing down the connections. I am very happy with it.

I have some other ClosetMaid cubeicals that I really like and I needed something good for my kids to store jackets, backpacks, and shoes. This is the perfect solution for my 3 preschool aged kids to stay organized. I had a couple of extra fabric drawers, so I put them in this to store their shoes.It is easy to assemble and holds all my kids' stuff perfect. I don't expect it to last forever, but this will do good for them through preschool and hopefully the first couple of years of elementary school

This is a nice high-quality polo shirt. The color is a very dark navy and is almost black. The XS is a 5/6 and fits my average-sized 4-year-old slightly large (sleeves are long and it goes well below his long waist), but I am sure it will fit well as he grows a little closer to 5.Smith's American is made in Bangladesh. 60% cotton/40% polyester.

My 4-year-old loves playing with this track. It is a fairly large track and needs to be set up in one particular way, so it isn't a lot of variation to it. It take a bit to put it together, but the instructions are easy to follow and the track pieces are numbered making it easier.Thomas goes around the track with his car and a chest that he picks up along the way after twisting down. It doesn't do much else than just go around the track, but my kids love watching it and putting the treasure chest back to fall into the car when Thomas goes back. My son played with it for a go 30 minutes and he has a short attention span.A fun toy. My one complaint that it is rather large and hard to store. It isn't a quick put-together toy, so to be played with often it should stay set up, which takes up a large amount of space.

I have 3 kids (2.5-year-old girl/boy twins, 4-year-old boy) that all love Jake. They all got very excited when they saw the box and kept trying to get to Jake. When I opened the box to get it out, I saw lots of pieces...the whole thing needs to be assembled, so beware and don't get it out with the kids around...put it together before they get a chance to see it!Once it was all put together, the kids have had a lot of fun playing with the ship. I actually really like that it is tall and skinny because it closes up fairly small. One of the little ones likes pushing it around and the other 2 like playing with it open.We also have other Jake ships (Bucky & Jolly Roger) and I think I like this one most because it is the most versatile. The kids can get into it and play with the inside unlike the other two where they try to put things in and then get mad when they can't get them out. I think this ship can really grow with kids and will be a fun toy for a while.

I have another aromatherapy diffuser - Greenair Spa Vapor + Advanced Wellness Instant Healthful Mist Therapy - that is comparable to this one. As far as them working, they both diffuse essential oils, have soothing colors, and work for a few hours (length of time depends on minerals in your tap water). I would pick the GreenAir as the better option, though.The PureGuardian diffuser has a slightly higher price point than the GreenAir. It does come with a separate filling cup (not really necessary since you can just use any cup to fill it up). Both come with a bottle of essential oil (this one was lavendar and I think the same came with the GreenAir, but I cannot remember).The PureGuardian has fewer pieces than the GreenAir. It has a "funnel" top over the base and then the green cover.  The GreenAir does have a few small parts including a top that can rotate to change the direction of the mist. The PureGuardian needs the entire unit to be turned to change misting direction.The green cover is pretty, but it does make the colors different and makes it more difficult to see if the diffuser is working. The white cover on the GreenAir means that I can see the water level without removing the top.Overall I would say they are fairly equal, but I prefer the lower price of the GreenAir and I like that it has a white cover that blends in a little better than the Green.

My husband is very happy with this set. He says it is nice with everything that you need for simple stuff. The case is nice so that it is easy to keep in the car or toss in the car when you have a job to do on-the-go. We have a rental property and are in need of a tool kit for fix-ups and this is perfect for the kit.Well constructed, easy to switch out, and a good set for the price.

My 4-year-old loves Batman (and pretty much all superheros, but Batman is his favorite). Superheros are the thing right now with all his friends at preschool. When this arrived he went crazy. He pretty much has not let go of it even though his little brother (2.5) also wants to play with it and he is supposed to share it. I mean, what is not to love about it? A cyber dinosaur and a superhero combined is too cool for kids.Note that this DOES NOT come with the Joker. I get a little annoyed when the stock pictures of toys include other pieces that are not included in the set. This only has the CybeRex figure and Batman. It also have 4 discs that Batman can shoot at villains (sold separately).This is going on my list of possible birthday gifts for my son's friends. If you need a gift for a 4 or 5-year-old boy, this is a perfect gift! I cannot speak for older boys because I don't have one, but the younger boys love it! Even my 2.5-year-old has fun with it.

We have a few of the Disney Cars & Planes Track sets already, so this fits right in. This one frustrated me the most, though. It was a pain to put together--I put the stickers on wrong (the fire ones go on the outside curves, the water on the inside) and once you put them on, they are impossible to get off. I needs to stay put together most of the time unlike other ones that are easy to take apart and put back together (similar to train tracks). It is fairly bulky, so I'm not a fan of not being able to put it away when not in use. I also am not a big fan of the fact that you really need to buy more sets to make this more fun.As for the kids, they love it. My 3 kids are all love Dusty, so this is new and fun. What is nice is that you can buy another small set to add to it to make it "new" again. The kids love cars and driving them over whatever they can so I like being able to keep it all in one set.As a parent, this is not a favorite, but I still really like these sets. I'm disappointed that only Dusty is included when they picture lots of other vehicles on the set. It would have been nice to have at least one of the RVs included since they are a big part of this scene in the movie.So, while I like these sets, I would recommend checking out some of the other ones first. The kids will love this, but it will need a lot more to it to keep it fun. Since we already have more sets, it fits in well with our set.

I use a Dymo 160 and usually use the white/black labels. Sometimes I want something a little brighter to stand out and these pink/black and green/black are perfect.  They work well...the same as all the other Dymo tape I have used. They are a bit more expensive, so they are best for the less common use to just stand out.

I've done a bit of juicing, but pretty basic stuff. This book is full of great information for the beginner! It tells you everything from what each fruit/veggie/nut/etc. does for you to how to store each of them and how long. It explains the basics of juicing and how it can help your ailments.I'm happy to finally have all the information in one location instead of hunting all over the internet for the same stuff. Great for us as we start juicing more.

2.5 stars rounded up to 3I have a FitBit Charge that I have been using for about 3 months. Here is my take on the comparison with the UP3 by Jawbone. The short of it: FitBit wins hands down. Unfortunately the UP3 is lacking in a few important ways.1. The FitBit has a display so you can always see where you are in your daily steps, calories, stairs, and more. The UP3 has no display and only has little lights to let you know if it is in active mode or sleep mode. To view any of your current stats you need to check your app-- it does not even work on your computer, so if you don't have a smartphone or tablet, you are out of luck (my father-in-law does not use either, so it would be difficult for him and he LOVES his FitBit).2. The UP3 only tracks your steps in active mode. No flights of stairs, no calories, nothing. It does not track steps well, either. I had both my FitBit and UP3 on for 2 days and the UP3 was consistently THOUSANDS of steps behind. One day the UP3 tracked just over 6000 steps and the FitBit had almost 10,000. That is a huge difference. I trust the FitBit more as I have watched it as I was walking and it was calculating the steps correctly.3. The benefit to having a tracker like this is the social aspect. Challenge friends and get your steps up. I have about 25 friends with FitBits. I have ZERO friends with a Jawbone. So the only person I can challenge is myself. I have no social interaction at all with the UP3.4. While the app is okay, it completely drains the battery on my phone. The UP3 syncs through the phone, so the app is always on and connecting to the UP3. I did not have this kind of trouble with the FitBit and it can also be synced using the computer so I don't need to have my phone.5. I was interested in the heartrate monitoring on the UP3. Well, it only checks your resting heartrate when you take it out of sleep mode in the morning.6. The FitBit is less expensive than the UP3 and it has a lot more features.While the UP3 is lacking, it still does have positives.1. I like the coaching tips. The app will give you tips each day that are helpful.2. The sleep tracking is excellent. It far exceeds the FitBit's sleep tracking. While I am not keen on the awake time of the UP3, I love the sleep mode tracking.3. It is smaller and lighter on the wrist. It is comfortable to wear, but the slider doesn't seem to stay put all the time.So, overall I would recommend the FitBit over the UP3. A few fixes would make the UP3 a huge improvement. I think it has the possibility to be as good as the FitBit.

Super cute table runner that is perfect for Halloween or any spooky event. It would also be nice for a Spiderman themed party (my 4-year-old loves superheros, so this would have been cute for his birthday). It is a decent quality and for the price is a great deal. It would look best on top of a white cloth, but I put it on my dark wood table and it still looks nice. I'm excited for Halloween to have this out as a decoration.

We love the Contigo brand water bottles in our house. Our kids (2.5 twins and 4-yr-old) all have the straw style Contigo cups right now. I'm trying to move them away from the straws a bit because they tend to chew on the straws and tear them up (the 4-year-old is the worst with this). I first gave this to my 2.5-yr-old girl and she had a little trouble with it. She is trying to learn to push the button while drinking, but not quite getting there. I have a feeling she will figure it out in a couple of weeks, though.  My 4-yr-old took to it right away and had no trouble.I love that there aren't a lot of parts to it and it is easy to clean. The kids can carry it easily and once they are able to master pushing the button and drinking, it is perfect! I'd say 3 is the right age to start this type of cup for most kids.

Very nice sturdy cable. I like that it is short because it keeps it from getting tangled up. I wouldn't mind another inch or 2, but this is good for the car (can't use it while driving anyway) or my charging station. I use this for both an iPhone 5 and an iPad mini.It is a little on the pricey side and I am not completely sold that the extra cost is worth it.

We have used other Zak! designed placemats (Cars, Jake & the Neverland Pirates, Doc McStuffins, etc) and we love them. My daughter is a big Frozen fan and she loves her new placemats! They are just the right size for her spot at the table. The colors are bright and she loves Anna, Elsa, and Olaf. I don't put them in the dishwasher and just do a wipe off or quick wash in the sink.

This is a large size lemon extract that will last a long time. I do a lot of baking and love making lemon bars and other lemon flavored eats. I used to have a lemon tree that produced the most amazing lemons, but since we moved a year ago I have been forced to use store bought lemons/juice/extract. This is a wonderful smelling extract that works in all my baking.I trust McCormick's and I will get more when this runs out a while from now.

I have been using reusable bags for a few years now. A year ago I moved from a city that had banned plastic bags so I had to have my reusable bags or be forced to pay for a paper bag. I have tried the cheapo ones that you can get from the store at checkout ($1 or so) and they always fall apart quickly at the seams when a little too much is stuffed in them. I like the ones that fold up really small, but they aren't always super sturdy.I really like these bags! The purple colors are very pretty. The bags are sturdy and can hold a fair amount of groceries. They are a little narrower than I would like. If they were about an inch thicker, I would be totally in love with them. I like that these are going to last for quite a while and not fall apart when a big box gets shoved in near the seam.

I have tried out quite a few different wi-fi cameras (including motorola, d-link, and foscam). I've been using Foscam for quite a while as baby/kid monitors to keep track of my 3 little ones in the house while home and away.They do take a bit of work to set up for viewing while away from home and I have older ones that do not have recording capabilities.The FLIR FX camera is relatively simple and versatile. I set this up to keep an eye on my front door and entryway. It has a large wide-angle view, so even though it does not pan it covers the entire area that I wanted plus a bit more. The picture is clear and bright (better than my foscam cameras).While it is nice that the camera can be used for other purposes (a "go-pro" type camera on a helmet or such, a dash-board camera, etc), once I put this up as a security camera and set up "zones," I do not intend to move it around and use it for other things.My only disappointment is that there isn't a way to access the camera on my computer at this time. I do have the app installed on both my Android phone and my iPad and haven't had any trouble with the apps.

I've been sewing for most of my life. I sew nearly every day and sell some of my creations. I also have a number of friends who want to learn how to sew and want me to teach them.This is the perfect beginner's sewing machine. It is simple without any extra bells and whistles like so many of the machines out there. You don't choose the tension or the stitch length or anything. Just pick your stitch and go.I love how compact and light the machine is. It is at least 3-4 inches smaller than my Kenmore machine that I have been using for 10 years. It is very light to carry, which makes it very portable. I do "crafternoons" with friends where we all gather to do our individual crafts (sewing, knitting, scrapbooking, needlework, etc.) and this is the perfect machine for those activities.Directions were easy to figure out how to get it set up with the bobbin and top thread to get things started. Stitches looked beautiful and the machine is not too loud (my older machine needs a little tune-up and can be a little loud sometimes).I plan on using this as a backup machine and also to teach friends how to sew.

We love Contigo water bottles in our house. I have 3 kids under 4 and they all love the smaller 14-oz version of the Striker. It is relatively spill-proof, but as any parent knows, kids will find a way to get water from any container to dump on themselves, the floor, their sibling, the dog, etc. These do make it more difficult, though.I like this size for my oldest on longer days since he is prone to drinking lots and lots of water. I also like this size for me because it fits better in either the diaper bag or my purse without weighing the bag down too much. In fact, I have claimed this one as my own before the kids can get a hold of it since I like the color/print and the size for short trips out.

I have another car seat bag that I had to work to get our Britax Marathon to fit in well. This one, on the other hand, I had no trouble getting the Britax in with plenty of room to spare. I also tried our Cosco Apt 50 (which, by the way, is super light making it great for traveling!) and it fit as well with both width and height available.Traveling with car seats is quite a pain, but this makes it a little easier to carry as well as giving the seat a little protection.

I love the Contigo water bottles. We have tons of them in our house. I have the older insulated ones (that are for hot & cold) and am not overly fond of their shape and they aren't as comfortable to hold (I tend to use them mostly for water, so I don't need one that works for hot). I really like this one and the Contigo Autoseal Fit Trainer. They both keep water cold for a long time (I put ice in it and it was still solid after a few hours).This one is similar to the non-insulated Jackson water bottle with the large opening in the middle. The lid pops open with the button on the front which can be locked so if you had kids (like me) that like to push buttons, they can't open it.

I love Contigo water bottles. I have quite a few of them, but haven't been a big fan of the insulated bottles they have had because they are smaller and a different shape than the regular water bottles. This one is just the right shape and it works the same as the Cortland water bottle with the cap and the push button in the back to open it.Works great for keeping drinks cold. My only problem that I had is that it leaked at first. I needed to work at getting it threaded right and on tight enough. Otherwise, I love it!

While these are much thinner than I expected, they cling really well to a variety of surfaces. I got these to use around the house with my kids. They like to draw on lots of surfaces and these help keep them somewhat "contained" to a specific surface. I can put these up in the room I am in and give them a drawing surface instead of a wall.  They easily go on and off without sticking (they really do just cling) Making it so this package will last a while.A stand alone white board is preferable when you plan on staying in one location, but these are perfect when on the move.

I had a two week old kitten and all the cat boxes i had in the house were toot all for him to get into, so i got this, and he took to it right away. Surprisingly several of the other cats seem to enjoy using this one too. I do think they could have designed the way the edges connect better, but overall i havn't had any urine spilling out and the little cat stairs do collect alot of the cat dirt before they come out. Overall i'm very pleased with the purchase, and the filter on top is a nice touch, as it really does help to keep all the odor inside.

Ok, this thing is huge and it's expensive. But i have very gusty winds in the afternoon, and looking at some of the other cat houses they look like they would all end up in the neighbors yard. This thing is so awesome, and my cat has taken to it very well. I live in california, so i don't think i have to worry about the condensation problems that others have been having. I did put a brick on it to make sure it doesn't go anywhere though, but so far it's doing it's job.. and looks good in the backyard.

Originally i bought these to train my cat, but this thing is bigger than i thought it would be and it has no "trigger", as it is a pump action squirt gun. It just shoots out too much water to be any use as a cat training device. This might be better suited for ginormous dogs. I do have a pool though, and the kids seemed to love it, so i let them play with it.

I can't believe no one can make a simple squirt gun anymore. I bought this literally 2 weeks ago to help train my cat, and the first day it worked fine, but now after 2 weeks, the pump/trigger has become so stiff i'm unable to use it anymore. Plus anyone who wants to know if it leaks, it does. I just kept a paper towel under it. I had bought 2 of these and both leaked, but not really badly i just make sure to prop it up slightly. Honestly if i had thought about it, i guess now i'm just going to buy a regular spray bottle Tolco Empty Spray Bottle 8 oz. Frosted Assorted Colors and i'm sure it'll work better and be more versatile than this thing.

Great syrup, and buying in bulk isn't a problem for me. I use this to make my own cranberry juice from "Lakewood" pure. This way i can control the amount of sugar in my cranberry juice. I also use this for making my own lime-o-nade and a mexican beverage called Jamaica (Flor de Jamaica). Much easier to get a good product without having to wait for table sugar to fully mix in.

1:37 MinsI Wasn't sure my cat Lucky would like this toy, but turns out to be one of his favorite. He also continues to use it at least once a day. What i wasn't expecting was that my older cats would love this too.It comes with catnip, which all the cats seemed to like, but for the most part, they ignore the scratching part, and just use the ball to play with.
what can i say, these are the best chairs ever made.

I have dual Asus 23 ips monitors, and i wanted to get a nice clean looking desk. These are ok, but there is no way to adjust the panels in a clockwise/counterclockwise direction. So on one side my monitor is slightly drooping while the other is straight and looks perfect. No amount of fiddling seems to adjust this, so i'm stuck with a slightly lopsided monitor on the left.. which isn't super noticeable, but it's there.

This flag has been flying outside my house for a year now, and it still looks as good as the day i bought it. I live in an area where every afternoon it's super high winds, and sometimes we get really heavy gusts which normally shreds cheaper flags. I will totally buy another one of these flags when i need it.

I'm somewhat of a flashlight-o-holic and have edc'd (every day carried) a flashlight for years now. I laugh at the days when i would carry my light and worry if my cr123 batteries were going to fail. This thing is perfect. It's bright, it remembers my settings, it's easy to recharge and most of all it's the perfect size. I think the only thing i wish is they have a clicky tail version but somehow keep the magnetic rechargeable tail too. :PAnyway, so far i've had this everyday for two months, and no problem, i carry in my pocket, and haven't had any issues with it. The only one draw back i had was with the clip. As far as i'm concerned the clip sucks. I removed mine and replaced it with a spare one i had from an old flashlight i had and now it's perfect.

I drive a lot and seems like my windshield is always dirty and as  a result, i run through windshield wiper fluid pretty often. This is a great deal. I also can tell this is very effective, because i was using water while i was waiting, and after i went through the water (which did not work nearly  as well), this fluid really is great at degreasing and removing dirt.
Really easy installation, great looking. Will probably order more for another room.
Great Flag, and very well constructed. Feels tough, and am very pleased with it.
"The Single Bulb" works great in my Craftsman Light. Too bad i thought i was getting 10 bulbs because of the description (It says Case Size: 10).
purchased August 19, 2014, broke September 11, 2014. Cheap Plastic.do yourself a favor, and do what i did. Just use zip ties, they do a better job than these.

I bought this in Oct 2012, and wanted to leave a review for other 2012 Nissan Frontier truck owners. The things you are probably concerned about are:- works with Utili-Track System / even the truck extender- keeps rain out (i live in CA, but i have gone through the car wash once or twice a month with no leaking)- Leather still looks great 2 years later.- Very easy to use / very convenient- Straight forward to install (if you watched the video on youtube)So why no 5 stars?The downside to living in California is the brutally hot summers. I park my car out in the open during the days and the internal temps can get to around 115-120 (maybe higher, that's just what i see on the temp display in the cabin). So one day i opened the back of the truck, and i can see that glue holding the the felt liner that is on the undersides of the tonneau must have softened/melted in the heat and caused the felt liner to separate from the metal portion of the cover. Ever since that day, the felt just hasn't been the same, it's out of place, and most times loose. This is still just a slight problem, as the cover still functions.The 2nd problem is probably similar to the first. The rubber seal that you stick to the truck bed shifted due to the glue melting. so there wasn't a tight seal anymore causing a whistling noise that i eventually figured out. (it didn't make noise when the tonneau was rolled up, only when it was down. So i removed the tonneau and i saw the rubber seal drooping slightly into the truck. I just went to home depot, and replaced it with a 1 inch peel & stick insulation foam and put the tonneau back on, and haven't had a problem since.As for keeping the tonneau looking shiny and new, i used Armor all the first couple months,  but switched to using  303 Aerospcae Protectant instead after reading many reviews. This has less shine, but really does seem to be magic on leather and plastic.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004YJQE0SI also wrote up a more wordy review when i first bought the product, and posted it on my blog @ survialpaladin dot comIf i ever need to buy a replacement cover i will most likely buy another roll-x from BAK industries, this simply has been the best cover i've ever used and the convenience it offers is well worth it.

I hate this product.I bought this by accident thinking it was my old "gravely" favorite, but when i poured it out, i had a serious wtf moment. Since i already had it poured out i gave it a try.  And of course it's NOTHING like original grape nuts. After tasting it it, it has a very long lingering aftertaste that i can only describe as "corn pops".CONS:-------------- presweetened- has oil??- terrible aftertaste- has more fat and calories per serving than normal grape nuts, and this is fit?PROS:-------------- if you hate normal grape nuts, you might like this.

pros: - fast shipping - very bright SPOTLIGHT - No heatcons - very pricey compared to others - not a FLOOD light. - color (very warm color, not clean white color) **** To be fair, i did not penalize this product on color, because it is clearly stated in the description, any negatives came stricly from the "floodiness" and price.If you're looking for a real bright true FLOOD light, that has a cool white color, then buy the par38 bulb from LEDwholesalers. it's item # B005CDACYYit is cheap, you get 2, and it's brighter and super floody compared to this.

I have bought several other types, and so far this is my favorite AND cheapest.Pros: - You get 2 for the price of 1/2 of the others. - These are bright, with a "cool" color and closer to true white. - These are ACTUAL FLOOD and not spotlights like many of the other bulbs. - No heat!Cons:- These are slightly shorter than my older bulbs so they are sunken in compared to the clf type bulbs i had before.At first i was really worried that because it looked like a smaller diameter circle where the leds are compared to some of the others, but these output so much light, they're fantastic. They're totally just as bright as any halogen bulb, maybe even brighter, and these don't generate any heat.
I bought the matching front panel with 2 usb ports, and a startech 3.5 mounting kit, and everything went in easy, and installed easily. Great product!

These gummies are harder than you might expect, and plus i personally didn't like the flavor all that much, although it was mild enough not to be that big of a problem. I guess i was just hoping these were going to dissolve easier or something, but there are sub lingual b-12 tablets that i think are better than these. I probably will keep using these till i'm out and not buy them again.

I've always used armor all and kept reading things about how it sucked, and it was actually bad for leather. So i picked this up, and have to say i'm liking it alot. The shine isn't as shiny as armor all, but it keeps my leather looking brighter longer. I had just got a car wash, and applied it to my tires / inside of my truck / and my tonneau cover and of course later that weekend it rained. But it's been a couple weeks and the tonneau still looks shiny. I also applied it to my garbage can lid as a test (because it looked horrible before) and sure enough the vinyl looks fantastic (almost new if it wasn't for the scratches the lid had). Plus we leave our garbage cans outside all the time, so it's holding up very nicely.

This figure looks good, but i believe this is a  25mm figure, and most current figures are 28mm (larger). So this figure ends up looking slightly smaller compared to the newer D&D figures. Still this might make a good halfling or young female axe wielder character.

This is just a great figure. it's 28mm scale and is larger than the old 25mm d&d minis. The one thing to note is the bow will probably be curled up when you get it. Just need to use a blowdryer to reshape the bow out.
28mm figure, and it looks great. When i received mine, he was leaning back too far, so i had to take a blow dryer and warm it up and push it back into a standing position again.

28mm figure - This is probably one of my favorite figures to date. I typically play fire sorcerers so this guy fits in perfectly for that character. Even though the face on mine is missing eyes, the coat detail is great. Mine came with a black paint wash, which just made his coat seem even more detailed.
28mm figure - I wasn't sure what this character was at first, but turns out he's an orc or half orc character. The staff on mine is very curved, and even using a blowdryer on it, still kinda curvy.

25mm - This is a great figure. keep in mind that this is a purple version of the knight, but the one pictured is blue/red. Only sad part is this figure is 25mm scale and looks slightly smaller than his 28mm adventuring buddies.
28mm - pretty good figure. The nice thing about her, is the bottom of her staff is actually connected to the bottom of the cape keeping it from bending.
25mm - unfortunately this character is just too small compared to the newer 28mm figures. he comes off more of a halfling than an elf.

These things are great. I have used caffeinated gum before these, but at a fraction of the cost, these things work just as good without all the extra chemicals the gums have.  I keep one in my vehicle, and another one in my desk at work, and use them all the time. One pill will start working within 5 minutes, and doesn't give me any jitters.
I ordered these overnight delivery, and the temp wasn't even that hot when i bought these, and yet they came ruined from heat exposure. What a waste of shipping.

If you expect this to be a straight up gasoline replacement in winter, you might be in trouble when you need it. There are definitely things you need to know about this product in order to count on it. So lets say you run out of gas in your car/boat/lawnmower.. the way it works is when you fill up the tank with this solution, the theory is, that your car(or other device) is warmed up, and there is enough residual gasoline in your lines to "spark" the rest of the solution, thereby allowing you to run on this fuel until you can reach a gas station and refill. This product has a 105F degree minimum flash point that it needs to achieve before it can take a spark and run off of. So if you run out of gas in the winter.. and you wait too long.. your car might get too cold for this to be effective. Also, trying to run it direct without any other type of fuel might not work either unless you have a way of preheating the solution over it's flash point. As for it being safe to store on hot days, this is a quote from the FAQ of the manufacturer:"extraFuel develops less pressure than a container of orange juice when exposed to high temperatures. The vapors are not explosive. The only way it would catch fire, would be when raised to a temperature above its flash point and if the fuel were exposed to a spark or a flame. However, ExtraFuel is packaged in a bottle where the mouth of the container is heat sealed with foil seal, protected by a child safety cap. That makes it difficult for a spark or flame to get near the liquid. This product is not flammable. "also, don't throw away the cardboard paper thing that comes attached to the extrafuel, that is actually a funnel that you can use when you need to pour it into your gas tank. I almost threw it away thinking it was just some advertising tag.here's a link to the rest of the FAQ:[...]
the build quality seems a little flimsy, but it worked to replace one of my power supplies that i lost. Just make sure to read the instructions and get the right polarity and voltages.

I don't have the gps/dvd upgrade in my truck for the audio system, so i didn't want to go out and buy an expensive head unit with android support and a lcd screen only to integrate my phone. I listen to a lot of pandora and audio book mp3's, and really needed a way to hook up my phone to the truck. Originally i was thinking about using some kind of bluetooth method but this turned out to be the best option. I have the phone mounted in the top center of the dash, and i kept the cable tightly wrapped, so the cable is neat, and runs straight down the side of the center dash to the EXT input and cigarette lighter. I also have the extre large sized battery and case on my phone, and this thing works great. I'm not going to lie.. the battery+case do make it a tad snug to fit into it, but you just have to squeeze it down and it''ll fit.  If you drive over rough roads, it could jolt it out a little, you'll just need to squeeze the phone back down into place, and everything will be fine. But i now get to use pandora everyday, and having the phone in the center makes it easy to use the navigation and calling features. Overall this is a fantastic dock for my truck.

i don't have my computer connected to these, or use it for anything other than playing on the xbox 360. But i have to say these are absolutely great, with only a few downsides. The one major downside for me, is i have a big head, and these things are like head-vices after hours of playing. they're just tight on my head. Being wireless you should also be aware that they are going to weigh about twice as much as other wired headsets. The earpieces are ok.. but i wish they had went with a better type of padding on the earpieces , maybe something similar to their 720's (i have a pair of them as well) instead of the foam & leather type material that they use. Overall though, these were just what i was looking for... wireless... great sound.. great integration with halo 4 and the batteries last a long time and even when they die, it's super easy to swap out batteries and keep playing. I would totally recommend these. If you are looking for a cheaper wired version, i recommend the Astro A40's, but if you are looking for a wireless option, i recommend these.

I'm 6'3" and 350lbs and the 4xt fits perfectly. The only downsides are what others have commented, in that the sleeves are slightly long, which in my opinion isn't a bad thing since the sleeves have elastic to keep them tight to your wrists. The colors are slightly off from the interior of the hoodie compared to the exterior so you'll get a two-toned look if you have the hoodie opened. Also as others have stated the hood does seem large, but i wear a baseball hat most of the time, so this doesn't bother me so much. It is warm, without being suffocating. I've been using it for two weeks so far, and seems great.

i bought these to throw into my hiking bag, and also carry one on my Condor H2O Pouch in a Maxpedition 26 inch Expandable Baton Sheath. I'm not so sure why everyone is so in love with boiling water, or carrying large pumps, or waiting along time using various types of water treatment pills/iodine. why not just get the dirty water and slurp it up using this. it's so easy. :)I wish they could get the same micron count and just make it a tad smaller, like by 1 inch, but other than that, it's still pretty awesome all around.

I bought 2 of these for my computer, and also have an xbox hooked up to one. Out of the box these things are great. Very sharp, very bright, i had minimal leakage on the edges, not that i even notice. One thing though, that the colors are on the "cool" side, but you can adjust them to be warm, but i actually like the cool settings better. The input switching seems kinda crappy. When i had my dells, it auto switched from HDMI to DVI when i turned off my xbox, but these just go dark, so you have to manually switch back to DVI. I've been using these for a couple months now, and am really happy with them. The only downsides are no adjustable stand, and no usb on the monitors.. but hey.. i didn't buy these for those items, i bought it for having great resolution, and it has totally helped relieve eye strain. I also play halo 4 on these and it's fantastic. It's what most gaming venues use.

Ok, i was trying to look for some real authentic olive oil, after hearing all the scandels in the news about the olive oil mafias and how they corrupt all the U.S. oils by diluting them partially (or almost all) with other types of oils. So of course i ignored all the other negative comments on here, and bought this. Sure enough, it passes all the "real olive oil tests" like being able to burn it, and seeing the thickness... so on..  but man, it is soooooooo bitter. If this is what real olive oil tastes like, i'm guessing i'm going back to the fake stuff. Also, some people have stated that they can't find this in stores, but i have found it here @ whole foods, and Mothers market here in southern california, for about the same price though.

I really love these mesh shirts. They have 3 buttons which i love. Most big guys shirts have 2 buttons, which is dumb, and makes me feel like i have tons of neck space open.. I suppose it's good if you wear alot of neck jewelry, but i do not.Also note that this is a great shirt to keep you dry. The polyester micromesh wicks away sweat and keeps you feeling dry(er) than normal all day long.I normally buy underarmor shirts for sports or hiking, but now i use these shirts instead and they're cheaper and feel thicker and more durable. The underamor shirts tend to feel really thin, while these have a more substantial feel to them.I also like that they're plenty long enough already in the normal sizes. So unless you really are super tall don't buy the "Tall" versions, otherwise they'll be too long.

Before i bought this i already knew that it used the micro hdmi connector. It's kinda silly since it has plenty of space for a standard hdmi plug next to the 3 standard usb plugs and audio connector. My review isn't about the description, but it's about the actual product.I am upgrading from an old Droid original, and this dock is lighter than the original droid dock, but i haven't had an issue with it. I bought the  Motorola Standard HDMI Cable for Motorola DROID X, ATRIX 4G, and XOOM and it works perfectly. I hooked up my keyboard and mouse and audio to this, and it displays out to the tv just fine.Be warned though, that there is limited resolution support, so if you have a high resolution monitor, you might not be happy with the lack of upscaling. The display will look stretched and blurry on a widescreen high res monitor. But on tv's, it works really well and looks great.Also note that i bought the TPU-Cases Matte Back Black Flexible TPU Case for Motorola Droid Bionic 4G (Verizon) ~TPU-Cases Retail Packaging~ and it fits great in this dock. The dock allows you to remove an insert and it creates more room for the phone + case.I really like that they now have the audio output on the dock instead of having to connect it to the phone like the original droid.Overall i'm really happy with this dock, but was well aware of it's shortcomings before buying.

Just picked up the new Droid Bionic, and got a couple of these cables and they work great. You can really tell that these cables are high quality, and no problems plugging it into my TV and into my computer monitor.

There are already many great reviews about this case on this page, i just wanted to let people know that thisalso fits very nicely into the droid HD dock. You can remove the insert on the dock and it fits perfectly.It doesn't even add that much thickness, and yet i know this case is going to last the life of the phone. I also suggest picking up a screen protector and you'll have a perfectly armored phone that still fits into the dock.

I originally was going to say this was a great light for the price, but really, this flashlight is THE BEST in it's class. I spent a lot of time comparing many other AAA flashlights, and they all fall short compared to this model. Im a huge fan of Fenix flashlights and was going to get a Fenix E05 R2 Flashlight, but it only provides 1 mode (27 lumens). Then i looked at the Fenix E01 Compact LED Flashlight, while cheaper, that too only has one mode (10 lumens). Then you look at the Fenix LD01 Flashlightand that has 3 modes, and up to 80 lumens, but it's 2x the price. So why not save money and buy 2 of these and get the same performance.  The only other flashlight you might consider would be the 4Sevens Preon 1, R5, Flashlight; Black; 70 OTF lumens; 1xAAA which has 6 modes, and 70 lumens, but the bonus is, if you buy the body separately from 4sevens you can change it to the longer 2-AAA size whenever you need. But this too is more money than just getting 2x ITP A3 EOS's. I originally bought the stainless steel version for my EDC, and it has lasted me 5 years and i still use it to this day. Over the years i keep returning to this flashlight and i have bought about 7-8 (black version) of these lights, and give them to relatives, and everyone loves them. Having the multiple light modes comes in handy, as i usually use the brightest for checking in computer cases, behind desks, under my car, and i use the lowest for just walking at night. It's totally the best flashlight, and using AAA's is great. I have several other flashlights that use the cr123's and other mini flashlights, but this is the one that is my go-to flashlight, and my edc (every-day-carry) flashlight. In the past year, the flashlights that i bought have come from either "LightJunction" or "Longhorn Tactical" and it usually takes about 2 weeks to arrive from either. Also please note that if you do buy this, it is possible to use the head on this flashlight in conjunction with the 4Sevens body and endcap, so you can still get the benefits of the preon 1/2 without the additional cost of the head unit.

I have a leatherman Surge, and i hated the big bulky case that it comes with. I also ordered the leatherman surge sheath (#934890) but it too is just slightly taller and wider than this Ti/Xti sheath. The Surge IS slightly bigger than probably was meant for this sheath, but i'm able to fit the Surge, a Pen, and a firestarter in this sheath, along with the saw blade in the hidden pouch behind the multi tool. I have posted pics so you can see what it looks like.

I bought this cooler on May 11, 2011, and didn't receive if until 5 weeks later. "Tool Hardware Shop" was fast to respond to my emails, but did nothing to resolve the issue, and offered no apologies or sorry's for a package lost in shipping. When i finally did receive it, it did not have the waterguard which was originally stated in the description as having. Anyway, now that i've been using the product for a few months, i can tell you that this thing is SUPER LOUD.. like a monkey banging on some garbage can lids. My old water cooler had a refrigerated part, but not a hot part. So i thought this would be a nice replacement, and it's one of the few that had both hot/cold and stainless design. Unfortunately this product is just terrible. It's so loud, period. The good looks and function of this product are totally ruined by the clunker noises coming from this thing. This things engine is like the jalopy of water dispensers. My cats get spooked every time it kicks in to starts cooling, the knocking is so loud from this thing, it's like we're getting raided by the FBI every time the motor starts up. Also, there is tons of condensation on the inside of the bottle. Bottom line is.. if you are deaf, then this is an alright product for you. But if you have any kind of hearing left, this product is way too loud. I can hear it from upstairs in my room with the door closed. The hot water is ok, and so is the cold water. The other drawback is that the ports are kinda short, so my ice trays have a hard time getting under it. I guess my old water cooler was better designed. I just really hate getting a white one, but it seems like i'm going to be stuck doing so. Stay away from this product, and this company.Update - July 12th 2011: Seller contacted me, and offered a refund for the cost of shipping. It could be possible that my experience was a "one-off" and you will have better luck. I still cannot leave a positive feedback for this water cooler though.

Let me start off by saying that i have a big noggin. My head is size 25 1/2 inch around which equates to an 8 hat size. This is typically a size 2xl hat. This balaclava is not even tight on my head (good for me, probably bad for most people). Also, the wool is a fine type material and not super heavy, which is just what i was looking for. I bought this specifically for camping and would wear a heavier 100% wool watch cap on top (DLA 835-2672-9201 , RN 93084). My suggestion is, if you have a large heard, and need a good balaclava, this will do.

I bought this belt in April of 2011, it is now July 2011, and i've worn this belt everyday since i got it. All i can say is, that I really like this belt a lot. I've gone through some weight fluctuations, and this belt is really nice for adjusting. I love it so much, i'm coming back and buying a couple more, and in different colors. I used to wear a solid leather belt before, but the notches never seemed to be in the right place. I would pierce my own hole, but then it kinda of ruins the belt. This belt doesn't have that problem, since anywhere along the belt is a possible location. Be warned, that there is some stretch to this belt, but once you get it adjusted, it will fit just snugly and provide just that slight stretch that you never knew you needed.

This cord lock light is pretty nice, it's not as bright as a mini flashlight but it is a nice clean and bright light good enough to use to find what you are looking for in the dark. The best part is that you can just slap this thing on any of your current backpacks, or jackets and you've got yourself a nifty little safety light. The best part is, if you're running or biking and it's dark, you can throw this on your jacket and just set it on strobe. The only thing i wish this had was a choice of more colors. currently it's only available in yellow, but i'm hoping that they'll come out with an all black version, or even od green or camo.

As a father of a toddler, I like to give my child the freedom to create and draw within reason, as drawing on the walls, is a BIG No No, however he still tries when I am not looking.Personally I love these chalk markers better then dry erase markers because I haven't had one leave any residue behind yet, and all it takes to wipe off the marker is a wet towel.They are easy to draw, and write with, come in an array of colors, 16 in this set, clean up well, while allowing your inner creativeness come out.These chalk markers are a must have for anyone looking to protect your walls from the damage most markers leave behind.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by IPOW for review.
