I have been using these headphones for over a week now, and these are some really nice 'BASIC' headphones that are very different in regards to the included "Neckband" that makes these standard Bluetooth headphones, headphones ware around your neck just like those more expensive 'Magnet' ones that everyone is buying and wearing now days.I really like the concept, however the design could use a little more work, as the part that these headphones secure into is not very comfortable, and the headphones themselves are not very comfortable, and really I was only able to wear them for 2 hours max before I needed to remove them from my ears for a break.I also wish that the volume/charging apparatus was lighter as it does have some weight that causes the headphones to fall out at times, and they tend to apply a slight pressure on the ear from them hanging down.The magnet which is located in the headphones themselves allows for them to be secured when not is use, and the magnet is very good, and works well at keeping the headphones mounted and secured when moving.Overall this is a good set of Bluetooth headphones, that can be used for basic use. The audio is basic, and does not sound 'Full' and 'Rich' at times, and the bass is minimal at best.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by Stoon for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

I have been using this TurnRaise Bluetooth Speaker for 2 weeks now, and it is really good! NOT TO BE SUBMERGED IN WATER.Overall this Speaker is really good, and I have taken it out of the shower and using all over the house. This truly can be used in other locations other than the shower.Where this speaker does fall a little short, is that the music sounds a little 'Flat' or does not really have any 'Bass' or anything else, it just sounds flat and not does not sound as good and 'Full' as other Bluetooth speakers I have heard.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by TurnRaise for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

This is hands down one of the best screen protector I have ever used. It installed so simply. I cleaned my phone screen with the included wet wipe, removed all the dust and moisture with the included soft cloth.I followed the easy instructions and the screen protector simply went right on. Hardly any bubbles, and those that were there came right out. I can't even tell there's anything on the screen. I had a Zagg screen protector on my 6 and it was nice for protection, but it felt odd and it kind of caused some minor distortion.This screen protector feels and looks like the original glass screen of the phone. It fits nicely, though you can see that it's there. It does not interfere with the case I purchased, and it has absolutely no scratches or imperfections at all. I've only used it for a weekend, but so far, I want one of these for every phone and iPod in my house.It does show fingerprints to some extent, but they wipe away perfectly. I assume the glass on the phone would show fingerprints too if it didn't have a protector on it. I mean, smudgy fingers leave prints.I just can't get over the feel of this thing. So smooth and it's essentially invisible.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by Aerb for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

When I ordered this, I thought to myself, "This is probably going to be a disappointment." When I opened it I was amazed. It comes with a nice leather travel case. When you open the case you discover a weighty and well made razor with a lot of chrome to ensure it will not rust. When you break it down into three pieces, even the interior parts are heavily chromed. This razor has a perfect feel in your hand, as well.As this is my first Safety Razor, I looked up on YouTube how to shave with this, (Recommend a video search of Safety Razor, and watching Executive Shaving)Shaving with this was a dream. The angle is just right. The razor is neither too aggressive nor too mild. It shaved me so perfectly on the first pass that I almost didn't need to make a second. The shave was much quicker than my older disposable razor and just as close.Included in the set was a nice Chrome Stand and a brush. The brush is badger brush that is perfect for applying a good lather, and the handle is very comfortable to hold.You won't be sorry you bought this!I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Let me start by saying thanks to BesTrix for sending over a review unit for me to test out.While I have been using thie product for almost a weeks now I must say that I can not say anything negative about this wireless charger. I tested this out on the Samsung Galaxy Note 5, which doesn't require any Wireless Charger Receiver Tag to allow for this to work, and works with the 'Rapid' Charging that is a not supported on this device.The best thing about this is that you can place the device on either 'Landscape' or 'Portrait' mode, as you can see in the photo's provided.The lights, both Red and Blue, are not to bright, and does not disturb the room if you are charging it at night.The biggest reason for the 4 star rating, is that they provided a 12 inch USB cable that is WAY to short to use even for a countertop charger.  I would almost ask they do not send one at all as I have been able to use my existing USB cables, however as it was included in the product, it is affected by the rating.Overall it's a solid Qi charging pad, and works just the way it should. Only wish it supported the Quick Charge that the new Samsung devices support, and that they include a longer, standard USB cable.

This solar powered spot light is great.It's so easy to assemble. Take the screw and bolt to secure the light and solar panel together at the angle you want. No tools needed. You can hold the bolt with your finger while twisting to screw it down to secure.There is a stake included to put into the ground, or you can choose to mount it on the wall with the anchors and screws.Power on with the button at the bottom of the solar panel. (Hi, Low, and off)The LED is pretty bright, even on low. The great thing is you don't have to worry about charging batteries because the solar panel takes care of that.I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

Quality leather in a nice design that optimizes the number of credit cards, ID's, that will fit in this amount of space.It will fit in a front or rear pocket of jeans or men's dress pants. This is a fairly small bag. I'm terrible at estimating meat temperature, and tend to have bloody steaks or hockey pucks as a result. Figuring a thermometer might help me with my end product, I gave this one a try. I've never used a meat thermometer like this before, so I have nothing to compare it with, but it worked well for me. My burgers came out medium for once!I agree with other reviewers that mentioned the small off switch and the fact that there's no auto off here. It's a battery drainer. There is no override to set a manual temperature (I personally don't care, but it's something to be aware of). Other than that, though, it seems to be accurate enough for my needs, and it's wireless and can be carried around on your waistband.I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

This thermometer does what it says it will do--it gives instant temperature readings! It is also much longer than my previous thermometer. I really like the big buttons and the easy to read face. You even have the ability to switch between Celsius and Fahrenheit! The thermometer worked right out of the box and is easy to figure out and use.I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

I was skeptical about the collar working on my Mastiff/Rot mix, but it has been a miracle.We only put it on him when he's going in the backyard, and when our little son is sleeping as to not wake him up. He tends to bark non-stop at our neighbor's dogs when he's in the backyard which can be very irritating to us and our neighbors, and he always seems to be more alert when our son is sleeping to those outside near our house, and tends to bark ALL THE TIME, and it wakes him up.Yes, dogs have a tendency of being protective, and we do not do this to hurt him on purpose, that is why for us, just using the vibration mode only for this review.I've tried the collars that just beep, but the sounds doesn't bother him at all, and tend to make it worse sometimes. Now with this collar, he receives vibration when he barks, and this is perfect as it stops him from doing it, and does not shock him which my wife and I do not want.I think he's only been buzzed once and as you can see in the picture, he doesn't like it at all. Now he knows not to bark when the collar is on. The only problem is he's smart enough to know that he can bark whenever the collar is off.So he still barks in the house since we do not put the collar on him 24/7, but at least he isn't getting on my neighbors nerves, and our little baby is not waking up from 10 minute naps!Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by Ortz for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

This may not be anything like Bose/Beats that is 10 times the price. However, at this price what you get is much more valuable than those.What you do get is a great sounding pair of Bluetooth headphone from MPOW. These sound great and provide good, (Not Great, it is Bluetooth) call-back quality. While my test calls were completed using these, callers did notice a little differences in talking on these and talking directly into the phone.Pros: Good, comfortable ear pads. Sound quality is very good. Build quality is very good. Quick connect/reconnect with Android and iPhone/iOS tested. Able to pick from 3 different ear pads, and ear tips.Cons: Distance from source is 10 meters only without any obstructions. May not work thru Brick walls or steel frames. Two/three walls/doors in office like setting maybe okay. The control buttons are small, so getting used to takes little while. No announcements about remaining talk/play times, however I do like the voice prompt provided with these as it does not sound like the lady is trying to seduce me when talking to me.These earphones are very comfortable even though I have small ears and the sound is good. I wear them while at the gym and while out and about. The bluetooth connectivity is a snap and the battery lasts a long time on just one charge (8 Hours). The bass is really good for ear buds and being that my main listening enjoyment comes from drum and bass music, well, bass is pretty important to me, lol.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by MPOW for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

I have used this router for traveling when only wired internet access is available. Plug the router in, plug in the ethernet cable into the router and it creates a wireless hotspot. So this camera is a great idea, however not executed perfectly. I would suggest if you do not have paper just notify the seller, (Polaroid).The paper is small (2 x 3), and was very easy to place into the camera, and does not require any special ink, and only needs to replace the paper when you run out.Overall the camera is kind of like the old Polaroid, or even disposable camera, as you do not have any way of reviewing the images after they are taken, and as you can see in the photo's posted, the camera doesn't take great images when a toddler is moving around, and also even when I believe I am holding it still, it still did show some signs of blur, when using indoors.This would be a great camera for Teen's or even younger kids that would want to print images out as soon as they take them.I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

I bought these not only to protect myself from credit card fraud and identity theft, but to protect the cards from wear and for my own personal safety. I'm not sure if everyone pays attention to detail but here is my advice.When you open your wallet at the market, store, and other public places, people notice what you have in your wallet. Whenever anybody opens their wallet at the supermarket I always notice how many credit cards and department store cards they have. Now if I pay attention how much attention do you think criminals pay to your wallet.The RFID chips in credit cards and ID cards, holds all of your sensitive info such as card numbers, expiration dates, names, addresses, etc. I did a little research and you can buy RFID readers and writers for $25 from china, I'm not a credit card genius but with all these department stores getting hacked. I think the credit card is a little outdated as far as security.Included is:10 Credit Card Sized Sleeves2 Larger/Passport SleevesIt's reasonably priced and a no brainer for anyone traveling or looking for added security. I tested these out by placing my Citibank card, (RFID Enabled Card) inside the sleeve, and when I tried to use it at a RFID enabled card terminal, (Drug Store) it was unable to read the card inside the sleeve, however when I removed it, It was able to read the chip and process that payment as usual.Sleeves seem to work as designed, and would recommend them to anyone with any RFID cards/licenses/passports to protect yourself.

This is absolutely the best bike mounted phone holder!Inside the box you get the plastic phone mount, and two different colored web style retainer bands (which are very durable), along with the Bike Mount.I take my bike out on on/off road trail rides, and it has had no problems keeping my phone in place while i ride. Which I'm truly happy about because now i don't have to worry about dropping my phone while I'm out. I'm truly impressed. I also like that it has a 360 rotational degree so you can position it any way you want it. Even though I got this product at a discounted rate, I have already placed another order for my wife's bike as she wanted one only after she saw mine.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by iPow for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

I bought this powerpoint presentation to use for a presentation I was completing for a big meeting. I tested it out on my Windows 7 PC and Windows 10 and both worked flawlessly!I didn't read the instructions since I enjoy figuring things out by myself. I noticed that the down button will move on to the next slide and the up button will move to the previous slide. The laser pointer did not work on my computer screens, just hope it will work on the projection screen when I test it out next week.You can not beat the price that is offered here! And it is really small, lights and compact. I moved about 10 feet and it worked just fine, and it proceeded through the slides nicely.The slot on the bottom of the device is great to store the usb which means you do not need to carry them separately.If this review helped you , please click on the Yes below, so i know i am hitting the things you need to know and that my reviews are helping.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by DinoFire for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

I have used this router for traveling when only wired internet access is available. Plug the router in, plug in the ethernet cable into the router and it creates a wireless hotspot. This is what I use this router for the most, as some big name Hotels offer free wired internet, and makes you pay for Wireless connectivity. This keeps you from not getting spoofed to connect to a wireless network that you shouldn't so using this is perfect for anyone on the road!Not only do you get the ability to recharge cell phones and other USB-rechargeable devices but it also has a USB port for inserting a thumb drive and an SD card slot. It is recharged via the included USB cable and that can be can also be used for connecting the device directly to a computer to access files from the SD card reader. My favorite feature is the built-in WiFi functionality. It can stream photos, videos, music, etc. to smartphones or other devices connected to it via the RavPower app. This is an awesome multi-purpose tech tool and it's very light and small to travel with.I really love this device, and I have been using it for 2 weeks, and find it always with me so if I need to share USB information, or recharge my Galaxy Note 5, this is a on-stop shop device that is so user friendly, set up only takes 5/7 minutes total!Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by HooToo for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

I like that it is much better than plastic, but these are a pain in the butt to clean. 5 stars by themselves when clean, 4 stars total when you account for the commitment needed to clean.The only suitable process to clean without a similar commitment to trying to give a cat a bath, is to boiling these in a pan for about 20 minutes. This gets these suckers (literally) clean.Other than the difficulty for cleaning them, these are great straws and I love using them. They do include a brush, however I am not a fan of them, and I don't feel that they get very clean.If this review helped you , please click on the Yes below, so i know i am hitting the things you need to know and that my reviews are helping.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my fair and honest review.

I like this cover for many reasons. I like that it is low profile, covers the entire front and back of the iPad Mini for full protection, and allows the beauty of the front side of the iPad to show through when the front cover is pulled back. I have a white iPad and my prior case covered most of the white area, so you couldn't tell what color it was. Also, because this cover doesn't cover the white "frame" of the front, you have easy access to 100% of the screen. I had issues with not being able to access my entire screen with my prior case.The magnetic feature works well and turns the iPad on and off easily. The folding cover works well, and folds into a triangular shape to allow the iPad to sit at a low or a high angle for 2 viewing options.Love this case, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice, affordable case for your iPad Mini 4.If this review helped you , please click on the Yes below, so i know i am hitting the things you need to know and that my reviews are helping.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my fair and honest review.

I have been using my TaoTronics Car Mount Cradle Holder for about 2 weeks now and I can say that the suction on it works WELL!I have used this with my Samsung Galaxy Note 5 attached with my GhostTEK Case and do not have to worry about the phone coming loose. I have this mounted on my dashboard and I am happy to say it sticks WELL! I have not had any issues taking my phone in and out of the cradle, and have not noticed any issues with it coming loose while staying on the dashboard. I have also placed it on the window in my wife's vehicle and it seemed to be very strong however I can not say how it feels in the long term.I am very satisfied with the TaoTronics Universal Car Mount and would recommend it to anyone looking to have a great cradle at an affordable price.If this review helped you , please click on the Yes below, so i know i am hitting the things you need to know and that my reviews are helping.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by TaoTronics for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

I really loving this new shock collar. Before I got this my dog was out of control and I had to get up every 5 seconds to stop him from chewing something up or going into rooms he's not allowed in, now I don't have to even get up I just tell him no and push a button! This has made my life so much easier!! I'm so pleased and I would recommend this to anyone with a puppy problem!!My wife does not like the 'Shocking' feature so with this collar, it has Four modes:Static Shock - Perfect for training if any Extreme Aggressive actions are observed.Vibration - Great for general attention, and works 99% of the time!Beep/Audible Tone - For distraction trainingLight - I use this for night tracking outdoors, or on a walk/run.I haven't even had to use shock so far I've only had to use vibrate and its been incredible!I received this product at a discount in exchange for my fair and honest review.

These work great! Just take it out of the package slip it on the door where the fold is, and it stops kiddos from getting in. As simple as that. I would suggest buying two, because it only comes two to a pack. These are also great to have when your out and about. If you are using a public restroom and the door has a broken lock, these will fit on top of the door. Preventing it from opening.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my fair and honest review.
Love these replacement LED Bulbs. They are a little longer but we checked the measurements before ordering and knew we had enough room for them. Love the brighter light!

I can't think of any reason not to love this little case. My wife has been looking at a lot of cases before deciding on this one, and so far she loves it! She originally had a slim little case that did a good job of protecting the sides and back of my brand new Galaxy Note 5, but provided no protection at all for the screen against a tiny piece of gravel on the sidewalk, and she wanted a case that would fit her debit/credit cards and ID so that she doesn't have to carry around a large bag.This little case took care of that and some. The case opens easily and closes securely. The magnet closure works so conveniently. The slots easily hold credit cards, identification, drivers license, etc. I haven't had any trouble using the phone with the case. When her phone rings, she opens up the case, and removes the phone so she doesn't have a huge bag up to her ears when talking on the phone. It also makes it super easy to be able to take photo's by just removing the phone from the magnet pouch, when in use.So far she loves this case, and highly recommends it to anyone looking for way to care your cards, cash, ID, and phone all in one!I received this product at a discount in exchange for my fair and honest review.

These collapsible bowls are something that I have never thought of having but are so useful! I often go to the park to walk and run and one of my dogs loves to be on the go with me and loves to run as well. There are times that it's been very hot outside and I haven't taken him due to not being able to have water for him. With the collapsible bowls now I can easily fit one or more into my tote bag or just keep in the car. Along with a bottle of water, he now has the ability to stay hydrated along with me on our summer excursions to the park or anywhere. I received three bowls in blue, orange and red, and each one is a good size for what I need and they are made from BPA free food grade silicone which is awesome because that means they are safe and durable. That also means that they are easy to clean with just soap and water or in the dishwasher.They are so cute and unique that my son loves to keep them for themselves as well!Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by IIyever for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

I have been using and testing this charger for a week now, and as you can see in the photo's this new Fast Chargers is FAST! I really enjoy just placing my phone on the pod, and it charging with my phone inside it's case I have not had any issues just setting it on the pad. I really love the automatic dimming of the light when it's charging so it's not a bright light shining in the room when we are trying to sleep.When you turn off the lights, the LED indicators dim off, so the room is dark when you need it, not glowing Blue/Green when it's placed on the charger. This alone is the greatest thing ever as the Samsung charger glows all night even when it's fully charged, you will see a 'soft glow' but the ChoeTech doesn't have that problem.Included in the box you get:1 x ChoeTech QI Fast Charger1 x Standard USB CableUser ManualI was able to use the 'Quick Charger' adapter from my Note 5 phone, however if not you may want to purchase the product that includes this.

I was nervous about some of the negative reviews, but had to try it......I'm absolutely pleased so far.1 - It fits perfect. I'm wondering if different ears require a special fit, thus some of the negative fit reviews. I can literally work out and jump around and this thing will not fall out and is surprisingly comfortable.2 - Sound was Great! I was nervous I couldn't hear anything....my purpose for this device doesn't include using it to talk with, but for listening only.3 - Pairing was as easy as any other device I'd ever paired in the past; held the button until the red/blue flashed (about 4-5 seconds), it showed up on my phone, hit paired, done in less than a minute. I have a Samsung Galaxy Note 5 and iPhone 6 / 6 Plus used for testing. While I was not able to pair 2 devices at the same time, I was able to easily switch the out by turning on/off the bluetooth device and it automatically pairing, with that device.4 - There isn't a volume control, but thought that was a silly review since you can control the volume from the phone itself, but I suppose having it available on the piece itself, especially while driving, would be helpful....5 - One reason I purchased this was because it was the only ear piece that didn't protrude out of my ear preventing me from wearing a head band, beanie, or leaving it in while I slept for my alarm.6 - Call talk quality was okay, I was able to easily hear the caller, however they can tell I was talking on a bluetooth device, saying that i sounded 'Far Away', but all test calls reported that they can still hear me talking at a normal tone of voice.This is my initial review from just opening, pairing and testing it out.....and don't mind posting later as my concern would be durability and how long it would last. I wish there were more STEALTHY (as one review mentioned) options out there, but I could not find any.

When you first get this, it does look extremely daunting when you look at it laid out flat. However it is very simple to put together. I didn't even look at the instructions, I just put the corrected numbered tabs into the correct holes. Everything came together nice and smooth! I scanned the QR Code and downloaded a few of the games. After playing around with it on and off for a few minutes at a time I started to get a headache, and a little nauseous, however my niece and nephew  LOVED it. They enjoyed the roller coaster and Zombie Games!I have a Galaxy Note 5, and the phone fix inside the case without any issues, and I didn't have to take my case off of it.Please note that this review was done using the product supplied by Kollea, for review. Please know that these reviews are unbiased and are my own personal accounts while using this product.

This lamp was furninshed by Brightech in exchange for this unbiased critique, that said, it's a well designed lamp. The lamp comes  approximately half-assembled and only requires a #2 Phillips head screwdriver and 5 to 10 minutes to complete the assembly. The first thing I noticed is how solid it felt, call me old fashioned but "heavy" indicates a certain level of quality to me ...lol. The light itself is has an excellent bright-to-soft ratio, casts a wide beam and shines evenly  rather than a bright spot in the center and drastically dimmer around the perimeter as is case withe some led lamps and flashlights. The lamp's adjustable head lends versatility and convenience. Now, those factors plus it's almost clinical asthetic, leans this toward perhaps belonging in a doctor's office or crime lab imho. All in all, it "feels" like a lamp tha'll last for years to come and may be fine for some to use in their bed or living room but this is going in my workshop where it'll be most useful.

This is an interesting product, one I'd never tried before so when I offered a sample for review I accepted with curiosity. I've been using this on my beard and mustache for about two weeks now and really love this stuff. Aside from keeping my beard & 'stache looking healthy and smooth, it also has a very pleasant aroma. My facial hair isn't very long so some of this balm stays on the skin, I was concerned about a reaction as I sometimes get w/ "safe" products but neery a pimple developed so that concern is no more! All in all, it may seem pricey to some but if U have a full-on BEARD beard, Mr. Rugged is a must have.

I recieved a sample of this showerhead for review and I really enjoyed it. The shower head's low profile makes it very sleek & stylish. I installed it using an extended standard showerhead pipe which leaves the wide showerhesd leaning slightly. I was worried that this angleing would cause dribble rather than a decent spray but the showerhead peformed well! It actually sprays enough horizontally that it's effective in that offset postition. All in all, really pleased with this.

Bought at my local HD a few months ago for professional use and they've held up to moderate use. I liked the fact that this set  included the short chisel and bull point. There's nothing really "amazing" about the kit, in fact I had to grind the chisel tip smooth as it had burrs and a small chip, a BIT disappointing (pun intended). I've always preferred Bosch, Hilti and Hitachi masonry bits and own a Milwaukee 7 piece hammer drill set that's "made in Germany" and has been excellent. All in all this SDS+ set is just as good and worth the money imho.

I received a sample of this flashlight in exchange for a fair review. I don't just hand out 5 star reviews, I really like this flashlight. I was surprised at the solid feel and weight of this mid-sized flashlight. The main beam comes from a high intensity type LED bulb while the secondary/lamp side is a collection of the soft type bulbs. The flashing red light is visible from a relatively good distance at night, really important in a situation like it's intended for, a roadside emergency at night. The magnet is strong that it holds the the flashlight complete horizontally. I've been using this as my "main" flashlight at work for a month now to really gauge it for this review and it's performed extremely well having proven useful in every situation, from working under a sink to the crawl spaces under the properties. If it breaks I'll buy another one, definitely.

I own a larger JuicyPack 16,000+ miliamp device charger and love that battery but I prefer using this one. The main reason is the stand function, even at less than 1/2 the power reserve as my other Life Charge device it powers my tablet through hours of movies while simultaneously powering/charging one of my small Bluetooth speakers making it a mini, portable entertainment hub. The single LED may seem like a gimmick but has come in handy for finding and orienting those usb cables. All of these features make this battery, (which I received in exchange for review), very impressive AND convenient which is why I gave it 5 stars, (not something I do unless a product really impresses me). At $70 it may seem expensive but I haven't seen anything else like it so imho it'dbe money well spent.

I needed this for professional use and was shopped around for a while looking at many small rotary hammers. Considering that I only needed one for masonry drilling tasks too big for my cordless 1/2" hammer drill and occasional tile demolition anything larger than 1-1/8" was overkill for me. Over 90% of my tools are Milwaukee and looked hard at their 5262 model but decided to go with this one over the Milwaukee because that one is rated 7/8" and 1.8 lbs impact energy vs this one's 1" and 2.5 lbs impact energy. I also liked the fact that this model has vibration dampening modules on the handle. I clocked this DeWalt, w/ a moderately used Hilti 1/2" x 6" TE-CX bit, at 13 seconds to drill a 4" deep hole. I've had it for a few weeks now and demo'ed 2 small bathroom floors easily. It's performed as well of not better than I expected. The case is just "OK", as are all of DeWalt's plastic cases but it DOES have room for alot of bits and acrutements like gloves & goggles. For $200, ($50 more than the 25222k and $20 more than the smaller Milwaukee), it's a solid buy for professional and diy'er alike.

Pretty good case, the magnetic closure is easy to open yet holds well enough that it'll keep everything in place. The card pockets are tight which is actually great because few things suck more that losing a credit card or drivers license. I bought this for a friend that had gotten her S5 and didn't buy a case, she was just putting it in her pocket. When I gave it to her she was skeptical because it wasn't a "protective" type of case but I was quick to point out that it wasn't a "drop protection" case it WAS a SCREEN protective case that's ALSO a wallet that perfectly matched her new Coach bag, yada yada yada, I got a huge hug and a kiss and she's used it exclusively ever since. ;-)

I've owned, used and worn out, literally, dozens of backpacks over the years including more than a few canvas ones. This one has been among my favorites, it's deceptively roomy for it's size and the layout, design, asthetic and materials are excellent. The larger pockets make it ideal for a laptop, books or clothing with the 3 smaller pockets balancing that out. Due to a recent blizzard forcast I decided to pack in orer to spend the night at work. I'm fastidiously bent on being efficient and "ready for anything" so I tend to over prepare. The amount of clothing, toiletries and other odds & ends like cologne, device chargers, flashlight, umbrella, snacks etc, that fit into this smaller canvas bag was pretty amazing. Granted, EVERYTHING was neatly folded, tucked and packed, (as spacial reasoning dictated). Needless to say it was heavy  to the point I worried I'd bust a zipper or strap but nope, the thing held together and, despite it's now swollen appearance, the magnetic clasps on the flap kept it closed (!?), that impresed me. I own another brown canvas/leather backpack the I used for YEARS, and am still very fond of, and this bag is right there with that one in terms of how utalitarian and stylish it is. I paid $50 for my other brown canvas bag which I'd rate 6 stars if I could, I received THIS bag as a complimentary sample for review and at $35 it's a great buy for anyone looking for a solid compact backpack.

I needed a couple of drivers for around the house and didn't want to bring home any of the ones I keep at work so I went w/ this very inexpensive Stanley set. So far so good, the drivers are light weight and the shanks feel sturdy enough to handle moderate punishment. The handles don't feel so tough but hey for the price and household use I can't knock their "diy'er grade" handles. I like that the flathead is fluted, allowing for better hold on those flathead screws. The clip that comes w/ these is great as it keeps them in place and has mounting holes. I popped the clip on the wall inside our utility closet and voila, neatly stored. Not going 5 star on them yet, I'm going to wait a while and see if they rust or break anytime soon.

My wife's 2010 Rav-4 has built in Bluetooth and I really wanted the same awesome convenience in my `08 Honda Element but didn't want to spend $80 or $100 on a Parrot kit or even on an inexpensive stereo w/ BT b/c my radio's fine. Brightech sent me this complimentary kit in exchange for this review and I'm really happy w/ the way it's worked so far. My car has an auxilary audio jack and 12v port so this EASILY jacked in. I wasn't thrilled about losing the 2nd power port b/c I have a lighter in the main outlet and used the second as a charger, that is, until I opened the box and saw that the plug has a 5v 1amp USB port on it, sweet, I can keep my charger! Pairing was a piece of cake and the sound is as loud and clear as the unit in my wife's Rav. I'm ging to continue using it and will go full on 5 stars once I've really put it through the paces and had it longer.

I'm a professional handyman and electrician's assistant/mechanic I'm also predominantly a Milwaukee tools user but always preferred Bosch or Hilti accessories for masonry. I can tell you however that these bits have performed just as well as the afore mentioned names over and over again. My first set lasted over a year seeing mild-to-moderate weekly use, (w/ occasional careful conditioning on a bench grinder). The size selection includes the most common diameters and is ideal for use on cordless 1/2" hammer drills. I also owned a Vermont American set  that's nowhere near the quality of these bits, which by the way are "Made In Germany". The "3 flat secure grip" design of the bigger bits is nice touch as they're prone to slipping in the chuck. Along with the other sizes we get two 1/4" bits as this is the most commonly needed diameter for many smaller masonry fastener applications. I bought another kit a few months ago and will continue to get this set as long as they're available.

This little unit is super convenient as the plug itself IS the Bluetooth  receiver that has a handy built-in  USB charging port to help make up for "robbing" a single outlet. I also own an NBEI Bluetooth receiver that's ok but requires a power source which makes that more of a stationary unit to be placed and left alone while this Brightech device is ultra portable and a breeze to use. I received this as a complimemtary sample for review and have been very happy with the way it's worked as well as the design. Definitely recommended.

These are "just ok" as is but with a little modification they're ultra comfortable. I cut out some pieces of foam I had lying around, (the same kind of generic white foam that's in these), and inserted it into the knee pads adding a second layer of padding. I don't need knee pads every day and so didn't want to spend $30 or $40 on premium pads and went with this >$10 pair. After using this type of knee pad on rough surfaces like concrete or rocky dirt the hard plastic develops gouges that can scratch some floors so be mindful of the plastic's condition. Aside from that the plastic does provide great protection. I've used them sparingly since getting them and can't complain, they stay on, don't slip much and feel good enough to wear for hours w/o much discomfort. The biggest downer on these, to me, is that the hook & loop on the straps is going to wear out eventually but with pieces of velcro I have and a little tethering, easily fixed when it happens.

I'm predominantly a Milwaukee tool user and being they are the originators of the reciprocating saw they make the best ones on the market and so I wanted to get a Sawzall but got a great deal on this DeWalt so I jumped on it and I'm not at all disappointed. I own 3 cordless reciprocating saws, (M12 Hackzall, V18 Hatchet Sawzall & Bosch 18v Lithium), but I needed corded power and this saw, at 10amp and a 1-1/8" stroke length, delivers the power and aggressive cutting speed I require on all my demanding demo and cutting applications. With a good metal cutting blade, ie: Diablo or MIlwaukee, 3" steel pipe is cake, pretty much everything I've put this tool to has been a breeze to cut. The vertical and horizontal blade interface isn't a gimmick as some have noted because turning the saw to get a horizontal cut isn't always easy nor feasible. The "cage" around the blade catch collects a ton of debris but is an excellent safety feature and can be easily opened one one side by loosening a single flat head set screw. About 2 months ago the blade catch seized on me disallowing blade insertion but  a quick spritz of Liquid Wrench, (which won't damage the plastic and rubber parts like WD-40 because it's silicone), literally 5 seconds later it loosened right up. I've known a few guys that have thrown out Sawzalls and other reciprocating saws because of that, not knowing they could've just hit them with a little WD-40 or Liquid Wrench. I've put this saw through moderate rigors over the last 6 months and maintained it well but will upgrade to 5 stars after some really heavy use.

I was shopping for a stubby driver set for professional, daily use and chose this becuse of the ratcheting feature and price point. Stanley is a great name in tools but I always viewed it as "homeowner" grade like Black & Decker, (the Stanley Proto line is a whole other beast however). I put a 2" extension on it and have used it as my tool belt, go-to screwdriver over the last few weeks and it's held up so far. They cap holds 7 bits and grips the extra bits tightly which is great because other "pro-level"/"premium" multi bit drivers I own can't hold the bits in place and the  rattling bits inside the handles are just annoying. So far I like this driver and even if I destroy it next month it's inexpensive enough that it wouldn't mattrr much.

The lovely (but PICKY) wife needed new Winter boots and I picked these to surprise her. I've bought her several shoes boots and sneakers in the past here on Amazon and I'm either lucky or gifted at knowing exactly what she'll love. These boots were another score, she opened the box and said "ooh!, wow they're sexy". They fit her loose at first as her foot kind of "swam" inside the boot but I put an extra insole in them and are now not only do they fit snugly around her foot but they're more comfortable with the extra cushioning. She's now worn these through 2 snow storms, a few 20 degree days and a recent cold rainy day and NO complaints. I have to agree with her initial comment about these being sexy, they look great on her and her in these. I didn't rate these at 5 stars simply because they're still new and we have no idea how they'll hold up.

Full disclosure, I recieved this as a complimentary sample for review. That said, I've been using it daily to test it out for this review and I like it alot. It's really easy to use, small enough to throw into a pocket and take everywhere. Most of us have smart phones that feature a voice recorder and mp3 player, so why get this right?...because the phone has to be taken out, the app opened, started and the phone held to record something. I've been using this to record reminders, take notes and remember little things I notice or are funny that I'd otgerwise forget. The mp3 player works well and sounds decent and w/ 8gbs it holds plenty of files. The kit is packed w/ useful accesories like a small microphone, land line jack, 4/3 pin charger and headphones. The menus and functions are almost self explanitory. Understandably the screen is on the small side since this is a compact unit and the backlit display helps out with this. I'll raise it to 5 stars once I've had it for a while longer and fill the memory alot more to see how long it lasts and performs. Overall this little recorder is now one of those things I automatically take everywhere with me, like my keys, wallet, phone, Swisstool, Zippo and now, the recorder too.

I stated on a recent review of Timberlands how I "now buy my sons' shoes 1/2 size larger because I was buying them new shoes every few months". THIS is one of such purchases, the last pair of sneakers I'd bought my youngest I got in his actual size at the time. The problem is that was only in September for "back to school" and already they were tight...lol. Back to THESE, he loved the look, mommy loved the strap and I loved the price. We've bought our kids many Skechers in the past so we know they're more than decent shoes. Considering the extra 1/2 size, (I put an extra insole in them to fill-in the shoe until his foot grows into them), he should have these until the Fall.

I had a NiCad Hitachi 12v batteries and charger laying around for what seemed like forever and decided to get this as a "knock around" drill/driver. I've had more cordless drills than I care to count including the "newer", lithium battery version of this. I say "newer" because this drill, the "OLDER" version blows the lithium version away in power and features. This drill is heavy, it's as heavy and solid as my M12 3/8" drill driver which I dig alot. Call me old school but when I read or hear a contractor saying, "the tool is heavy :'( wah wah wah" I want to respond, " quit your whining and MAN UP, we're big boys now!" :-D. I want to feel like I'm gripping a TOOL not a TOY...;-). I digress, this model comes equipped w/ a lanyard, frontal bit holder and an adjustable hook that has another bit holder built in. Features that may seem gimmicky but are occasionally useful. For under $30 it's a great buy if you already have the batteries.

As a fulltime handyman and part time electrician's assistant/mechanic I often need to work in boiler rooms, crawl spaces and attics and I don't always have the time or desire to go upstairs, downstairs, or back outside to the truck b/c I need this or that. This wrench along with my 7-1/4" Knipex Alligator, Victorinox Swisstool, 5/16" Greenlee slotted & Phillips #2, Sheffield hatchet multi-tool and AA LED Maglite are GLUED to me all day long. Brother, let me tell U my job seems like cake at times. This wrench has been beaten and battered and still grips the $ht even with a few busted teeth on the gator side. The measurement markings are helpful and the wider-that-average gape means less "going out to get a bigger one boss". I own, use and love only a few Bahco tools and all in all they are as heavy a duty, professional grade a tool as I've seen.

I wear an medium or large in jackets so I followed the sizing guide and ordered an XL. I was a little disappointed because it fit like a US "slim-fit" medium so keep THAT in mind when choosing. I considered the holiday weight I'd put on and calculate it's actually a good fit for "normal weight Mike". The zipper is removable, attached to the the inside by a series of buttons, on a cold cold day or night the outer buttons have to be used. The color is exactly as pictured and materials are ok. The jacket is a middleweight, not so heavy but mot too thin, warm enough, w/ a sweater underneath, for Jersey Winters. Overall, for the price, it's a good buy.

I had bought these for my little guy a while back and they've been great so I  ordered them for his brother. The price is exceptional considering the quality of the leather and materials as well as the athstetic of these hikers. I bought these, (and most of their shoes), 1/2 size bigger and throw an extra insole in them, which I'll remove within a few months, so that their shoes, sneakers and boots will last them at least 6 to 8 months. Before doing that I was buying a new pair for them every few months!...but I digress. I take my guys out for walks during light to medium snowfalls here and they haven't complained about wet or cold feet yet. Both pairs have been solid boots at a great price.

I use my tools professionally, I have this Milwaukee adjustable in 10" & 12", I also own a 10" Greenlee (0451-10M) and 2 Knipex Alligators in 7" (8801180) and 10" (8801250E). ALL of these tools are great in their own right. I own over a dozen Knipex tools and swear by them, I also own a plethora of Greenlee tools and a cornucopia of Milwaukee power and hand tools...lol... but this is a review of THIS plier and IT's performance and I love it so far. Quality-wise I'd place it between the Greenlee and Knipex names. As for performance this thing has stood up to everything I've thrown AT it and everthing I've thrown IT at. The weight of this tool, plus the reaming head, make this plier (and the 12") an ideal impromtu hammering device. I love my Knipex `Gators but grab them when more "finnesse" or the need for the groove is involved. These are certainly not as light or crafted as well as Knipex or Bahco pliers but are right there w/ Crescent & Channellock.

This is my thrid ililily cap and it's another winner. My head circumfrance is on the small side for a frame like mine so I'm super picky about caps but this one is dead on. The material is a bit thin but considering the look it's fine. All in all a cool cap for Summer or Winter.

I want to first say that I received a complimentary sample of this speaker in exchange for an honest review. If anyone looks at my review history they'll see that I rate at 5 stars only when a product EXCEEDS my expectations and this speaker does just that. Keep in mind that not only am I describing this objectively and on it's own but SUBjectively and in comparison to 1 other Bluetooth mini-speaker and 1 non-Bluetooth mini-speaker I own. This is touted as a 'shower/bath-time' Bluetooth speaker, which it IS, but it's also an all around "take anywhere" device. The sound is crisp and loud for this size speaker, part of the reason is that the speaker portion is around the perimeter the bottom where the sound actually bounces off whatever surface we place it on, keeping in mind, that acoustically, tile and other materials like it provide a kind of "amplifiying" affect. Battery life isn't bad at all, as I've gone through entire 20 song playlists w/o having to recharge it but I haven't clocked the time per say. The suction cup is pretty cool as it allows me to pop this speaker to many surfaces as opposed to sitting it on a horizontal surface like my other mini-speakers. The reason I view this as a "take anywhere" device as I said earlier, are the call buttons, because of these I take this in my car and to job sites. Overall a reeeally speaker at a reasonable price.

Full disclosure: I received a complimentary red press in exchange for this review. On to the actual review. I'm by no means a coffee aficionado or snob, I am however, a coffee lover and and addict. That said, I'm also an "efficiency" or speed freak and this press delivers on all fronts. I've used an Aero Press for the last couple of years and loved it because the speed and ease of use. The downsides I've found to the Aero Press are that it doesn't have the capacity to make more than a cup at a time and the filter hasto be replaced every time, (essentially a 1 cup/1 filter ratio). Something the Aero Press possesses over this is that I can make espresso with it BUT that's the ONLY advantage. All of that said, this  press has replaced the latter. I love this thing, I zap my water for 45 seconds in the microwave during which time I'll put the grounds in this, get my light brown sugar and cream and fave mug out. Pour my hot water in, stir & wait about 20 seconds, (allowing the water to really grab the oils & flavor), plunge and pour.Another advantage of this is clean up, I just toss the grounds, (flush them down the toilet actually =-O), pour dish soap and hot water back into it and let it sit until I return from work then it's a quick rinse and done, (occasionally I do dismantle and thoroughly clean every part though). My first French press and I'm loving it, thanks Kona!

I've been using this cologne since last year and I have to say that I LOVE this fragrance. It's lasted me this long only because I've been wearing Lacoste, Leu Di Issey and Domain in between but this one IS my scent. This time around I went w/ the combination shower gel package simply because of the price here. The shower gel smells as good as the cologne and the bouquet lasts surprisingly long. On to the cologne, (the rest of the review basically a copy & paste of my original Luna Rossa review) it has excellent balance and maturity, projection is great and, not just the scent, but the 'linger' on my clothes drives my woman "bite her lip" crazy. Some of my other favorites include Leau d'Issey, Dolce & Gabbana (dark blue), Carolina Herrera & Chanel Egoiste Platinum. The compliments I've received on this particular scent have been several and from both men and women. Compliments and inquiries I  receive regarding other scents I wear aren't rare but THIS fragrance seems to have an intangible effect on the females that wander into it's range because I've never had so many woman say how "awesome" I smell. I'm hooked on Prada's Luna Rossa.

I bought this at a local retailer last year and happened to come across it here on Amazon prompting me to review it. This detector has worked exactly the way it was designed to work each and every one of the thousand times I've used it. Prior to this voltage detector I used a Milwaukee 2202-20 which was excellent. When it came time to replace it I went w/ this one instead only because of the sensitivity dial feature. Both tools have their pros & cons: the 2202-20 can be turned on and left on a live wire while I went to an unlabeled box and it would stop beeping once I'd found the right switch which saved time, something that can't be done with this tool b/c it's only ON when the button is held so I've to walk back & forth to test whether the right breaker wss tripped. On the other hand the sensitivity dial has helped alot in that it detects voltage through denser materials than the Milwaukee when set to high. This tool actually has 2 buttons, the first is near the tip which is for setting the dial and using over & over, while the actual dial can ALSO be pressed allowing for adjustments without going back & forth from dial to button. Overall I'm happy with this tool and the price is reasonable here.

In order to satisfy my moderate tool addiction I purchased 3 Circuit Alert tools last year on impulse and have used them only sparingly b/c I predominantly use my Knipex and Greenlee electrical tools on the job. That said, these have work well when I HAVE used them. One can tell immediately that the materials aren't the same degree of quality as say "Klein" or "Knipex" but rather in line w/ a name like Stanley (which are more than decent tools). I say this not to knock Stanley or Black & Decker type tools but because they're simply not for professional use day in & day out. This Gardener Bender line is unique in that it possesses a built in voltage detector which is a "useful novelty". The tool can be flipped, the button held down and the non-contact detector will flash and beep if there's power. Additionally the detector can be removed and used as a simple, stand alone voltage sensor. I was surprised to find out that this line is also insulated (1000v rated) which makes it, not only, all the more versatile but a tremendous value compared to other insulated electrical tools. The stripping end of this has cut well for me, no worse than my Greenlee stripper, and the spring adds ease-of-use to the equation. An ideal line for anyone in the trades or the average Joe looking for a wire stripper w/ a few bells & whistles.

I want to start by stating that I'm in no way a mountaineer, climber or even a Winter sports enthusiast, what I am is an outdoors guy that cares about quality and asthetic. These boots possess all of the qualities I look for in a cold weather/Winter boot, they're waterproof, warm, lightweight, superior traction and look great. I can't stress enough how comfortable these boots have become after a few weeks of wear. My prior experience w/ the Adidas Terrex line is that, in order to hug the foot, they run a bit small/tight so I purchased these a 1/2 size bigger and even then are snug. I'm flat footed mind you and certain shoes are a bit narrow for me but nevertheless the extra 1/2 size is perfect. Aside from all the stated pluses, I've been complimented by a half dozen strangers as well as friends & aquaintances. The ONLY reason I didn't go all "5-Star" on these YET, is that I've only had them for a few weeks and want to really gauge them over this entire Northeastern New Jersey Winter first, snow, Ice muck and salt, everything this little boy loves ;-). All in all the $200+ I paid might seem steep for some but, like my Fast X GTX, these will last for years.*Update:After 2 recent snowfalls and 9-20 temperatures these boot performed and achieved 5-star status. Walking and standing for 8 hours a day over the course of the 3 days I wore them to work to really gauge them my feet stayed warm, sweaty warm. The Continental rubber soles didn't slip once despite the snowpack between the treads. Money well spent.

So far I've bought a 1/2 dozen jeans on Amazon site unseen and I've either been really lucky or really good at determining the right jeans from the pictures. This is the first pair of Dinamit jeans I've ever gotten and they're great. These are lowcut and button fly so be aware when buying them that they may not be for you. I'm a 33/34 but put on a few pounds over the holidays and bought these in a 36 yet they fit like a 34, not terribly disapointed since I'll be back to a 34 by February but be aware that you should order at least one size up or they'll be skin tight. I can tell they'll fit better once I've lost the holiday weight. I was skeptical of the denim quality when I ordered them but no issue once I got them, good denim here. The tag said "$299.00" which I believe they may have once sold for.

Great little lantern for camping, general use or to just keep in the car. Battery life is excellent, I've had the same Duracells in it for months and use it every time I need to look around the rear portion of my Element at night. Aside from the carry handle there's a hidden plastic hook that enables us to hang it upside down, a simple thing that adds to the overall functionality. The flashing green light is a huge help in the dark and the only way to locate the lantern in pitch black conditions. Love this inexpensive lantern.

This is a quality lightweight, sleek, low-profile pump that delivers. The mounting bracket fit my bikes frame precisely and without having to drill as the bike already had the holes and fasteners in it. The pump itself is made of aluminum with a hidden flexible hose that easily extends for use & retracts just as easily. The kit included is well thought out in that it includes accessories for inflating sport balls and other items, spare elastic bike straps, bike tire removal tools and a velvet drawstring storage bag. The inflator head itself possesses further versatility as it adjusts for use on Presta or Schrader valves. Overall this pump and kit are easily worth $30 so it's also a bargain.

The pads were, as the title says, thinner than I expected.  Having flat feet, most of shoes and boots have an empty space in the outer metatarsal area and I thought these would be ideal to fill that void. They did the job but not quite as effectively as I'd hoped. Otherwise, these adhered well to the inside of my shoes and most are still there after nearly 2 years. For the price I'm ok with them and may get them again for dressier shoes but for boots I'll keep looking for thicker ones.

After using, (and really digging), the Milwaukee folding saw for a while I found that it wasn't solid enough to replace a good jab saw so i bought this. Most jab saws  cut through drywall like a hot knife through butter when they're new and this one's no different. The differences I notice here is that the blade is an inch longer and stiffer (insert falic joke here_____ lmao) than my old Klein. The grip sits in my hand almost as if it were designed around my palm, maybe not the same for everyone but it's still really ergonomic. I still use the folding saw occasionally but not so much for drywall anymore. Nothing can replace a quality, traditional jab saw, especially one built like this.

First of all I want to disclose that this was a complimentary sample from the manufacturer. Now, this is a HUGE amount of eye gel compared to other brands at a price that's incredible. I feel a tingling/toning effect almost immediately with this product that indicates to me that it's working on my skin. The cooling nature of these eye gels almost immediately begins to alleviate puffiness around the eyes.

First off, full disclosure: I received a complimentary bottle in exchage for this review. That said, I've been taking Omega-3 fish oil for years, from several different manufacturers and had settled on one recently, a brand sold in large quantities at Walgreens & Duane Reade among other places that has a catalog of over 200 supplements, HOWEVER, I like these better. First of all for their price, this bottle of 180 double strength capsules costs about what a 100 capsule bottle of the 'concentrated pearl capsules' I've been buying and contain 99% the stated amount of Omega-3 in those pearl capsules. These capsules ARE larger than the average fish oil capsule but I really don't mind that even though I take them 3 or 4 times a week, 2 or 3 at a time. I expected a fishy taste after a while of taking these but it never came. Over the last 2 weeks I've gone through a considerable number of these but don't mind as they're priced reasonably enough that I'll definitely order more in the near future. Thanks NutriGold.
Bought this for my Honda Element LX and it fit perfectly. It's incredibly easy to install and has held up to all kinds of weather here in North Jersey. Cool accessory that doesn't cost too much.

This is cool little bag for my tool accessories. The small outer pockets are great for miscallaneous small parts that might otherwise be lost amongst the contents of an otherwise larger bagg forcing one to waste time digging around for them. The main compartment isn't going to 'hold a tool set' but it's ideal for my laser layout & measurement devices. the 2 larger inner pockets are large enough to hold some accessories and a great place to keep those smaller product manuals that usually get lost. I didn't give it 5 stars because imo it's overpriced but it's an altogether solid, handy bag.

I couldn't be more satisfied w/ these headphones. First off the sound is excellent, loud AND clear. They literally sound WAYYY better than a $70 pair of Apple iPod headphones I own. The obvious convenience here being that these are wireless/Bluetooth, but, unlike other Bluetooth headphones available, these are self-contained to the earpieces as opposed to the 'neck bar' that many of those others have. The battery life here is great so far, lasting for hours & hours, at moderate volume, before needing a charge. I was skeptical about then staying in my ear as I rode my bike or worked out but they stay IN, thanks to the soft rubber supports and the in-swept design. The kit brings a usb-to-mini usb charging cable, spare buds and supports, very nice stuff. The ONLY down side with this is proximity, mine lose contact after about 10 feet but not a big deal b/c they're for my workouts so my phone's always on me. The only reason I didn't go 5-Star is that with my phone IN pocket, there's an occasional, completely random, unintended disconnect that has only  occurred a couple of times but is annoying enough to juuust keep it out of the 5-Star arena imho. All in all a well designed, comfortable and apparently high quality head set kit that doesn't cost a lot.

Prior to buying this set I owned a Harbor Freight 50 piece set that imho was borderline garbage for any kind of professional use. This set is 10 times more solid. The 3/8" ratchet itself is apparently built to last and uses an easy-to-reach lever to switch direction rather than the standard twist switch on the the back of the tool head. Another feature of the ratchet is the push button release. The variety of sizes included is not bad as it's covered every nut and bolt I've encountered. One accessory that sold me on.this set is the 1/4" square-to-hex adapter for driving bits, an accessory that I've had before from other brands but non as solid as the one included here. I imagine a professional mechanic or assembler needing or wanting a more premium name in ratchet sets but for the the average professional handyman/electrician's helper like me this set is excellent.

I've had the original version intact since 1999 and my younger son has ALWAYS wanted to get his hands on it so I was excited to find this 'version' here and bought it for him. Of the 6 characters in this series this is definitely the coolest one and probably the most difficult to find. Very little difference between this one and my original 1998/99 release, most notably the sword included with the one I bought my son DOES NOT have the lettering or symbols on it so heads up because the image shows that.

Full disclosure is that this was sent to me as part of a promotion in exchange for an honest review. That said, this is that review ;-)...I've used hyarulonic acid serum before, as well as products containing hyarulonic acid as a secondary ingredient so I DO have experience w/ the ingredient. This particular formula IS a good one, I almost immediately feel the cooling, "lifting/tightening" effect I've gotten from quality serums in the past. Hey look, I'm a guy's guy but let's face it, looking good & feeling good go hand in hand so staying fit as well as keeping and LOOKING healthy are important. All in all this is one of the better 100% hyaluronic acid serums out there and a solid choice for anyone looking for great skin care products.
I'd give these 5 stars except the manufacturer states "60 shots" but they provide more like 35-45 good shots from my Daisy before getting all soggy & limp...lol

I bought these for my son to use w/ his 3DS after he destroyed his iPod headphones. Other headphones I've bought him have worked for a couple of weeks before he'd seperate a speaker wire. These have lasted, I thinks it the flat wire that's contributed to their longevity. The sound is also there, clear and clean.

I own a SOG Power Duo and Victorinox Swisstool. This one falls right in between those two being better than the SOG but not made as well as the Victorinox. The tool came quasi loose which is fine as it reduces the break-in period but also means it'll get loosER with time. I like the finish which has yet to show a rust spot and, being naked metal,  allows for decent grip. Leatherman has always made solid, lasting tools so I'm certain this is no different.

Compared to the stock Samsung battery this has 10% more juice and it shows. I've put through approximately 250 cycles and it hasn't slowed down or broken, granted a Li-Ion battery can endure roughly 2,000 cycles but in my experience with some cheap batteries the begin to show signs of breakdown after about 200 cycles ie: charge to 90% instead of 100%, rapid drain etc.

This armband isn't anything spectacular but it does keep my giant-a55 phone on w/o applying a torniquet to my upper arm. The small key slot is cool but I throw my gym member card & $ in it while I'm working out.

I've used Sea Breeze and Neutrogena toners for years and they're great but after using this one from OZ Naturals I don't know that I'll go back to those. This is a "toner/tonic", the afore-mentioned toners leave my face cool and refreshed while I notice this one does that but with a longer lasting effect. While the other basic toners eliminate the shine and produce a crisp clean feeling the effect goes away after about 1/2 hr and my oily skin reverts to it's natural state. THIS toner/tonic from OZ keeps my face shine free and crisp for much longer. After a shave, application of aftershave and mask I put this on and wow is my facial skin high & tight. Another thing I dig is that this is a spray and not a splash on like other toners.

For the price these are definitely a bargain. I kept 3 out of the 5 since the red and light blue seemed feminine in color and design so i gave those 2 to my girlfriend...;-) The remaining 3 blk/brwn bracelets have been great. The buttons have remained intact and w/ an occasional petroleum jelly rub, the material has stayed soft and pliable. Wiuld get these again, no doubt.

Chalky flavor was expected but mixes better than I thought. I mix this in a quart container w/ skim milk, a strawberry Yoplait and a few drops of strawberry syrup to combat the chalk taste.As a long time whey powder user I was skeptical about tthe effectiveness of a non-whey but no complaints. This pea protein actually is easier on my digestive system than some of the whey powders I've tried in the past.

For the price these are definitely worth trying out, however, they'll take about a month to reach you. These are relatively easy to install on the phone and 5 for the price is a great deal. I gave them 4 stars because the image shows an opening for the phone's home button but the ones I recieved did not have this cutout.

This is the first exercise ball I've ever used, let alone owned but it's been great. I weigh 180 lbs and use it a total of maybe an hour/hour & a half a week and it hasn't needed topping off. I'm finding new ways to stretch and work out using this. All in all I'm happy with this exercise ball from Monster Fitness.

I have a half shitzu half poodle, (insert hilarious breed combo name here _____), that's picky about what he eats but he started chewing on these sticks as soon as I gave him one. Not a bad doggy treat.

First I want to clarify that most of my reviews focus on positives and therefore remain in therealm of 4 or 5 stars. That said this is just a stretchy tank. It does NOT "slim" or "shape" in any way. I'm typically a Large but bought this in Small and it's just a tight form FITTING shirt but doesn't provide any actual support. As far as I can tell the little 'panels' are just decorative because they stretch out but aren't in any way "actively" doing anything...lol

In my experience Hitachi makes good tools but they make 3 particular tools VERY well. Those are rotary hammers & breakers, miter saws and reciprocating saws. This recipro confirms that notion. I've used this sparingly because I predominantly use my M12 Hackzall and V18 Hatchet Sawzall as I don't do alot of demolition. The 2 afore mentioned tools have a 1/2" & 3/4" stoke respectively which covers most of my cutting needs but the 1-1/8" stroke on the Hitachi makes it a great demo saw. The power is there, I recently chopped a 10' theater sized couch into 3 pieces using this w/ a 10" Milwaukee demo blade and this guy didn't bog down, jam or otherwise fail. The battery life is just ok but understandable as it's a higher drawing tool. It's feel in the hands is batter than any other reciprocating saw I've ever used. Hitachi is making an impression on this Milwaukee fan boy...;-)
Great looking pair of shades. Not "high quality" by any means but at this price thelook and fit make these 5 star glasses all day long.

As a longtime Milwaukee user for core tools I was a little skeptical about the quality of a tool brand like Hitachi/Ridgid/DeWalt but this saw turned out to be a solid performer (as I'm sure are the Ridgid & DeWalt saws). The light is dimmer than the LEDs now available on most tools but preferrable to NO light whatsoever so no love lost there. I'm predominantly using a Freud Diablo 40 tooth and the saw cuts effortlessly through most stock. All in all I'm impressed w/ Hitachi's look, feel and, most importantly, performance.

I put 2 sets of these on hikers and 1 set on my work boots and they're great. These are super easy to install, cut to size and use that I'm looking for something similar but thicker. My sone plays football and I put a set on his cleats and so far he digs them too. They make donning and removing above-the-ankle shoes and boots SO much easier than traditional tugging & tying and the hold better than some traditional laces. The uses don't end there, I weaved a single cord through an old hiking pack that was missing the original cord on the back and voila! good as new.

I gambled on this purchase because I'd never smelled it before and I've never EVER bought a fragrance without trying it out first. The gamble paid off, it smells great, fresh, clean and masculine without being overpowering. Just as an indicator for readers to have an idea of my 'preferred taste' in scents and in no particular order, I wear Luna Rossa, L'eau D'Issey, Dolce & Gabana (original pour homme), Polo Sport, Carolina Herrera, Escape and Egoiste Platinum. This fragrance from Lacoste is right there with those others in terms of distinction, projection, masculinity and longevity of bouquet. I'd recommend this as a daytime or Spring/Summer fragrance.

Nice short sleeve shirt. The material is on the thin side but as a black shirt I'll be using during the Summer months that's actually a plus. The fit is on the athletic side and maybe a bit smaller than that so if you're not a fan of that look order 1 size up. For the price I paid here I ordered a second one as soon as I tried the first one on. Great buy.

I'm a longtime Milwaukee tool user but decided on Hitachi for my business to avoid leaving my more expensive Milwaukee tools in the handa of less experienced and sometimes less careful workers. I needed less expensive tools that performed and I found that in Hitachi. I considered Ryobi for my purposes but those tools just don't cut it, (or fasten it...;-) ), in a professional, day after day environment. The tools are ergonomic and have performed very well thusfar. The yellowish task light on the drill and impact driver is just 'ok' and the fact they're turned on/off independently makes it a novelty but may come in handy some day. The circular saw has cut alot of wood and just as well as a DeWalt saw I had for years and Hitachi makes excellent reciprocating saws and the one included in the kit is no different. Another factor in choosing Hitachi is the 10-year tool warranty. As a whole, this kit and the grinder kit I bought separately were solid investments.

Owning a 10 amp. 4-1/2" Milwaukee grinder I needed something lighter and more portable so I decided on this Hitachi. So far so good, I've used it on lighter applications like removing concrete sealant from between coping stones and wire wheel applications. It's perfomed really well on those jobs, providing good power and battery life. I'm not a huge fan of locking switches on ANY power tool, much less a grinder, but the solution is simple, I don't use the lock. The guard is a screw down type-1 which is 'ok' to me but that's because I'm accustomed to a spring lock guard so no biggy there either. I also purchased a 5-piece Hitachi 18v kit that also does the job and  leaves me with plenty of batteries and a backup charger

I bought this not only to use at home but to put to professional use. I have it attached to an 18v Ryobi drill that I bought to  use exclusively w/ this, as a safety precaution I taped the chuck shut over the interface on this after unknowingly loosening it then lowering it and dropping the drum onto my foot (OUCH!). the locking tip is a little bit of a hassle to loosen and tighten after inserting each span of auger at first but after a little practice one gets the hang of it. The drum has a 'piggy bank' type plug on the side that serves to spray Liquid Wrench or WD40 onto the auger. Currently using a 25' 1/4" drop point auger in this. I also purchased the larger General Pipe Super Vee but at $450, more powerful and being corded I seldom use it as this smaller unit clears 90% of the drains I've used it in. All in all an excellent device for the average home owner, handyman or plumber to own.

The price on these jeans was too good to pass up so I ordered them in size 3332. They're dark w/ a hint of rust and some rough spots near the right front pocket. They fit well considering they're low-rise AND slim-fit. The denim is brittle so I fear that the first  tug or stretch the wrong way will rip these jeans really easily. Overall, for Kenneth Cole jeans w/ a tag that reads $70, these are a still a great deal despite the apparently cheap denim.

This little receiver works very well. I use it at work in conjunction  with an XBoom speaker leaving my phine in the safety of my pocket while my music streams wirelessly. It's got weight to it, which to me, indicates a degree of quality in any electronic device. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is that it has no internal power source/battery, I understand that this is meant as more of a stationery device and realize that certain applications require some portabilty something easily addressed w/ a small internal battery. No love lost however as I own a few external batteries.

Long drive, lengthy flight or just sitting on the recliner, this thing is SWEET. I've only had it for a few days but it's already part of my 'at-home' routine, cold beer or Cutty Sark neat, World Chess and this pillow after a long day at work...lol The settings are on a slight delay so don't keep hitting the button, give it a second or two and it'll kick in. The vibrations are pretty strong really stimulating the entire back of the neck thoroughly. Just pop in two AA batteries, zip it up, throw it on and ahhhhh, melt away aome tension. ;-)

This is a great looking watch at a really great price. The first thing I noticed is the size, this this is BIG, it's also heavy which, to me anyway, is an indication of quality. The stainless steel band has a nice "offset" link pattern that complements the overall appealing look of this watch. I love that it's motion wound as I only need to give a light shake when not in use to avoid resetting the time whenever I put it on. I've only hadthis watch for a few days but I've already received a few compliments from friends and coworkers. It carries the look of an expensive luxury watch without breaking the bank. Overall I'm extremely satisfied with this watches quality considering it's under $40. 5 stars all day long.

Right off the bat I want to say that the sound this little speaker puts out was impressive. I played everything from Skrillex to Johnny Cash to compare the sound quality and I wasn't disappointed. I'm by no means an audio quality 'expert' but I love music and know what good sound is. This little device delivers BIG sound in an ultra portable package. Kudos to XBoom for including clear instructions along with all wiring necessary for charging, connecting and expanding to multiple speakers. The ONLY reason I didn't go "5 star" is that I want to gauge longevity BUT considering the price, even if it only lasts me 6 months, I'd give it a 5er.

Excellent tech pouch made to withstand the 40hr a week, tool-in/tool-out, grind. It has a compact and well designed storage scheme that lets me pack quite a few tools onto it. The fact that it's designed  with 3 ways to attach to our belt/suspender makes it that much more modular. Everything I've ever had from CLC...hmm...well, I STILL HAVE everything, it's all lasted.

Bought this set for my 13 y/o after I caught him grabbing my Luna Rossa and Issey Miyake colognes. I chose this set b/c for under $30 I got an overall 2 oz of classic fragrances by Calvin Klein, one for almost any occasion...;-)...not bad. On to the fragrances, my 2 personal favorites among these are Eternity for Fall/Winter and/or evenings and Escape for Spring/Summer and/or daytime. Obsession, CK One are good "everyday colognes" imo. Any which way one regards them they're 4 distinct scents I've known & loved for years, and now my son loves them too.

First of all let me be clear, if I had paid the $47 this shirt is selling for right now, I would rate it 3 stars.
