This gives you lots of suds with only a small amount. The scent lasts a pretty long time too. Be prepared for the scent to be STRONG while you are using the product, but it lessens quickly and does not disappear for hours.

I chose this product simply because my electric razor was dying. It has three floating heads, lots of power, and comes with a cleaning brush and charger. It has no trouble tackling the short hairs (or the longer ones) and does it without causing me any pain. The heads pop off for easy cleaning. There really is not much more to say other than this razor R-O-C-K-S!

First and foremost, it must be understood this is is an access point and not a wireless router. This access point is an entry level device into the 802.11AC world at 433 Mbps.After removing the device from the box, I noticed it was very small. This device is actually smaller than a cup coaster. The device was actually very simple to setup, but the instructions are very minimal. Do not expect a detailed guide or any technical information in the instructions. Setup is done via a CD on a windows PC. The setup utility will find the access point, and allow you to do a minimal setup. A few steps after the setup started, the AP was completely configured and running.Once on line, I tested the device with an Samsung S5 Phone, and a Windows Surface Pro 3. Both the Surface Pro and Samsung S5 would connect at 351 Mbps. Every once in awhile the Surface Pro would jump up to 433 Mbps, but would then return to 351 Mbps. The AP was around 2 feet away from both of the devices. Throughput testing was done using Iperf with the Surface Pro. Actual throughput numbers started at 80.4 Mbits/sec, and maxed out at 92.9 Mbits/sec at a rage of 2 feet from the AP. The second test was done from a different room on the same floor on the other side of a wall and stairwell. The connection rate on the Surface pro dropped to 117 Mbps with a throughput of 54.9 - 59.4 Mbits/sec.This unit would be best used to cover a room, small apartment, or to provide coverage on one floor of a two story house. It will not have the power or range to cover a larger one story or two story house.

My husband tried this one for me over the course of a week.  In the applicator, is smells of citrus and maybe a bit of ocean.  The scent is not overly strong or musky, which is good as neither of us like many of the "sweeter" scented deodorants.  It goes on smoothly and is clear.  On my husband, the scent mixes well with his to create a pleasant odor that remains with him for the better part of the day without being overpowering.  From my perspective it is nice because of the scent.  He said it remains effective even when he goes out after work.  Overall, we both like the Axe Phoenix scent.  My only question would be why is something that comes with a blue label and smells of citrus and ocean called Phoenix?

My family games together. My son lives in the house directly next to mine. Recently while questing together on ESO ... uh, during an online game ... my Mumble (like Team Speak) started acting hinky. I could not help but think that this would be the perfect time to test out this product. I had already given my son one of the pair so all I had to do was tell him in group chat (within the game) to turn on his "walkie". Here are the results:One: The batteries only lasted 30 minutes before we had to recharge.Two: There are no cradles for the devices to recharge. Included with the devices are cords for us to plug into the devices and then into a wall's power outlet.Three: Recharge took several hours.Four: When we tried to use them again, they only lasted 45 minutes.Five: We spent most of our time repeating ourselves because we could not make out what the other was saying.Six: After tossing out the batteries given with the devices and inserting normal "throw away" batteries, the devices became clearer (though not crystal - more like what a weather radio sounds like) and lasted 6 hours.Our thoughts:The batteries that came with the units must be pretty old and can no longer hold charges - or something like that. Perhaps mine were faulty. I only know that they did not work well for more than 45 minutes and took what seemed like forever to charge.Yes, we are sure we were on the same channel and the distance between us was a little under 1/2 an acre.Once regular batteries were inserted we could hear what the other was saying, but not clearly as the description made me believe I would. The product description says it can use regular batteries for up to 21 hours. That must be if the device is on but not being used often. We used hands-free for our game questing and it lasted 1/3 of that time before it began sounding like the rechargeable batteries did.I give the product 3.5 stars and that is going on the assumption (something I hate to do) that the batteries that came with our pair were old and/or faulty. I would not suggest these if you plan to use them non-stop for 6+ hours. So if you are going on a long hike (in multiple groups) take extra batteries. If you plan to use them to report back to a camp site, I suggest checking in every 15 minutes to make sure you can still hear each other.

The OtterBox brand is well known and for good reason. They make strong products to protect your expensive items, such as cell phones and tablets. Please know in advance that because of how well its history shows it as being dependable, OtterBox products are a bit more expensive than other brands. This product is no exception.This item is a single piece. It is molded to fit ONLY the Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge. It will not fit other types of Samsung Galaxy S6. (The regular S6 is straight/flat. The Edge is curved and thinner.) There is nothing to keep the case from slipping and there is nothing to help you hook it onto your belt or any such place. Do not expect to receive a shield for the front of your phone either. Screen protectors are sold separately.

As others have noted, the Syma indoor copters are pretty sturdy.  It is fun to fly indoors and easy to control.  Purely by accident, I discovered just how resilient the little copter is while flying it around the room and not noticing my cat stalking it. Flying only a few feet off the ground, it passed his hiding spot. He jumped from cover and promptly swatted it out of the air...hard.  Once the shock wore off and my laughter stopped, I checked the cat and the copter. Both were unharmed and functioning properly.

This product is 5 pieces of thick paper with a tab on each. Unlike the picture provided, my tabs are not colored. Each divider paper and tab is simply white. When I say "thick paper", I do not mean as thick as cardboard. I mean thicker than normal computer paper. Each divider paper is already punched at the top with reinforced (on one side only with copper) for two-hole folders. This product does not include the folder or anything else that you use these divider sheets with. You must purchase folders separately.At the time of this review, the price for these 5 divider sheets is just over fifteen dollars. That is pricey for this product. You are mainly, in my opinion, paying for the Avery brand name. I did not find these to be any better than the cheaper brand that I normally purchase; use your own judgment.If you use pencil or erasable ink on the tabs, then you should be able to easily erase and reuse the tabs - if the divider paper is not worn out by then. I give three stars since the product does what it says and is as good as other brands. I minus two stars for the very high price, the divider sheets not being as thick as many cheaper brands, and for not being color coded tabs as the picture shows.

Review for PNY 32GB MicroSDHC card.For price/GB at the moment, you can't go wrong with this card.It's a speed class 10 , UHS speed class 3 card.In English, that just means that it is the fastest current spec for this type of card supporting 10MB/s write speed on normal devices and 30MB/s if your device supports UHS.  After testing, the actual speed was closer to 50MB/s writing to the laptop (Still not the 90 listed, but very good).  Ease of installation will, of course, depend on the device.  -test on Samsung Tab 4-edit.  As initial testing was done in a tablet, I figured it'd only be fair to test in a laptop as well.  I had to use an sd to micro sd adapter, but the card functioned properly in the laptop as well with no issues moving from one device to another to share data.

Okay, this stuff must be like catnip to outdoor felines. I have two indoor cats and one outdoor cat. (Actually a stray.) The indoor cats do NOT like wet/moist cat food; however, they will eat this. They still prefer the dry, but will eat this even though they won't eat the other canned cat foods I have tried. The outdoor cat, who is used to catching prey and eating meat, cannot seem to get enough of this cat food. These cans are small. They are the perfect size for a kitten, but for a full grown cat I had to use two cans. (They must make a larger size and I just don't know about it.) This product is a bit pricey, so I would not give it to the felines everyday, but I will be keeping some in the cabinet as a weekly treat.

I bought this kit, not quite sure how it would work up but for the price it was worth the gamble.  Turns out the kits is comprised of very nice quality felt, the patterns are stamped on the felt and are clear and easy to see.  You add the tassels and stuffing, but otherwise everything you need is included.  I would say that if you do not have the patience for tiny stitching this kit might not be for you, but if you enjoy small detail work, the results are well worth the time.I used by own cotton thread, but that was the only material substitution I made.  I did not follow the instructions as to color and stitch, but rather used more vintage colors and a single strand of cotton DMC thread.  The result was outstanding.  Very delicate, very vintage and very pretty.  Even if you used the colors suggested the results would be very pretty, but I would caution that a single strand of DMC works far better than the doubles they recommend.Overall - 5 star for quality of materials, clear instructions and impressive results.

I love this kit, love all the "All Stuffed Up" kits for the quick and easy die cut patterns. No cutting of pattern shapes required, just start stitching! The felt is of a very nice, thick quality and the ornament works up to look exactly like the photo. It is an easy evening project, the only thing you need to add is the batting to stuff the shape. For the price and the quality of the materials included you simply can't go wrong if you want a very cute, very easy stitching project.

This tin is every cute, and a nice quality.  Not too thin, not too cheap feeling.  The size is perfect for 'dog cookie' treats for gifting and the print is clear and quite attractive, with a nice vintage feel.  While I did think it was a bit pricey given the price is for one tin, I would order them again simply because they were unique and fun.

I ordered this set for my granddaughter so that she would have something to 'create' while Thanksgiving dinner was cooking.  The little ornament kits were packaged individually (12 in all) and then a small package of 'extra' just in case there was an error in the creating process.  The kits were simple to assemble, even for young hands, and the results were very cute.For the price, the quick shipping and the cute factor, I would order these again.

Ordered a set of these scarf bails and they arrived quickly and nicely packaged.  The color is an antique bronze and nicely matches all the antique bronze findings on the craft market today, so adding jump rings or extensions is easy to do.  The only thing I would mark this set down for is that a feels a bit 'plastic' rather than metal.  That was a bit disappointing, but once I had attached the center ornamentation, the bail took on some weight and the plastic feel was not quite so noticeable.  I would also mention that you want to use some caution when you pull your scarf through the bails at there were some burrs inside which would snag a more fragile scarf.  I simply used an emery board to smooth the inside a bit before inserting the scarf - problem gone.Overall, I would order this set again.  For the price they do work up nice.

I love this kit, love all the "All Stuffed Up" kits for the quick and easy die cut patterns.  No cutting of pattern shapes required, just start stitching! The felt is of a very nice, thick quality and Mr. Moose works up to look exactly like the photo.  It is an easy evening project, the only thing you need to add is the batting to stuff the head and body.  For the price and the quality of the materials included you simply can't go wrong if you want a very cute, very easy stitching project.

This kit is very cute and quick to complete.  As with all of Rachel's of Greenfield kits, the materials are excellent quality and the instructions are clearly written and easy to follow.  This kit is one that can be completed with very nice results by beginners as well as experienced stitchers.The only thing I would caution is that you should measure, measure, measure before you cut your fabric as there is not much margin of error allowed in the fabric.  The homespun typically is a bit off-grain, nature of the beast, but it would have been nice to have just a pinch more fabric so that you could bring it back to straight grain before cutting.  There is an ample supply of quality wool felt for cutting pattern shapes.  The colors of both the fabric and wool are true to the photo and the project looks just like the photo image when you are done.  It measures about 12x14-1/4" more or less when finished.As always with these kits, you won't be disappointed if you follow the instructions.  Cute, quick and attractive - what more could you want for the price.

Don't know why I did not think to look here a long time ago...silly me.  Use these for pill delivery to my sheltie and they work great.  He gobbles them right up just like a treat.  The price here is about $1 LESS per pack than what I had been paying in the stores, so this is the bargain.  Groups of six might seem excessive, but there are only 40 (more of less) in a package and when you use them twice a day you can burn through a pack pretty quick so the six-packs give you a good supply.  If you need to deliver some type of pill/capsule to your pet this is a good way to do it - no fuss, no trauma - just gobbling and wagging tails.

Ordered this 2-way for my dogs - a 2 year old Sheltie (25 pounds) and a 5 month old collie pup.  I ordered the 'medium' thinking it would be strong enough later for what will be the larger dog (collie) but still light weight enough to not burden the smaller sheltie.  In theory it was a good plan, but the reality is that the lead is a bit heavy duty for a smaller dog.  The strap is fine, about 1/2" wide, but the latch at the end is very heavy duty.  No complaint as I would rather have the security of the heavy strength, but if you are working with smaller dogs you might want to consider down-sizing a bit to reduce the weight.  Otherwise, the lead is of excellent quality, appears to be well made and should work just fine for my needs.

This stuff is great, once you open the package your mind starts to venture off to all kinds of possible projects!  I wanted to use it for transferring needlework designs to cross stitch fabric, so I was not sure if it would work.  Printed the design up and ironed it onto 18 count even weave fabric and had no problem with it at all.  The design transferred perfectly the first time.  While ironing I did pick up the corners to peek and see if it was working and had no problem when I laid the corner back down and continued to press.  The paper came off clean and easy, but if it does stick simply run the iron over it again and it comes right off - best removal  of the transfer paper results when the transfer is still warm from the iron.  I have an iron with the steam holes in the bottom and had no issue at all with the transfer.  The paper background is clear so you do not see it on colored fabric, only the design prints.  I noticed that it does tend to have a bit of a tendency to pull fabric fiber up with it when you remove the sheet so the smoother your fabric the better your results seem to be.Overall this transfer paper might be the best thing since sliced bread.  Yes, it is a bit expensive, but you certainly get what you pay for which is a super quality transfer.

Yes, it really works!  It is a rare moment it would seem when you purchase a computer program that is supposed to do something and it actually does - amazing but true in this case.  I needed a program that would assist me with the creation of both cross-stitch diagrams and needlepoint diagrams so I took a leap of faith and ordered up.  The install was quick and easy, and YES it works just fine on Windows 8.  The learning curve is a short one, and once installed you will be up and running very quickly as the commands are very intuitive and easy.  There is an instruction booklet with the program but you must print it out from a PDF format.  I do wish the instruction book came with the install disc, but it was easy to print.  It is 180 some odd pages and well worth the time to read it so that you get the full use of this wonderful program.  I purchased the 'professional' version and it does have some differences from the base program that makes your work a bit easier and faster.  Creating patterns for your sewing machine is an add-on that DOES NOT come with the Professional version.  The main difference between the base version and the professional appears to be mainly editing functions and a few other bells and whistles.  I would consider them to be well worth the extra money if you really intend to use this program to its fullest capabilities.This program also allows you to import (very easy to do) a photo and translate that to a stitch pattern, even assigning DMC color numbers to the colors in the photo - very impressive and pretty darned accurate.  You can assign color numbers from a substantial list of standard fiber makers such as DMC, Anchor, needlepoint wools, silk threads, they are all there for easy use.  You can also import a prepared chart and then trace over it to create a new pattern off that chart - again very easy to do and quite accurate once done.  You can cut and paste from the included library of designs, or you can create your own library and cut and paste from there.  The number of things you can do seems almost unbelievable, and the more I work with the program the more impressed I am with its abilities.Overall, this was well worth the money and one of the best purchases I have made for the computer in a long time.  If you are thinking about purchasing this program I would say treat yourself, you won't regret it!

Back again for more!  We go through these 'spitty toys' pretty quick with two dogs that love to play.  Have a Sheltie and a Collie and they both carry these rope toys around with them all the time in case the occasion should arise for a quick game of tug-of-war.  It never ceases to amaze me how long they last when they are being battered about as much as they are.  Seldom do I get strings on the carpet as they are twisted quite tightly.  Both dogs are what I would consider aggressive chewers when it comes to these toys, and they are one toy that can take the abuse.  General life span with two dogs working on them is about 4-5 months before they have to be 'retired' to the trash.  If your dogs love to play and you want a toy that will last, I would recommend these rope toys.

Ordered these for the garden as my other pair had worn out and I really did not want to pay a lot for garden shoes that always take more abuse than normal shoes.  Took a chance and ordered up.  They arrived quickly and are exactly what I was hoping they would be.  The shoes are a bit wide, but when working in the yard they are more comfortable that way rather than have them rub on your toes and the sides of your feet when you are hot and sticky.  The sole liners were pretty much useless and I just pulled them out and threw them away because you really do not need them in the shoe, and they did not want to stay in place but rather kept walking out the back end.  The strap across the back helps the shoe stay on your foot and the little vents on the side provide a nice bit of ventilation for an otherwise plastic shoe.  For the price they are comfortable and well-suited to survive the dirt, water and mud of the garden.

I needed some glue to hold the ear tips of my Collie pup in place.  I was desperate to find something that did not sting or burn as most super glues do.  I ordered this glue as a last ditch desperate effort to avoid the prick ears.  It is wonderful, and I wish I had found it much earlier.  I admit to having doubts, and was not overly excited about paying almost as much to ship the glue and the glue cost itself, but in the end it was worth every penny of the expense.  The glue is rather runny so rather than put it directly on the ear edges, I squirted some onto a small piece of foil and let it set for a few minutes to 'sticky up' a bit.  Then I applied a thin line to the fur edge of the pup's ears with a q-tip and held the ear in place for about 30 seconds.  It worked just perfectly and the ears are still in place over two weeks later with just the original glue application.  No burning, no stinging, no crying - completely painless for the pup.  I wish I knew about this glue a couple of years ago when I had the same ear battle with my Sheltie.  The glue is latex based so it washes off easily if you get it on your fingers and it simply wears/rub off the ear edges so there is no mess for the puppy, and no super-glue stiff edges to contend with.  I would highly recommend this glue for ear training, it is easy to use and provides you with a safe and humane way to train the dip into your puppy's ears.

I ordered this book because I was looking for a basic compilation on the Rough Collie, height, weights, coats, breed standards, basic care and medical issues, etc.  Just a general overview of the Collie from puppy to adulthood.  I thought this book might be what I was looking for, but actually it was not.  Now, this is not a negative review of the book, simply a statement that it did not contain the information I was hoping to find.  What this book does cover in great detail is the genetic lineage (European and American) of Collies from just about the beginning of time.  Approximately 75% of the book was dedicated to tracing the breeding line of the Collie.  This is outstanding information if you are a breeder and you want the complete breeding history, but if you are a Collie owner who simply wanted some basic breed information, this book is not for you.  The remainder of this book was dedicated to the basic of breeding and keeping of breeding kennels once you have obtained a Collie.  It is important to point out that this book is a vintage book, and the techniques and approaches offered reflect the age of the book and the thinking of the time when it comes to dogs.  A great Collie 'heritage' resource, but not helpful for a new Collie owner who is looking for general breed information relating to care and feeding of their new 'pack member.'

I ordered this bistro set to put outside by the fire pit.  I had previously ordered a cream color set, also from Wayfair, so this is a second purchase.  Like the first purchase, it arrived in lightening quick time (less than four days from date of order), in excellent condition and assembled quickly and easily (I used my own tools).  The set is a perfect antique bronze color which matches nicely with the existing iron patio furniture I purchased last year.  The set is sturdy and comfortably accommodates an adult in size.  The chairs have rubber 'feet' which is a nice touch.  The 'rose' pattern is very pretty.  The set is not completely wrought iron, but some combination of stainless and iron, but it is heavy enough to resist the strong winds we are subject to out here in the open agricultural area of Indiana.  If you are looking for a pretty little set for seating or simply an accent piece in your yard, I highly recommend this set and I highly recommend Wayfair for their fast shipping.

Ordered this harness for my Sheltie who loves to ride.  Was concerned about the measurements, but it fit perfectly.  Ordered a S/M for him because his body weight is 24 pounds, and his neck measured 16 inches, body girth 24 inches.  The harness fits perfectly, not too tight but with enough room to let it out a bit if we needed to later down the line.The line that buckles to the car seatbelt fit perfectly and locked in as it should to our 2012 Ford Explorer and our 2012 Ford F150 truck.  The line from the "D" ring of the harness to the seat buckle is short but can be lengthened if you desire.  It is short enough to keep him in place on the backseat but with enough room to move and reposition himself comfortably.Overall, for the price this harness is excellent.  Quality is good, in fact so nicely done that I am ordering another harness so we will have one in the truck and one in the car.  Now our 'pack' can travel safely together - road trip!

Silly me, here I thought the basic Stonewall Kitchen scone mix was not one you could not beat, then I ordered the chocolate, and then I ordered this coconut - they just get better with each flavor!  It is a toss up as to which one is the ultimate best, but this coconut is certainly a contender.  The taste is soft and not overpowering, but strong enough that you get the true flavor of coconut.  Great with coffee or iced tea.  Easy to make, but be sure to make a double batch because they won't last long!

Like all the other Stonewall Scone mixes, this chocolate one is easy to make, and tastes wonderful.  This is certain to be one of those treats you savor outside on a summer morning with a cup of coffee!  If you like chocolate, if you like scones,  you will be delighted with this mix.

This game is black and white and does not work on the Kindle Fire, in fact you cannot even download the game to the Fire, only the older version of the Kindle.  Wish they would have said that on the front side, but it was only 99 cents so not a big deal.  Just disappointing for the grandkids.  The game itself is cute and would be one that the grandkids would have liked to play, but in black and white on the older Kindle where navigation is a bit more difficult for little fingers, it simply does not score too high.

I purchased this video from the Interweave website.  Mistake.  Yes it was on sale on the Interweave site which is what lured me to it, but after having paid for 2nd day shipping and receiving the merchandise a full TEN days later - and receiving no response from Interweave when I made an inquiry - I learned my lesson and Amazon it will be in the future.So, that being said - the DVD is outstanding.  I purchased (from Amazon) one of the old Priscilla reprints for Irish lace and it was enough to get me started, but this DVD sealed the deal as far as technique.  I am a visual learner, much quicker to pick something up when I see how it is done, rather than read how it is done.  This DVD made it so simple.  I understood the concept from the Priscilla book, and was able to complete the patterns, but this DVD gave me further insight into what was happening with the stitch and why it was happening, you can see where the stitch is going on the DVD which makes the directions so much more clear.  There were a few 'cheats' on the DVD that were much easier than the written directions in the vintage books.  The stitches are exactly the same when completed, but much easier to accomplish when you can actually see the stitch happening.  I wish the DVD was longer than its 124 minute run time, but it will certainly get you going in the right direction.  The instructions Ms. Treanor provides are clear, concise and when she weaves her Irish history into the technique you feel like you are recreating a bit of history.Overall this DVD is outstanding from start to finish.  If you want to the learn Irish lace technique, or if you think you might have the concept but want to gain a few 'cheats' or insights I would highly recommend this DVD.  If you are an accomplished Irish lace creator this DVD could be disappointing for you as I suspect if is the basics without much in the way of advanced technique.  I will say that it is one of the best I have purchased and I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in getting started with Irish lace.  Ms. Treanor would be doing the art a great service if she continues to share her knowledge and expertise in this format.

I read all the reviews before ordering this bistro set for the front porch.  The reviews seemed to be mixed as to the quality, stability and assembly, but from the photo the set was exactly what I was looking for so I took a chance.  The price was reasonable and the set shipped quickly and arrived earlier than estimated.  The set comes unassembled, but is well packed inside the shipping box.  The parts/pieces were in excellent condition when I unwrapped them, and all the parts/pieces were included.  The set went together in under 30 minutes (did use my own screwdriver and wrench), and no engineering degree was required for the assembly.The set is both sturdy and well made, there were no chips, dents or flaws in the chairs or table.  The color is described as 'off-white' but in reality it is more of a very light mocha color with specks of color in the gray/rust range.  It does have a nice vintage appearance and I do not object to the color at all, but it could be easily painted if a person had a desire.  The table and chairs all had rubber protectors on the bottom which was nice.  I live in an open rural area and the winds come blowing through at a pretty high clip, but this set is heavy enough to stay in place, but not so heavy that it is inconvenient to move around.  Overall, I am very pleased with this little bistro set and can't wait for a sunny morning to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee on the porch.If you are looking for a good quality set, an affordable price, quick shipping and charm - this set should check all those boxes for you!

Okay, I am a Downton Abby fan - admitted.  I have also enjoyed the modern remake of Upstairs Downstairs and enjoyed it very much.  So, I thought I would venture back in time and watch the original inspiration for the remake.  Oh it was painful to say the least!  Yes, it is an older creation, but I was not quite expecting the poor acting that I encountered.  I tried to give this every chance to redeem itself, but each episode just seemed to get longer and the acting worse.  If you can suffer the flat acting it might be possible to appreciate this series for the vintage piece that it is - I was not able to do that and I returned it to Amazon on their Buy-Back program because I knew that I would never finish watching it.

Okay, I am a Downton Abby fan - admitted.  I have also enjoyed the modern remake of Upstairs Downstairs and enjoyed it very much.  So, I thought I would venture back in time and watch the original inspiration for the remake.  Oh it was painful to say the least!  Yes, it is an older creation, but I was not quite expecting the poor acting that I encountered.  I tried to give this every chance to redeem itself, but each episode just seemed to get longer and the acting worse.  If you can suffer the flat acting it might be possible to appreciate this series for the vintage piece that it is - I was not able to do that and I returned it to Amazon on their Buy-Back program because I knew that I would never finish watching it.

This book is exactly what I had hoped it would be - loaded with great information.  I ordered it for my Kindle Fire and it is clear and easy to use on the Kindle.  Took me a few minutes to figure out how to enlarge the photos, but it can be done and the photos enlarge clear and beautiful.  The book covers the basic perennial elements but goes into helpful detail about each flower and it needs and short comings.  That is the section I go back to over and over while planting this year.  I have also taken the Kindle to the nursery with me so that I can look up the flowers before I buy them to make sure they will do what in the garden what I have planned.  An excellent source that I will return to over and over - and such beautiful photos!

I ordered this reprint of a vintage pattern source.  It is nicely done, the photos are clear and the instructions are clear and easy to follow.  The patterns are the typical vintage designs you see in filet crochet, so if that is what you need this book is an excellent source.  There is a brief section at the beginning that covers the basic how-to filet crochet, reviews the stitches and defines the terms.  A basic presumption of crochet is assumed, but even beginner crochet folks will find this book easy to follow.  Wonderful pattern resource from the days past.By way of an update...while I am a great supporter of Amazon and the Sellers doing business here, I found an excellent site at [...] where all of these vintage pattern books are available for free.  Yes, free.  You can see the entire book, print a page or print the entire book, or download it for later use.  If you appreciate vintage patterns but money is a consideration for you, I would suggest checking out this excellent site as an alternative to possessing the original book.

This crochet magazine is an excellent source for filet crochet patterns.  Each issue is loaded with filet crochet patterns, both traditional and a few nontraditional.  It is an excellent find, the patterns are clearly written and the photos will inspire you to new heights of creation.  I purchased four back issues and each one is simply outstanding.  If filet crochet is your passion, this magazine will not disappoint you.

My wife is very pleased to finally get a remover that does not leave a greasy or oily residue. It costs a lot but it dos an excellent job. It removes all the makeup completely without causing any irritation. It has a very slight scent which is acceptable. Putting a bit on the finger instead of on a cotton ball provides results just as good, if not better, and cuts down on the expense by lasting longer. Excellent product.

There are numerous parts inside a cloth case which was housed in a 10" x 6 1/2" x 3 1/2" cardboard box. There are 7 black guide combs with sizes 1/8", 1/4", 3/8", 1/2", 5/8", 3/4" and 7/8". There is an orange ear comb that is used to cut around the ears from any angle. There is also an orange fade comb "Which effectively blends lines better than standard combs", whatever that means.In a separate plastic bag is a pair of scissors, styling clips, barber comb, cleaning brush and oil. These items are all very small and of minimum quality. A sheet of very thin plastic is furnished and referred to as a "Barber Cape" indicating that the manufacturer does have a sense of humor.The clipper has a full-size hair cutting blade pre-installed. Another blade is furnished that is identified as a detailing blade "for precise styling around the ears, sideburns and neckline.A large installation sheet 32" x 11" is provided. English instruction occupies one half of the sheet and non-English the other half.This is a corded device with the cord being roughly six feet long. It quite noisy but does actually cut hair. Based on its low cost and lack of quality it would seem that it has a limited lifetime.

My Dobie is a very picky eater an easily bored if given the same food more than a couple of times. He weighs in at around a hundred pounds so the recommended serving size for this food is 3 1/4 - 3 3/4 cups. However he won't eat just dry food served alone so I give him two cups of Eukanuba and mix in some canned food such as chicken, pork or beef. Sometimes I will mix in FreshPet chicken or beef just to give him some variety to satisfy his pickiness.I usually don't buy food not made in the USA nor do I buy any food that has ingredients from China. This Eukanuba is made in Argentina but I have not been able to learn if it contains any ingredients that originate in China. I like the fact that this food contains chondroitin and glucosamine but am not comfortable without the knowledge of all the ingredient sources. I will keep a very close watch over my Dobie and the least sign of deviation from the norm will result in discarding this product.

Very handy to be able to split the water feed. This connector has a large handle for turning to make an easy attachment to the faucet. Both of the two outputs have handles that are also easy to turn for controlling the water flow. The faucet connection has a washer already installed. This works well.

These are dated 10/22/2016 which means they are likely reasonably fresh. Suggested serving size is one bag containing 160 calories. However, I find that 1/2 bag is a satisfying size snack. They are described as "Calories from fat 0" which is a big plus. They taste good.The only negative I have is that they are pretty beat up upon arrival. More of the pretzel crisps are broken than I would have expected considering the way they were packed. I would estimate that between 20 - 25% of the crisps are broken with a small percentage actually shredded.
My wife says that this is easy to apply and does not have an odor. However, she also says that the color, although it was expected to be red, is just a tad too bright for her taste.

This was easy to install with the furnished screws I mounted it at the back of my garage on a wooden storage locker, I purchased a case of folded paper towels which fit nicely into the holder. Very convenient and very easy to use.

I upgraded two of my PC's to Windows 10 and a third PC arrived with Windows 10 already installed. I have been a senior for a long time and my memory is shaky at best. However, I have been using Windows 10 for fairly simple tasks and now I can go full out. The book is easy to read with a decent font size. Every subject one can imagine is covered and understandable. There is even a DVD provided so if you want to watch for a while instead of reading then you can do so. This is a really great book.

This is not a quality item but my Dobie likes to chase things and especially items that are new to him. This works half-posterior but I just throw any or all the parts and he gets a kick out of fetching them. I have not seen, heard or read of any problems with pet stuff from Vietnam. I scrubbed this thoroughly before letting my Dobie touch it. Even though he holds it in his mouth I do not let him chew on it and he does not get to keep it.

I did not know where this originated until the USPS made the delivery. I do not let my Dobie anywhere near products from China. That goes for food, toys or anything else. Into the recycle bin went this item.

This is a small hub that is white colored and has a blue LED. It arrived with an installation guide which consists of diagrams. When I first plugged the hub into my Dell All-In-One the PC immediately rebooted without any assistance on my part. Having read the other reviews I was worried that some damage was being done to my Dell. I waited a few minutes and the PC came back up and all looked to be functioning normally. I plugged a device into one of the ports on the hub and it was all good. I am completely pleased with this hub and the concern I had initially because of some of the other reviews is a thing of the past and hopefully soon forgotten.

I sprinkled this over an area that my Dobie likes to mess with. I let him sniff the container before I spread the contents and he seemed to enjoy the scent. When I was finished with the spreading I sat back and watched my Dobie's actions. He went over to the sprayed area, gave it a few sniffs and resumed his messing around just as he did before. Smells good, easy to apply but totally ineffective.

Horrible, horrible scent. This is unbelievable that such an obnoxious stench would be included in this product. My wife gave it a try but in a short time she had to wash her hair again with a pleasant scented shampoo. The Dove took a dive into the trash barrel. Phew.

My two USB ports were being used for the keyboard and mouse. I needed to be able to connect my printer which would not work in the wireless mode. I unplugged the keyboard and plugged this hub into the now empty USB port. No power cord is required so installation is as easy as can be. I plugged in the keyboard and printer into the hub and activated the two appropriate switches. Works perfectly. Great product, great price.
This is easy to use and works well. My wife loves hummingbirds and has several feeders. She says this is the best ant guard she has ever had. If she is happy then I am happy.

This is a really great product. The strips are easy to apply and they are hardly noticeable.  Last night I put a couple of strips on the kitchen window and a couple more on the kitchen cabinets. This morning there are many results especially on the strips applied to the window which is just above the kitchen sink. I have become invaded with a whole slew of little teeny tiny flying insects that are about the size of a dot. They hang out mostly around the sink even though there is no food or dirty dishes in that area. Seems like for each one I swat there are three more replacements. I am ordering more of these strips which seem to attract these pests.

I tried to find these frosted bulbs to replace a burned out one locally without success. Amazon came through as usual and shipped them immediately. Unbelievably, they arrived at 7:25AM (today) Sunday morning. The fixture in my foyer has three bulbs and these fit in with the other bulbs just fine. The bulbs work well and the price is right.

I have a large Dobie. According to the recommendations on the can I should feed him about ten pounds of this stew per day or roughly one entire case. That would eventually have him grow to a size about as big as my house. My cost would run over $1000.00/month.No way am I gonna feed my dog 10 pounds of food per day. My Dobie does like this stew so what I do is put roughly 1/2 a can of stew on top of his dry food. He is OK with that and I save about $965.00/month. This food says "Made in USA" and beneath that it says Growth and Maintenance. I hope it means the ingredients are grown in the USA and not that my dog will grow. I will continue to research the source of the ingredients and if I find that any originate in China I will discontinue giving this to my dog and change that really stupid name to "I Hate You and Your Rotten Bad Stew".

I received a 12 pound bag of this dog food which used the customary  "Made in the USA" on the back of the bag. Pet food companies are obviously of the opinion that if they claim the product was made in the USA it will be assumed by consumers that the ingredients originate in the USA as well. That is far from actuality. Ingredient sources are not provided in most cases because the pet food folks are ashamed of their ingredient source. In the case of Wellness I researched their web sites and many other sites to try to get some inkling of their ingredient source. It was not to be.I have a Dobie who will not be served any product unless I know the ingredient source is safe. This Dobie replaced a previous Dobie who was killed by being fed dog food that contained ingredients, such as chicken, from China. You may recall the news reports of the many pets that were likewise killed in this manner. Did that stop pet food companies to stop using ingredients from China? Of course not because it is the dollar that counts not the food safety.I will hang on to this bag of Wellness while I continue to search for the ingredients sources. If I cannot learn of the sources this bag will be recycled.
I have been trying various types of decaf that are brewed with a Keurig and none of them had a coffee taste. This Tim Horton's which I brewed with my Tassimo is the best yet. Thanks Tim.

This has been an enjoyable series for me.  I've read the first three books so far, and while I liked the Ellie/Brett book the most, this one is a close second.Both Carter and Regan are pretty likable characters.  Regan had a truly awful childhood, and she's still sorting through that with her mom, who's in a psychiatric institution because of severe mental illness.  (What is it with the parental figures in this series?  Almost all of them are a big bunch of suck.)  Regan and Carter start out as a one night stand, but that doesn't last long.  They were good together and good for each other.My only complaint about Carter is that he kept referring to women as chicks.  That's douchebro behavior, and he's a doctor for god's sake!  You'd think he'd move past that once he was out of high school/college.  I did like that Regan didn't put up with him calling her that.The circle of friends Regan had (Jayne, Maya and Ellie) was a great aspect of the book.  I also enjoyed Regan's conversations with Mrs. G.

I read the third book in this series (about Ellie and Brett) first, and I liked that one better.  I really liked Jayne, but it was really hard to like Nick.  I mean, the point of a romance is to root for the couple to get together, right?  I wasn't sure I wanted Nick for Jayne, I thought she deserved better.  Nick was a TERRIBLE boyfriend.  He had a girlfriend, Lisa/Linda (ok, that was pretty funny) for 3/4 of the book, and she took a back seat to Jayne 99% of the time.  Jayne was always concerned with Lisa's feelings, why wasn't Nick?  And it wasn't like Lisa was a horrible person, she was quite sweet.  She wasn't the right person for Nick, but why did it take so long for him to figure that out?  He was such a tool!  The ENTIRE TOWN could see it, Stevie Wonder could see it!Jayne had been through a lot, her grandmother was the worst, and she had no other family.  I liked how she formed friendships with Regan, Maya and Ellie, so she wasn't just pining after Nick the entire time.  Nick's dad was great, as was his cousin and sister, but his mom was kind of awful (she annoyed me much like Ellie's mom annoyed me in the third book).

Usually, Courtney Milan + historical romance = a good read.  This one didn't quite do it for me.  I liked the characters, but something was missing.Despite his stony demeanor, I really liked Smite.  The author did a great job of explaining his childhood and how it shaped the man he grew into.  I especially enjoyed the scenes with Smite and his bothers, the scene with Ash was my favorite of the book.  I liked Miranda too, although I liked her less as the book went along, and usually I love the heroines in Courtney Milan's books.  Her interference in the situation with Smite's school friend Richard annoyed me.  Really, Richard annoyed me, his character was kind of useless.My interest waned whenever the story focused on the Patron.  It didn't seem all that believable, and I found myself not caring when the identity is finally revealed.I much prefer the books in the Brothers Sinister series.

Another good addition to the series.  Bella and Rafe were both likable characters, and I liked the fact that they were really close, supportive friends as well as something more.  Lianne turned out to be a great supporting character, after a not-so-good start.  Her devious mind was a real asset to Bella.  I'm looking forward to her story.This book tackles some pretty serious and timely subjects, but it doesn't come off super preachy or a total downer.  The fact that Bella and Rafe came from completely different economic backgrounds, and it didn't cause any problems for them was refreshing.

I borrowed this with Prime, and it was a good choice.  It started off a little slow, but once Jamie and Wes were a couple it it kept my interest.  It was funny, sweet and quite hot.Of the two, Jamie was the more likable character, showing a lot more maturity than Wes at times.  Wes thought Jamie would freak that he was gay and all Jamie said was "I'm from Northern California", I loved that.I loved Jamie's family and after reading the epilogue, wanted to spend more time with them.  The contrast between his parents and Wes' was stark.

This is the fourth book of the series I've read, and I'm a little disappointed.  The blurb indicated this one would be different from the ones before it, but it really wasn't.Again with the sexism, another woman who's only had one sexual partner and the dom who's been around the block a few thousand times.  If I'd done a shot every time Sawyer mentioned Chloe's innocence I'd be in a coma.This could have been an interesting book, a woman who is not a submissive and not interested in BDSM and a dom who might be wiling to give it up for her.  But it turns out she is a sub, she just didn't know it until he told her (ugh) she just isn't into the public stuff.  And all he really gives up is his club membership, he gets to be in charge of all the sexy times with Chloe.  "So tell me Chloe, what woman do you want to be:  an inhibited one, or a woman ready to explore?"  Because of course, if you're not into kink, you're boring.  Cue my eye roll.

In the last few months I've been doing a lot of barre workouts.  I bought a bundle of DVD's from Barre 3 featuring Sadie Lincoln and I really like her as an instructor.There are two workouts filmed in a gorgeous outdoor setting.  Burn & Firm is a lot more challenging than Lengthen & Strengthen.  I was sweating up a storm and my legs were shaking durning B & F, whereas L & S was much more gentle.Compared to the Barre 3 workouts that I've done, these have almost no upper body work and I missed that element.  Also, the instructions are done via voiceover, in the B 3 workouts they have microphones.  I don't like the voiceover as much.This is a good introduction (and a great price) to barre workouts.

I've recently added Barre 3 workouts into my exercise routine, so I bought these socks for that purpose.  It took a little getting used to the fit of the toes, simply not being used to that.  But I really like using them.  Before, I would be sweaty and then my feet would slide around on the mat.  Now, I stay in place, and they're comfortable to wear.I wear a size 10 women's shoe, and the M/L were the perfect size.

This is the third book in this series I've read, and I'm glad I didn't start with this one even though it's the first.  The others I've read are better than this one.The heroine of the book is Ellie Mae Clampett, err Presley, from Apple Pie-ville.  When she's not frozen in a perpetual blush, she likes to read kinky erotica.  She's 25 and has had one boyfriend her entire life.  So of course her roommate Cora decides that the local BDSM dungeon is the place for her.  Just because I read this book does not mean I'm looking for this type of stuff in real life.Of course Dmitri, the dom who trains her, is completely enraptured by her blushing innocence.  Like the other doms in this series, he's taken lessons in how to speak like a condescending a****** to women.  Like the other books in the series, we have the pathetic woman who needs super dom to rescue her.  He makes sure to tell her exactly what she needs, because she's clearly too dumb to figure it out for herself.One of her hard limits is humiliation, so after two days of training Dmitri decides to punish her by humiliating her?  Apparently she's on the fast track sub training.  "The time for gentleness had ended."  After all she'd had TWO DAYS of training.  "Her submission, body, heart and soul were his for the taking."  Of course they were, it's already DAY THREE!In this world, only the doms are allowed to have well paying/interesting careers, while the subs seem to have mundane jobs.  God forbid she have a more important job than him.  She even mentions that she's glad she has a less responsible job (oooh, all that thinking!!!!).  Plus, he makes a few remarks to imply her job is clearly beneath him, I guess that's partly how he keeps her in her place.  The other part is clearly his immense manhood.There really isn't a lot of angst or drama in this book, save a little with Presley's ex Steven.  Thought I was actually on Steven's side when he told Dmitri to stop talking to her like she's a child.  But clearly, she's into it, so to each their own.

I liked this as much as the first book except for one aspect and that's why I gave it three stars instead of four.**************MILD SPOILERS****************It comes out that Sam got pregnant in college, when she was 19-20.  She decided she wasn't able to take care of a baby and decided to have an abortion.  Right before the procedure, she miscarries.  How convenient to take the easy way out rather than have the character stand by her decision to have a legal medical procedure.  It comes out in the press later and people are looking at Sam like she burned down an orphanage on Christmas.  Even Nick, who claims to be pro-choice, is all "why not adoption?".  Ugh, it's like he doesn't understand what the word choice means.

This book really, really needs a good editor.  There are numerous typos throughout.  The most glaring example is near the end when aroused is used instead of roused, considering the context it was particularly cringe worthy.  Beyond the typos, the story is bogged down by so much unnecessary detail.  Every time Bailey walks into a room she describes it in painstaking detail.  There was just so much mundane life stuff that it made my mind wander.  Really, the book could be shortened by a third.Honestly, the best parts of the book were the dark parts (and the part at the end with Anna and Nick), because these were the parts that made me feel something.  I felt sadness, rage and violence, I wanted to rip off Stephen's face with my fingernails.  But the rest of the book didn't make me feel much of anything, except annoyance and disbelief.Jax and Bailey's relationship happened way too fast, especially considering the Bailey had been abused (in the most horrific ways) her entire life.  The day after Jax meets her he starts calling her angel and he's always touching her face.  I find that creepy, why doesn't a woman who's terrified of men?  And I found Jax's lines so cheesy.  But he's not always cheesy, he also has rage issues, which is the last thing an abused woman needs in her life.Andrew seemed to exist only to be the cliche gay friend.  He has a huge crush on Jax, but Jax is NOT GAY!  I know because it's pointed out numerous times that it could never happen.  I get it, Jax is straight!As horrific as Bailey's life with Stephen is portrayed, I can't help but be skeptical.  She was hospitalized numerous times and no one noticed she had scars all over her body.  Doctors are required to report that kind of stuff.  I get Stephen was a well connected lawyer, but come on, it's not like he could have all of law enforcement in his back pocket.  That's the kind of stuff that takes me right out of the story.

One thing this book made me appreciate is authors who have a gift for writing realistic dialogue.  Nothing about this book felt realistic to me.  Not only could I not connect with the characters, I didn't like them at all.  They all seemed selfish and petty.  Honestly, I didn't get the sense that Quinn and Chase even liked each other (even when the book was almost over), let alone believe that they were falling in love.My random thoughts as I was reading:Soap opera actors do not make that much money, no way could Ginger afford a house like that.  Paparazzi don't follow around soap actors, either.  Maybe if one of the characters had been friends with a Kardashian, I could believe it.Quinn works at what Chase calls an "elite restaurant", where movie stars eat, yet Quinn spends her down time wiping down menus?  It's like calling  IHOP elite.Why is Chase still on a soap opera if he's got so many movie offers he's turning them down left and right.Someone needs to clue in NA authors (not just this author) that smirking isn't sexy.  It mostly screams "I'm a douchebag!"If birth control pills really had the effectiveness that they do in romance books, there would be an enormous population explosion.  And what kind of idiot doesn't insist on condoms when having sex with an admitted manwhore?Saying, "you're absolutely immaculate" to someone after having sex is really weird.

I borrowed this ebook from my library.This book could have been so much better.  There were parts that were really good, but I found myself really frustrated with it more often than not.  My main problem was Miles POV, and unfortunately this was every other chapter (although, thankfully, they were much shorter than Tate's).  It was like reading a "Fun With Dick and Jane" book, soooooo distracting!  Because of the way it was written, I got no sense of chemistry between Miles and Rachel, no sense of anything really.  And that should have been some emotional stuff, but it just fell flat.And I also have a problem with weak heroines who let a**hole guys walk all over them and treat them like crap.  Tate reiterates over and over that she knows nothing about Miles, so why is she falling in love with him?  He's defined the terms of their "relationship" (f*** buddies), he'll never love her, never let her in.I feel like I'm listing only negatives even though I've given this three stars, and there were good parts.  The story is well written, I finished it in a day, so clearly it kept my interest.  I loved Cap and Ian, particularly Ian who should be sainted for being such a loyal friend to Miles.  The scene with Rachel and Miles near the end was pretty powerful, and the last few chapters were pretty awesome.

I borrowed this ebook from my library.The best parts of this book, hands down, were the supporting characters.  Sam and Asha especially.  I also really liked Chelsea's parents, they felt authentic.Chelsea was completely awful in the beginning (as was the point), and although she didn't quite redeem herself by the end, she did grow and mature quite a bit.  For a short book there was a lot going on:  bullying, gossiping, homophobia, sex, violence.  The vow of silence thing kind of deflated on itself, I felt like it didn't fully reach its potential.  But the story did keep my interest, I read it in an afternoon.

Like the other books I've read by Jessica Scott, this one is quite emotional.  Both Sam and Patrick tugged at my heartstrings, especially Sam, she just seemed so lost.  She's conscious of what she's doing, pushing Patrick away and not being a present mother to Natalie, but she feels powerless to change things.  Completely numb.I liked the way Patrick fought to save their family, but didn't go all alpha caveman to do it.  He simply said he wasn't giving up and was there for her.  There were moments of sadness, anger, passion and levity, and it felt real and believable.The ending left me with a smile.

After reading a few books that were terrible, frustrating or just plain "meh", this was a nice change of pace.  It's a quick (less than 30 minutes), sweet story about a high school crush.  Sadie and Aaron both have a crush on the other, but of course think that it's not reciprocated.  There are also undertones of class differences and how hurtful believing stereotypes can be.  All in all, it left me with a smile on my face.

I'm glad I got this from the library instead of buying it, because I'm pretty ambivalent about it.  Since there are already so many reviews, I will explain my rating by comparing it to some similar series I've read.It's far better than the "This Man" series by Jodi Ellen Malpas, where I was praying for a murder/suicide of the two main characters.  Even years after reading it, my hatred still burns for those characters.It's slightly better than the 50 Shades series, and J. Kenner is definitely a better writer than E.L. James.  I liked Nikki and Damien a little better than Ana "the color beige is more interesting than I am" Steele and Christian "I'm a stalker with creepy E.T. fingers" Grey.It's no where near as good as the Crossfire series by Sylvia Day.  Everything between Eva and Gideon also happens at warp speed, but I felt "it" as I was reading, it was palpable.  And no other author that I've read brings on the steamy like Sylvia Day.I've got the other two books in this series on hold from the library, but I'm not sure I'm interested.

I glad I checked this out from the library instead of buying it, because it was a really frustrating read.  Suckered by all the good reviews again!Where this book fails spectacularly is in all the flashbacks, especially putting them in the beginning of the book (and really there are way more flashbacks than present day).  I would have liked it so much more if we'd gotten to know Cassie and Ethan in the present first.  Present day Ethan seems like maybe he's an ok guy, but college Ethan is an enormous jerk.  I could not see a SINGLE redeeming quality in him, not one.  Why would I root for Cassie to give him another chance when he's such a colossal a**hole?  It took me very little time to completely hate him, at least let me see some of the good first!Maybe I've read too many NA books in the last few years and my tolerance level is at an all time low.  I'm SO OVER doormat virgins who keep going back to guys that treat them like crap.  And I'm even more over these guys who act like brooding a**holes and still have women falling all over them.  And part of me couldn't even feel sorry for Cassie about the way Ethan was treating her, because she just kept taking it!  Even when she finally (!!!!) has enough and breaks it off, she's crawling back in a few days.  And his excuses were the lamest ever.  Really, your high school relationship didn't work out, how shocking (said no one ever).The only reason this gets two stars instead of one is because I liked some of the present day stuff.  But 99% of me doesn't want Cassie to give him another chance, no matter how much he grovels and says he's changed.  Cassie was right when she said people would think she's and idiot for going back to him.  Even so, I'm on the waiting list at the library for the next book, hopefully it will be more in the present and college Ethan will be a distant memory.

Nothing in this book made sense.  My WTF face was on the whole time I was reading.  The idea was a good one, unfortunately it was not executed well.  The dialogue was completely unrealistic and cheesy.Everything moves at warp speed.  Even for teenagers, many of whom fall in and out of "love" at the drop of a hat, things moved at warp speed.  Hey, there's a cute guy!  He kissed my hand and looks at me all dreamy-like!  I think I'll have sex with him in a car in broad daylight hours after I meet him!  That happens within the first few chapters, and then it's teenage angst interspersed with a biological weapon making dad on the run from the FBI and other secret government agencies.There are five parts to the book, alternating between Luke and Bea's POV.  Luke's chapters were nearly intolerable.  He's beaten and left partially brain damaged, which turns him into a jerk and a super athlete.  Um, ok.  But when we get back to Bea, she's gone from wallflower to drinking, drugs and a sort-of orgy.The further the book goes along, the sillier it gets, and I can only suspend my belief so much, even in fiction.After rereading my review, I realize it doesn't make much sense, but neither does the book so...

This book has been on my TBR list for almost a year, so I was a little fuzzy in the details about who Sawyer and Jared were from the Him/Her books.  While I caught up quickly, I wasn't in love with the romance in this book.Sawyer is a free spirit, not one to be tied down.  Jared has been in love with her for awhile, and waits patiently (almost too patiently) for almost the entire book for Sawyer to catch up.  Sawyer and Jared were both nice, good, people but I just never got that excited about their romance.  There was a lot of sex (almost too much), and it kind of made the story drag for me.Surprisingly, where to story shined the most was Sawyer coming to terms with her past.  Finding out about her grandmother, going to visit people and places from her past, these parts felt more interesting to me.

I have to admit I like this little book more than I do other "reference" books out there. It travels with me every call day and it surely helps to read a topic in 1-2 minutes prior to engaging a "clinical scenario". A must read.

You have to love this item. For a fair price you get the best of Hairo. V60 and an elegant decanter. From coffee snobs like myself to the amateur coffee brewer, this item will please most coffee drinkers. Now, the cone itself is made of plastic. If you have a problem with this you should be looking into a V60 that is made of ceramic.

While the design is interesting, I do not believe this is a good "fit" for most users out there. For almost $30 you could purchase a better product, perhaps without the headband, but with better sound quality. Disclaimer: I was provided with a free sample in exchange for a review.

Love it. Protects the iphine very well while remaining slim and portable. It quickly replaced my old case. The strongest feature for me is the accessory limb it comes with which you pop open to recline the phone in an optimal position to watch vids and flicks.

I kindly received an invitation to try this product for free in an exchange for the review.First off this product is qualified as a handbag and as such must be treated and reviewed as such. To add on to it it also says "briefcase" in the description, and this bag surely seems to fit such qualifiers. I will also add that I'm not a fan of handbags. My best coloquial description of this would be a "Murse" or a man purse. That said I would not have bought this on my own. However, there are several pointers to be made about this particular Murse:The dark, brown, almost milk-cholocate leather color is suitable for any individual to use it, either female or male. The details, for example, straps and bolts are not flashy yet do remind a similar fashion design in women's purse--which is a turndown for me. The straps that would qualify it as a handbag also make it look like a purse. The material is what appears to be well tailored and treated leather. Now I'm no connoisseur when it comes to leather, but it looks genuine to me. The insides are cotton. The protective inner pocket that would hold your laptop, books, etc., isn't grand or as stylish as the outside. So be wary. This detail actually made me take off another star (-1 star for looks in general). All in all I would say it's an OK Murse (man-purse) that would suit most men or women who're into this style.I'm the type of guy that prefers a normal Adidas backpack to carry my laptop around, but that's just me. If you're like me, perhaps this is not the product you're looking for. If you're into a Murse and would like to look in style (and accept the details as depicted above in exchange for your $$), then this is your product.

I'll start off by saying I'm grateful for having received this product in exchange for a review. However it will not alter my analysis of the product: its presentation, durability, and performance.Presentation: The dispenser is made of plastic, making it seem like a durable "polished" metal type of dispenser. Not that there's anything wrong with plastic, however it does stain after a couple of uses with kitchen gunk. It uses 4 AAA batteries which makes the device quite uncomfortable as a rechargeable dispenser would be preferred. In terms of how long the batteries last is difficult to tell. See why in the explanation below.Durability and Performance: The device worked well for over 1 month and then it crashed. What!? Well...yes. The device stopped working. We changed the batteries and the device was still silent. After inspecting the battery chamber is was evident gunk was building up inside the AAA chamber. What? I think this is a flaw of the device. Yes it comes with a small fame so it the battery chamber will never make contact with water; however I think this is why the device malfunctioned. Water entered the battery chamber and it stopped working. This is clearly a flaw in the design. The soap dispenser is made to be in the countertop, alongside kitchen stuff and soap and the disaster of a post-meal sink. Bottom line is: I do not recommend this product. Shortly after it stopped working I went back to using my usual pump-ing hand soap dispenser. If you can't beat the basics its definitely not worth purchasing.
I paid $55 bucks for this work of art during a promotion. High quality sound, high qulity build, a solid purchase. Absolutely recommended for the meticulous user in search of quality and durability.

Should be enough if you're looking for low quality sound during auscultation of any sound emitted by the human body. However, if you truly wish to have a superb physical I would suggest another stethoscope. This device is good for a quick exam. Meticulous users should use other more soffisticated equipment.

Love at first sight. Oh yeah. I received this little critter in exchange for a review, and boy am I a happy reviewer. Lovely speakers. The size is just right, the sound profound and a-booming that you'll be shocked such sound can come forth from such a small device. The actual color of the speakers are darker than the one on the picture shown, making it more elegant that you'd think. I don't know much about decibles and am in no position to discuss with you the minutiae of sound; but as a layman I can tell you these speakers make damn good job of sounding near perfect given its size and portability. Rechargeable batteries make it even a better choice, so you won't have to worry about packing AAA batteries anywhere. My advice would be: if you're looking for portable speakers and would like to get a higher end and affordable set, then get this one. Very recommended.

There's a short version of this review at the very bottom. If you'd the extended version, hold on and plunge into its words:And as I close the gap between me and the book Ready Player One, a deep sense of nostalgia surges over me, such as the one that has powerfully embodied me after finishing a book I have loved and will remember perpetually (at least as long as my brain function remains intact).The depth of detail the author grants his readers is surreal. It will most definitely immerse you deep within the world of the OASIS, and especially for the generation that has witnessed the creation and evolution of the video game, this book will resonate with them. I bet the effect it will have on most of us geeks who have loved and cherished video games, we will be easily transported in the OASIS, even in the absence of an immersion rig, suit, or gloves.The characters were superbly developed. The main character I felt had an excellent development as the story progressed. I especially liked the parallels between his life within the OASIS in comparisson to his existence in the real world, of how those two lives converged and diverged in different parts of the story, and of course of how it unraveled in the end. The other characters that leave a strong impression are Aech, Art3mis, Shoto, Daito, Og, Anorak, and Serranto, with whom it is easy to sympathize with.The plot and the development of the story was excellent. You start off in the OASIS world as a normal user named Parzival and quickly immerse into the deep culture that has flowered in the world of the OASIS. The effect of the megacorporation trying to grasp it all, the unrelenting search for power and its ultimate effects on freedom, are all palpable struggles in the story, to the extent it resonates with you and the reality we live in today. Our hero, in the end, prevails defending freedom to create and to navigate a world free of oppression and control; where we converge as a humanity in our trouble times of undeclared yet fierce wars, of tyrants ravaging lands and burning thousands in exchange for ultimate control.The reality is our technological world isn't far away form creating an immersion rig that will allow us to live parallel lives and realities. You can already see how people interact in complete anonymity and the benefits and consequences of such interaction. With both pros and cons, as you can easily fall for a personality or "spirit" of a user of unknown age or sex. The purity of this click is heavily exploited in the book Ready Player One, one of the many currents of the book very well developed by the author. Many of us have friends around the globe who's avatar might be quite different from their real persona, resemble a phantom they cherish or wish they were in some parallel reality. And these friends, as far away and strange as they might be, are still bound to us by the ties for friendship.I will end this book review by saying YOU HAVE TO READ IT, especially if you've ever played a video game in your life and have fallen in love with it and its characters. For me, Zelda - The Ocarina of Time, Grandia II, Halo, Half-Life, Super Mario Bros, and many others, have been worlds I visit once in a while in the deep vaults of memory. I see a movie of this book is on the way, a fact that makes me cringe. It can go both ways, or either be a superb film reaching fat beyond what the detailed book could do, or fall short. If the author is involved in the development of the movie (I hope he is), such as Fight Club and Gone Girl were, perhaps we might yet expect a grand movie that will best the book. A feat I feel will be very difficult to achieve, yet not impossible.Short version of the review: READ THE BOOK!
Awesome, sturdy material built to last indeed! Ideal for oven baking, smoking, and grilling. Gives you a tight grip while protecting you from the heat.

It's a good starters book to begin understanding the simple complexity of getting more readers. But after reading Write, Publish, Reteat, it truly raised the bar and left "your first 1000 copies" under the bar.

Loved it. Th price is just right. The material is...well just what you would expect from a $15 pair of headphones. It's by no means luxurious and not rock-solid, but it gets the job done and pretty well at that. The sound quality is superb. I mean, if you're a "gusto" kind of person looking for that palate-refined sounds, I bet you already know you're looking at the wrong product. This is for the layperson who doesn't give a crap about a few details in decibles and other idiosyncrasies, but enjoys good sound and good bass...and a low price. I absolutely love it and, such as was stated by a reviewer previously, it's awesome there's no branding nor pictures invading the ear set. It just is.In terms of comfortability its pretty comfortable on your ears and head, enabling you to wear them for hours on end. One reviewer argued the cable wasn't long enough--I disagree. It's just right. If you're the type of person who listens to music more than a few meters from your computer, then you're probably better off getting a blue-tooth set (and sacrifice more precious $$ in exchange for some freedom). In conclusion, get this if your demands meet the product description and if this review helped you at all in deciding whether or not to get them.  One turn-off (and this is merely superfluous) is the packaging. It gave me an initial shock to find the box was so little and light-weight. Then I unraveled the insides and was happy thereafter. Of course, this detail by no means damages the product's review since its performance is great as depicted above.Amazon Basics products offers a nice variety of stuff to which I respond--if you need a reviewer for such stuff, I'll very gladly put in the work and review such items.

This book is the true champion regarding self-publishing. It is the go-to manual every indie author should read not once, but at least two times straight out. As in Sparta, the leader was a soldier battling shoulder-to-shoulder with his comrades; this book is the leader inspired by the misgivings and blossoms of hard working indie authors who are inspired to create amazing stories compelled by a vision full of art and emotion. Not only have they manage to inspire me as an author con continue plowing the field of words, but have also given me hope in finding the truest of camaraderie when a soldier tells another soldier--yes, it's a rough road; walk on and you will eventually see the light. Get this book and please, get the print book too. It's a reference manual, not just a story you should discard.

Over the years Greg Ip had transitioned in my perception from financial journalist and follower of the latest economic news to something higher.  His surveys of the US economy were well worth pulling out of the middle of the Economist and keeping as a reference.This book calls that judgement into question.During the crisis many people commented that we could draw an analogy between the work of forest fires for the health of the forest and recessions for the health of the economy.  It was rather interesting.Greg Ip takes this analogy and turns it into a book.The book fails because analogies are just that: analogies.  At some point they break down and at 280 pages this opus stretches them way past the point where that happens.So if you want to get a smattering of knowledge about the Peltzman Effect, ecological systems, forest fire management, the insurance business, the European lending crisis, the AIG debacle, levies on the Mississippi and in Holland, how to run an airline and the role of capital in banking mixed in with interviews only the phenomenal access Greg Ip and his ilk enjoy, then thats cool, this book is for you.If its serious analysis you want, if you want to be able to hold a conversation with somebody who works in Immunology or Psychology or Forestry or Medicine or Insurance or Aviation or Banking or even Central Banking and do not want to come off as a dilettante who is merely parroting easy-to-digest platitudes, best you dont read this at all.I can only comment on the stuff I understand well:  So for example Germany is allegedly to blame for the fact that Greece has borrowed money it cannot pay back because it is the lender who makes it possible for the borrower to borrow.  Thats plainly ridiculous.  Its a macroeconomic explanation for microeconomic ills which mainly affect Greece, Portugal, Italy and Spain (and the north of Europe too, of course, but at least they can afford the sundry inefficiencies in their market structure)  And it's, of course, an argument the financial press has put forward to justify the unjustifiable solutions that are currently being pursued, namely the official sectors perpetuation of the rot in the south of Europe in the interest of avoiding overall change.Banks Greg Ip really really really does not understand.  He thinks banks take depositors money and lend it to borrowers.  That was true, dunno, five hundred years ago, and even then it was half true.  Its certainly not how M3 is generated, for example.  With most of the money that goes around, both the deposit and the loan are generated in the banking system itself, of course.  M3 arises when you come to the branch to ask for a loan, I approve it, I open you a bank account and stick the money in there (my liability) in exchange for expecting you to pay me back one day with interest (the banks asset).
