He avoids the trap--conspicuous in the writings of Harry Harootunian, the editor of the series in which this book is published--of pure speculation that loses sight of empirical material. Manufacturing Modern Japanese Literature opens avenues for future research--some suggested, some implicit--, and should be read by all readers interested by Japanese literature or by literary criticism.

Knowledge about global products is itself global. We know about them even before they are sold in a store nearby. Indeed, shaping consumer expectations is part of the strategies of global firms, and has given rise to a whole marketing industry. Everybody knows, for instance, that McDonald's restaurants are to be found in all major cities in the world, and that they provide a food service experience that is both homogeneous and predictable (if not palatable to gourmet palates!) The Golden Arches, McDonald's trademark, have become an icon of international business and popular culture, and the Big Mac a symbol of junk food and fast service. There are even talks about McJobs, McWages, and a Big Mac Index tracking exchange rates.People who have travelled in Asia know that some fast food specialties are customized to accommodate local tastes--the Maharaja Mac contains chicken, not beef, and teriyaki burgers are to be found not only in Japan, but also in Taiwan and Hong Kong. Some McDonald's publics are specifically Asian, as witnessed by familiar scenes in ordinary restaurants: school kids in uniform having a snack on their way home or before cram school; office ladies enjoying a relaxed atmosphere; lively birthday parties during week-ends. We know the story. It has been told before: by articles in the international press, by case studies in business schools, and by direct observation when one ventures abroad. What can the reader possibly learn that he does not already know? And what can a team of anthropologists bring to the task that does not duplicate the narratives of journalists and business writers?Such skepticism was met by the five authors of Golden Arches East when they embarked on their collective endeavor to study McDonald's restaurants in five East Asian locations. Some academic colleagues accused them of legitimizing corporate hype, or of elevating to the status of a research project what could at best be handled as a sophomore class assignment. Few took them seriously, and they had to give justifications for their choice of topic. For James L. Watson and his coauthors, studying McDonald's is not only anecdotical: "To dismiss enterprises like McDonald's as somehow unworthy of serious inquiry is not only elitist, it is also suicidal for our discipline." As an academic field attached to cultural change, anthropology has to focus on terrains where change actually takes place, and the evolution of food habits is a prime example of cultural evolution.Besides, the fast food industry and its adaptation to East Asian urban cultures is a good test of theories that take a critical perspective on the transnational transmission of cultural norms. Is McDonald's an instrument of American imperialism, of cultural homogenization, and of commodity fetishism? In the lead author's terms: "Does the spread of fast food undermine the integrity of indigenous cuisines? Are food chains helping to create a homogenous global culture better suited to the needs of a capitalist world order?" When observing, in true anthropological fashion, people who actually eat and spend time at McDonald's, a different and more nuanced picture emerges. As James Watson underscores in his introduction, cultural adoption is a two-way street. McDonald's has indeed effected small but influential changes in East Asian dietary patterns, in ways that are more subtle than the critics of imperialism would surmise. At the same time, East Asian consumers have quietly, and in some cases stubbornly, transformed their neighborhood McDonald's into local institutions, again not always in the direction that was planned by corporate headquarters.What strikes the reader of Golden Arches East, more than the differences and variations across the five Asian localities, are the common patterns and repetitions in different cultural contexts. Sandwiches are produced according to a rigidly uniform process detailed in a 600-pages manual. The menu served at McDonald's is broadly the same from Tokyo to Hong Kong, from Seoul to Taipei, and the local adaptations serve only to underscore the homogeneity of the service provided. Customers usually, but not always, order a standard combo of three flagship products: the Big Mac, French fries, and a Coke. As the authors note astutely, "the keystone of this winning combination is not, as most observers might assume, the Big Mac or even the generic hamburger. It is the fries."This fact, added to the cultural trait that the hamburger is classified as bread or bun more than as meat, explains why fast food cuisine is usually considered as "snack" by Asian consumers. A proper meal must contain rice, which the McDonald's menu does not include. As a consequence, McDonald's restaurants are often used as meeting places, leasure centers, or even after-school clubs: middle school students usually sit there for hours, studying, gossiping, and picking over snacks. Another Asian characteristics is the presence of a majority of female customers. Women appreciate the relaxed atmosphere, the clean toilets, and the non-alcohol policy that keeps some noisy male customers away.The localization process of the McDonald's franchise also follows a similar cycle that is closely correlated with the level of development and openness of a given country. The first opening of a McDonald's facility in a foreign capital is not a minor event. The startup dates (1971 in Japan, 1975 in Hong-Kong, 1984 in Taiwan, 1988 in Seoul, 1992 in Beijing) closely follows the emergence of a new urban middle class with purchasing power and cosmopolitan tastes. The first McDonald's are usually located in prestigious districts (Ginza in Tokyo, Tiananmen in Beijing) and are first perceived as upmarket restaurants offering American cuisine (and culture) to a new class of young entrepreneurs and professionals who can afford the experience. These yuppies and foreigners are quickly followed by thrill-seeking teenagers and by young couples looking for a romantic date spot. Children are also prime movers in the creation of McDonald's East Asian clienteles. It is they who bring their parents or grandparents to the franchise, which offers a child-friendly environment complete with a play corner, birthday party salons, and iconic characters like Ronald McDonald or his female companion Auntie McDonald.During this first phase of installation, McDonald's employees have to "educate" customers to the rules of fast food restaurants. During McDonald's first weeks of operation in Moscow, employees distributed information sheets to people standing in queues, telling them how to order and what to do after paying. The first discipline is to form a line in front of cashiers: in Hong Kong during the 1970s, customers packed themselves into disorderly scrums and jostled for a chance to place their orders. Similarly, customers at first generally do not bus their own trays and leave without attending to their own rubbish. Napkins placed in public dispensers disappear faster than they can be replaced. Without guidance, elderly people are likely to disassemble the Big Mac layer by layer, and eat only these parts that appeal to them.After several years, when local managers think their business is well established, new items are introduced in the menu to suit local tastes in order to boost sales. The street-corner McDonald's restaurant is transformed from an essentially "foreign" setting into a place at once familiar and indigenous. The transformation from exotic to ordinary repeats itself across fast-growing East Asia at ten or twenty years intervals. Today it has become hard to convince a Taiwanese or a Korean child, whose favorite venue for birthday parties is McDonald's, that hamburgers are not part of the local food culture. McDonald's restaurants in most major Asian cities are packed wall-to-wall with people of all ages, few of whom are seeking an American cultural experience. For many people however, particularly in the politically sensitive contexts of Korea or China, McDonald's is not simply a corporation: it is also a representation of "the West" or "America". Some intellectuals see it as a symbol of American cultural imperialism--defined as the encroachment of cultural practices and values that reflect American political and economic power.Are they right? Obviously much more than cuisine is involved when McDonald's first comes to town. It is a signal that the country is open for business, and that its citizens are wholeheartedly embracing globalization. They are buying much more than food, even if food is all that McDonald's is selling. As Stephen Mintz argues in the closing chapter, "Goods are embedded in their culture of origin; their introduction into a different culture is more than a simple importation of commodities." The McDonald's experience embodies quintessential American values: it is fun, friendly, and familiar. Consumers are treated based on the principles of individualism and equality, especially between male and female customers. The restaurants reflect cleanliness, efficiency, transparency, and economy. These features affect the way in which such food service is perceived by people in the host culture.The cultural transplant sometimes creates misunderstandings. In Hong Kong for instance, people are suspicious of anyone who displays what is perceived to be an excess of congeniality. The visible smile that McDonald's employees were instructed to wear could be tantamount to a challenge. Similar reactions are reported by contributors who worked in Taiwan and Korea. In fact, the longer McDonald's operates in an East Asian city, the less evident are the forced smiles. Consumers are far more concerned with efficiency, reliability, and hygiene. And the penetration of American influence that intellectuals associate with McDonald's does not seem to bother ordinary customers. As Watson concludes his chapter on Hong Kong, "Having watched the process of culture change unfold for nearly thirty years, it is apparent to me that the ordinary people of Hong Kong have most assuredly not been stripped of their cultural heritage, nor have they become the uncomprehending dupes of transnational corporations."As a last comment, Golden Arches East also reflects the fast pace of change in East Asia. Based on fieldwork conducted in the early 1990s, many chapters have become completely obsolete or have acquired historical value as testimonies of a bygone era. It is hard to imagine the long queues that formed when McDonald's opened its first restaurant in Beijing in 1994; and the pocket bells or "pokeberu" carried by Japanese school children have long been relegated to history's dustbin. The chapters on Korea and on Taiwan also heavily bear the mark of the times. The first was written during the "rice wars" when Korean farmers protested against foreign food imports, taking McDonald's as a symbol of the loss of Korean identity. The chapter on Taiwan also reflects the politics of identity that opposed cosmopolitans from the mainland to Taiwanese natives reconnecting with their roots by chewing betel nuts.This historical context may explain why the book somehow overestimates the role of politics and does not devote enough attention to the "theater of the familiar" that fast food restaurants have now become. Meanwhile, yuppies in Tokyo, Shanghai and Hong Kong have upgraded to the Michelin guide, whose publication in select major Asian cities has been accompanied by much publicity and debates. An anthropology of the impact that the famous red guide has had on haute cuisine in the Asian cities where it was launched, remains to be written.

The Chrysanthemum and the Sword, Margaret Mead once remarked, was a book that could safely be put in the hands of generals or congressmen. Similarly, the book was adopted by generations of students, visitors and businessmen looking for easy clues for understanding Japanese culture. First published in 1946, Ruth Benedict's essay was able to reach different targets and to pursue different goals--from the "know thy enemy" of occupying forces to the "know thy ally" of cold war officials and the "understand thy competitor" of US business executives. For an extended period of time, the Japanese were the most alien partner America ever had to deal with. Benedict's book therefore had successive leases of life, and was read anew by different publics.Such longevity is indeed rare for a social science book--all the more so for an essay written on the spur of the moment, and with a specific goal in mind. I can think of no other war propaganda material that has so well served the objectives of peace. Similarly, it is hard to imagine nowadays a policy maker or a military officer reading the work of a contemporary anthropologist to inform his decision-making process. The idea to commission a report by an anthropologist on a strategic policy issue would be alien to a modern bureaucrat. Today, anthropologists themselves would oppose being enrolled for a military cause, and few would accept the assignment to write on demand. But such were the times in the period immediately following World War II: anthropology was a young discipline that captured the imagination of the masses, and the nation was united behind common goals and values.As mentioned, Ruth Benedict wrote her book as a response to an official assignment: to understand Japan in order to propose a course of action for US military forces occupying the land. The book finds its origins in the works of the Office of War Information, which enrolled all the help it could find in order to adjust war messages and military tactics to its strategic objectives. "Whether the issue was military or diplomatic, whether it was raised by questions of high policy or of leaflets to be dropped behind the Japanese front lines, every insight was important," Benedict recalls. Different materials were collected, not least the testimonies of Japanese men and women which the author was able to interview on US soil despite the policy of forced confinement, and to whom she addressed her grateful acknowledgments in the book's opening message.The behavior of the Japanese, at war or in peace, was read as an enigma. They had fought as formidable foes against US forces on the battlegrounds of the Pacific, and had vowed to resist invasion of their homeland with desperate energy. But once the Emperor told them that the war was over and they had lost, they accepted all that such a fact implied, and actively cooperated with the occupier. Already during the war, Japanese soldiers and officers, who treated their war prisoners harshly and fought to the death instead of surrendering, gave their full cooperation to the Allied forces and turned into model prisoners when taken into custody. On the political front, Japan transformed itself almost overnight from an authoritarian state into a fledging democracy.Benedict's preferred course of action was to treat Japan with respect and forgiveness. One strategy to plead for such an understanding policy could have been to emphasize the commonalities between the Japanese and the Americans. There was indeed a case for such an appeal: "we must show mercy and compassion because they are like us," one could have argued. "They have been abused by treacherous leaders and isolated from foreign influence, but we will bring the Japanese people into the fold, and bestow upon them the gift of liberal democracy." Ruth Benedict argues exactly the opposite. Not that she thinks that the Japanese are not fit for democracy; but they must come to it at their own pace and on their own terms, not by fiat and imposition from an alien power. "Japan will have to rebuild her self-respect today on her own basis, not on ours," she writes.Throughout the book, the author emphasizes difference and otherness. The Japanese are not like us. They behave differently; they are subject to different values and principles; and their key concepts do not translate easily into English. Examples of this abnormality abound: "Men appointed to read [the Imperial Rescripts] have killed themselves because they misread a sentence." Teachers are burned to death dashing into flames in order to rescue the picture of the Emperor which was hung in every school. A samurai father holds his sword upon the throat of his son undergoing surgery, menacing to kill him if he utters one cry. Zen disciples sit in an ice-cold waterfall before dawn, or spend eight years reflecting on a riddle. In this strange environment, words acquire a different meaning, and the effort at translating them into English is wholly deceptive. "Makoto does not mean what sincerity does in English usage. It means both far less and far more." The notion of "on" implies "a return upon this indebtedness and therefore it means love. But the primary meaning is the debt, whereas we think of love as something freely given unfettered by obligation." As for "giri", "there is no possible English equivalent and of all the strange categories of moral obligations which anthropologists find in the culture of the world, it is one of the most curious."Benedict does not seek to unriddle Japan and the Japanese by moderating this sense of otherness, but by accentuating it. She does so by several rhetorical figures, which all contribute to the pervasive feeling of strangeness. She repeatedly uses Japanese words and concepts that introduce a distance between the text and its meaning, as most of her readers are not familiar with the notions employed. She borrows examples from John Embree's Suye Mura, whose stories of ribaldry and other folkways from the countryside would seem strange to any urbanite. She draws parallels between social arrangements and habits of life in Japan on the one hand and customs or institutions found among the primitive tribes of the Pacific islands or Papua New Guinea on the other. She highlights comparisons with China, itself a different culture from a Western perspective, only to emphasize that Japan is in turn different from China, redoubling the otherness effect.This doubling of one's stakes is also found in her descriptions of common pleasures and popular habits. As Benedict writes, the Japanese have elevated simple gestures of everyday life to the degree of an art: sleeping is "one of the most accomplished art of the Japanese," the daily bath is "a fine art of passive indulgence," and erotic pleasure is "an area about which they are not moralistic and we are." But not only are these customs different from ours: they contradict themselves and are negated by other cultural traits. Every pleasure is redoubled by its negation: the hot bath with cold showers, relaxed sleeping with sleep deprivation, eating with fasting, romantic love with self-sacrifice, erotic pleasure with abstinence. Similarly, keeping a mistress, visiting geishas or prostitutes are "within the circle of human feelings," and "homosexual indulgences", autoerotic pleasures, or indulging in sake drinking are also part of accepted behaviors, "about which moralistic attitudes are inappropriate." But these "human feelings" are in turn contradicted by duty and social obligations, to which they must abide.In the end, this doubling of contradictions inverts the poles between Japan and the US, and the American reader is faced with his own contradictions. As Clifford Geertz's suggestive essay highlights, "what started out as a familiar sort of attempt to unriddle oriental mysteries ends up, only too successfully, as a deconstruction, avant la lettre, of occidental clarities." To borrow a lengthy quotation from Geertz's essay: "There is, in fact, nothing 'wrong with the picture,' just with those who look at it upside down; and the enemy who at the beginning of the book is the most alien we have ever fought is, by the end of it, the most reasonable we have ever conquered. Japanese newspapers pronounce defeat as 'all to the good for the ultimate salvation of Japan.' Japanese politicians happily govern the country under MacArthur's umbrella-parasol. And the Emperor, urged by the General's advisors to disavow divinity, complains he is not really regarded as a god but does so anyway because foreigners seem to think that he is and it should be good for the country's image."

I like to use all natural and or organic hair care and body care when I can do so.As I find a lot of the time I have really good results with themWhen I know I am not putting unknown.Hard to say chemical into my hair or onto my skin.It just feels like maybe I might have be helping my skin or hair out in the long term.This argan oil conditioner which is for itchy dry scalp.Is loaded with all sorts of natural moisturisers such as manuka honey and argan oil.Is very hydrating it takes a bit for me to figure out the right amount for my hair.I have been using it everytime i shower and my hair feels so soft and looks very smooth.No longer is it dry and frizzy.I received this fantastically' hydrating conditioner at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I mounted my Television' above  fireplace the issue after that was there was no place to put my PlayStation.This tempered glass shelve.Came with everything I needed to mount it on my fireplace.The glass shelf is a lot larger that I anticipated it would be.it weights around two point seven pounds without any hardware or mounting brackets on it with.It is very mall made with all metal brackets.the glass is tempered.We could not find the right spot to mount it where it did not stick out to far.It is being used in my bedroom to hold a lamp.As I was not able to find the right location in my living room for it.That is me being too picky about how to looks.not that there was anything wrong with the shelf.Make sure to take measurements if you are super picky like me.Once you get the shelf I am sure you will be very pleased with it.I received this floating shelf at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

These headbands are a tad smaller than the other ones I reviewed.The seam to fit my daughters heads better than mine.They work wonderfully to keep their hair out of their faces.All day long.I put one on in the morning before school they came home with it still on and in relatively the same look I created.The variety of colors allows them to change it yup to match with their clothes they are wearing that day.these are really soft cotton feeling.The are also wider than normal I feel.Which is great for my daughters hair as they get flyaways near the hairline an.These headbands keep them looking presentable all day.Very pleased with the headbands.My girls must find them acceptable as they love to pick one out for the day.I received these headbands at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I have had the pleasure of trying out a couple items that HBY sells.The first item was a set of very strong hairbands.That I use on a daily basis without one snapping yet.So when the opportunity to check out some more of their hair accessories came up.I did not hesitate.This set of knotted headbands is super soft.They are on the larger side.So they would fit a teenager or adult.I put them in my four-year-old's hair and they slide around too much.They did not like them.I wear them and find them to be comfortable.They are larger so they will cover any hairline issues.Such as frizzy hair or an unruly cowlick.When you put them on the stay in place.No sliding forward or backwards.The headbands are nice and stretchy.The look to made out of soft cotton material.These are not your cheap headbands you find in every store.Both Fashianable and functional like a headband should be. I received these headbands at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

First off this is my first experience with a camera lens for my phone.When I first put it on. I could not figure out what the heck the point of it was.The pictures looked the same to me.This company sent an email explaining how to use.I was really glad they did as I was not using it right.So I tried it again following instructions from the email.Darn, I was impressed with the difference I see so much detail in my cell phone pictures.I never used to use my cell phone camera due to the fact that it takes really crappy pictures.I am glad this camera lens makes them so much better.As sometimes I just do not want to lug my Nikon camera around.If you love to take photos as much as I do grab one of this LOHA camera lens.It was truly impressive the detail I could see with it versus just my cell phone camera.I received this camera lens at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Having such a large family.It has been a long time since I had the time to sit and focus on what I liked to do prior to having a family.This year my youngest girls went to preschool.I found myself at a loss as to what I was going to do with my time without little people in the background commanding my attention.One thing I really have always had a passion for was painting.So when the chance came up to check out this six-pack of acrylic colors.I was really looking forward to enjoying this new found time expressing myself.These are nice size tubes of paint.I did not have any paint brushes or canvas around.As I can not remember where I put them.I found some sponge brushes.And away I painted.The texture of the paint is thick not runny.So each color does give a nice solid color.The colors are all very bright and true to what you see on your screen.i had so much fun creating with this set of acrylic paints.I do not feel the are of lesser quality then paints I have used in the past.I was very pleased I got the chance to check them out.And hope the will help me to unleash my creative side once again.I do recommend these paints.I received these acrylic paints at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I ordered these touchscreen gloves for my husband.He always has gloves on.But needs to take them off when he uses his phone.I figured these would be a great pair for when he is driving.He has long thin fingers that he can have trouble finding gloves that are both long and wide enough.these touchscreen gloves.Are a great fit.With the zipper on them they allow him a nice tight fit.The colors are an orange and grey with red zipper.Very stylish I can see these touchscreen gloves being used for a lot of different situations.The material is thin so I will probably have to invest in a warmer pair for are super cold winter for him.Right now these are working great.The fact that he does not have to remove them to answer a call or make one is just one more reason why he is so pleased with them.I received these touchscreen gloves at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

From scraping the dough off my counter top to scooping up food.This stainless steel pastry scrapper has been missing from my kitchen.This pastry scraper has got so many uses.I have always wondered how the heck you get all the dough up off the counter now I know.It is comfortable to use with large rubber handle.I have used it to chop up my meat when frying ground beef.My favorite thing about it is the measuring marks.If I am following a recipe, I can quickly use it to tell how much butter or whatever I am adding.An all around very useful item to have in any kitchen!!!I received this pastry scraper' at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

When I saw these jars I knew the would be perfect to sort out my craft drawers.There is a mess in them.I can no longer find anything.These jars are just the right size to store everything from beads to tacks in.They are solid glass jars.The came packaged in their own section of a gridded box.So the all arrived in perfect shape ready for me to fill them up.these jars would be great for any organization needs.Along with the fact that the would be a great size for party favors at a wedding.They are just the right size for my needs I am very pleased with them.I received this set of hexagon jars at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a super cute way to dress up the most your bathroom with some holiday cheer.This set comes with the snowman hat which is the to cover a box of tissues.The face which is the toilet seat cover and his body which is the rug.i do not feel it is going to last more then this year It feels to be a thin felt material.The rug is also felt the bottom of it is slippery.It would be cute in a spare bathroom that does not get much use.in the picture it looks to me like the hat was to cover the top of the toilet tank.But it nowhere fits it.Then I realised it was only to cover a tissue box.It is cute and festive.I will only be using it when I have company over.As my kids are really hard on stuff.And I do not feel it can hold up until Christmas with daily use.It is a cute idea but  I am not impressed with it.I received this toilet seat set at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

From a candlelight dinner to hanging outside with my family.This led tea light candle holder.Leaves the most beautiful butterfly when lite all over your walls.It is on the smaller side so make sure you read the description when you purchase it.As I had not.even at the size it is it is for sure a great way to light up your home or patio.It is hard to put in the tea light and remove them.Due tho the fact that the cover is attached to the handle/hanger.One good thing about that is a will not misplace the top.A couple of these tea light holders hanging around my yard would be so pretty.I received this tea lite candle holder at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

These goggles are very adjustable.My girls are almost five they fit on them great.Nice and tight fit around the eyes to not allow water to get into their eyes.These could easily be a pair of googles your child could wear from babies through at least five as my girls are almost five and they are still working out great for them.The colors on them help them to pick out their pair of goggles easily amongst the sea of one colored googles that you see everywhere.We are very happy with are google and do feel they would be a great first pair for any child.I received these googles at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

0:50 Mins All the special women in my life have birthdays in February.They are super hard to shop for.One thing I know the like is jewelry.So when I came across this beautiful William Wang birthstone pendant in purple.I had to check it out.It arrived and boy was I excited.Just like a kid in a candy store as I opened in.The photos do not do it justice.It is so much more beautiful in person.The necklace from the stone setting to the chain.Is so pretty.The platinum snake chain is eighteen and a half inches long long.With an extender on it allowing you to adjust it a couple more inches to get the perfect look on yourself.The birthstone stone is huge on it.It is securely mounted and surrounded with Swarovski crystal that form a v shape over it.Every inch of this necklace is just gorgeous.I am really debating if I will gift it or keep it for myself.This is a beautifully sparkly necklace that is sure to make a great gift for the holidays.I received this necklace at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Jumping rope is an effortless way to get that heart pumping.The thing with the majority of jump ropes is the come as one length should work for everyone.This is the first aluminum rope I have used.It has changed my opinion on ropes for sure.It arrived nicely packaged inside the bag was two rope cables plus a drawstring storage bag to store them in.When not it use.The cables are ten feet long.With the ability to adjust them mid-workout with the thumbscrews.The handles are slim with a grip on them.So there is way more control when jumping versus the old school plastic handles.Whether you are an advanced jumper or a basic jumper this jump rope is sure gooing to meet your needs.I am very pleased with the fact that it so lightweight and easy to adjust to my liking.I received this jump rope at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Really wish I hadn't even tried this one. I bought a camelbak for my 5 year old. This thing fits but you CANNOT get any water out of it!! I have tried everything! It just will not work. Back looking for another option so we can use the camelbak on outings.

So I waited before reviewing & have been using these for a couple of cycles. I am never going back to pads or tampons! I did practice putting it in & taking it out before I started, just seemed like a good idea when I wasn't stressing about making it work. I haven't had any issues with these & can easily wear them the 12 hours they claim (the only time it leaked was about 13 hours in one day when I hadn't been around a restroom). For me these are the absolute best option, I do not feel them and there is no dryness issue. I have already recommend them to my closest friends. I like these best and have also used the throwaway ones --I didn't like the idea of having to deal with cleaning it while out at places. I have looked at some local box stores since using these & I haven't found them near me! So Amazon to the rescue!

I ordered this to match my son (he requested I be tinkerbell since he is being peter pan). The wings they sent are TINY and do not look ANYTHING like the photo. See the bottom of the skirt in the picture? That second layer is a sheer layer that you wear like a belt, but it only has that material on the FRONT of the thing you wear like a belt. I was worried my chest wouldn't fit in it (my main concern with all of the tinkerbell costumes. . . ) but it did. That is the only good thing I have to say about this one. I am back looking on here to decide if I will buy new wings and maybe a crinoline or something to go under it to make it work for a party this weekend, or send it back and not match my son.
Works perfectly with my laptop as described.
Works perfectly with our dual screen tvs in the car. As described.

I am really pleased with these! I have had two surgeries on my arm after being a passenger in a car accident about 7 years ago. I have not regained the flexibility I used to have. I started using these along with the NSD spinner. It is simple to use and I can do it while playing on the tablet. I can tell a big difference!  I haven't built up to the strongest but using the easy and medium is a nice workout for both my hand and wrist. Between the two I have noticed my hand isn't going numb like it used to.

I was shocked when we got this! It is a really good mask & I got it  for under $5! The eyes are clear to see through and it has foam on the back of the mask so it doesn't hurt your face. My son loved that it matched his new pjs. Thanks so much!

This is the perfect size for my 4 year old! He started taking golf lessons after he had such an interest with the plastic sets. This one was the perfect size for him. It is heavy like a driver should be and has withstood a lot from my son. For $17 I can't complain!  We will buy the next size up when he out grows this one.

This was a prefect addition to our month of learning about the moon. It is what I had in mind when I was searching for books. It has real pictures showing each phase & my 4 year old easily understood (as well as a 3 year old and a 2 year old). We read several books about the moon & phases of the moon. The fact these where real pictures and simple  was exactly what I had hoped for!

We used these last week in our week dedicated to learning about frogs. The tangible objects really help the little ones learn the names and stages of the life cycle! My 4 year old, plus two extra 2 year olds all learned the names of each stage and could put them in order! Add in some youtube videos of the life cycle (Bill Nye has a full episode on youtube!) and the Froggy books for some fun themed things as well!

This works on my old Iphone as well as a first generation Ipad. Had it for a few weeks, and had no problems.As other reviewers said, it does not charge when plugged into the computer (but can sync). If it could charge while syncing I would be happy to give it five stars.For the price & the length you can't beat it.
Why spend so much more money for the same product at the store? I have had our cable for over a year, and it has worked perfectly! Dont waste your money on something else, this product works! =)

I loved this movie! I actually didnt take my little one to see it in theaters & now I wish I had. Its a cute story, that has a good moral. The movie also keeps my almost 3 yr old's attention. I catch him singing along even if he isnt watching it (if its playing in the back ground).

I love the fact that this tea set is Made in America, made of recycled milk bottles, safe for food consumption, AND dish washer safe!!! =) Yes at first I couldnt believe I was spending that much on a plastic tea set, BUT I dont regret it. These pieces are STURDY! I have multiple kids come play, and these have taken a beating in the last four months but dont look any different! I am going to add the other collections made by Green Toys to our plethora of toys as well! I know at least two parents of children I baby sit will be buying this set as well. The colors are nice and vivid as well! I do keep the spoons out of the den, just because I have little children come play often. We have a cute little basket we keep this set with some play cakes on the hutch. My son & his friends will pull it out and have a tea party (hello good manners lesson!!) then put it up when they are done.

I keep a spray bottle of this (diluted with water and a few squirts of Dawn dish soap) to spray around all the doors/windows/floor boards of our home. I also use it to clean in the kitchen & bathroom. We thought we had a squirrel get into our attic (which scared me in the middle of the night when it sounded like it was coming through the roof!!). Pour some of this onto a cotton ball, and throw them up in your attic! Also spray the diluted stuff to get it all around up there. Within a day or so no more noises during the night!! =)

We have quite a collection of Einstein dvds. I love the fact they are teaching music & art while children LOVE them. This one includes more than one episode (as all the ones we own). My son loves following along to the directions, and often asks to play Einsteins.

I have three of her books & I love them all! This is a great resource for both parents and caregivers. I have worked with kids for over ten years, and there are still things in here I have tabbed. =) You wont regret buying these books.

My toddler has a big basket of these books (separate from the other books he has, since he LOVES these). I love that this one has the ABC's, he loves spotting things & this is a great tool. I recommend ALL of the first look & finds. They offer great opportunities for children to learn colors, shapes, matching, counting, letters, and more.

I liked the fact I was able to order this through prime. I have had a cord (from my cable jack being run to the tv about eight or ten ft away) for a couple months. I have been looking for one of these, and no store around me had them. This did just the trick. Half of the cord was already tucked under large toys, but it ran across a door way that was out in the open. I read other people had put it in a hot car or boiling water to get it to lay flat. Well, its been cold here (I know very strange for "spring" in the "south") & I am not about to use one of my pots we cook with to heat this with. So once I got it today I wrapped it around the opposite direction and taped it together. Left it alone for about six hours, then took a hair dryer on high to it. Only took a couple minutes of heating for me to know it was going to lay flat. Simple, and effective! Hope that helps!

I was looking at vitamins for my almost three year old and myself. He was taking flinstone vitamins, and I wanted to add probiotics and a good omega 3 to his intake. I came across this brand, and liked everything I read about it. It is well rounded and covers everything basic, without having allergens in it. It also has the probiotics already in them! I did order a omega 3 & DHA (spectrum is the brand) that are flavored liquid gels so he can chew them (I tasted them and they taste pretty good). These rainbow stars came in today, and my son happily chewed it up and said they taste good. He also loved the fact they have stars on them (stars are always a hit with him), I took a picture and posted it.I feel better that he is getting everything he needs, and he is happy with them. =) i also ordered my vitamins from this brand, and I like mine as well. This will be the brand we stick with!

I mistakenly thought  these would be large enough to hold outdoor extension cords and other ""garage" items. If I had seen them in the store I would not have purchased them, especially considering they are four dollars a piece with tax. Also if you are looking for a black wire basket attachment I own 3 of the Honey Can Do brand which is available online for sixteen dollars at walmart and home depot. Unfortunately neither company offers them in their stores, but maybe they will if it becomes a popular item. It measures  7.6 in.height x 13.9 in.width, and 5 in. deep and can hold up to 50 lbs. They fit perfectly at the end of a 14 inch shelving unit and I find them quite useful.

I have been using another brand for years but it kept popping off the clear hole plug and it is over $4 to purchase the parts from its manufacturer. These were on sale at BJ's for a 4 pack (green, yellow, orange, and blue), for ten dollars. So for that price I decided to try them. I deducted one star since the flip top presses on my face when I drink out of it and it is annoying to me. However I do like the hourglass shape as that makes it easy to handle with soapy hands like when washing the car. It is BPA free and the lid can be placed in the top of dishwasher and bottle at the lower level.

This product works quite well for clearing my kitchen and bathroom sinks which I use 1-2 times a year. I reside in a 1955 home that still has it's original galvanized steel and iron drainage pipes, so I consider myself lucky I have not had to replace them yet. It is important to wear chemical safe gloves and eye protection when using this product as it does splatter as it initially contacts water. I'm still somewhat concerned about environmental safety, but all the other "safe" products did not solve my drainage issue. This is my third purchase on Amazon of this product using different sellers each time. This particular seller currently offers the best value for this product. My first  purchase of this product was one bottle for ten dollars including shipping, so getting three for this price with shipping is quite a bargain.

The best feature of this and other Jigsaw products is being timed released. I have become a loyal customer to this brand for that reason and it seems to be a high quality product. I take 2 in the AM with breakfast and 2 in the evening after dinner. I have never had any issue with change in bowel movements and it has provided moderate improvement in my sleep maintenance issues from menopause. Yes, it's a bit pricey over other magnesium products and I have used numerous brands over the past 20 years and it is still my favorite.

All four of my cats LOVE this specific flavor and get excited just like they do when they see the Greenie cat treats. I have all of the Nutro Co.cat  flavors with and without the hairball control, but this one is THE favorite. It doesn't really smell any different to me than the other flavors and they certainly all look the same. I must say it has decreased my one long haired cat from vomiting fur balls. I have not noticed any change in bowel habits which I thought I would see an increase in output. I took advantage of the incredible recent sale, but unfortunately this flavor had a 4 bag limit. I still buy Organix too which also recently had a great discount sale with a late expiration date as well.

This offer is the best bang for your buck since the next best price for this product is at your local big blue box home improvement store for nine ninety nine for 12" x 20' or 24" x 10 feet. I bought this not only for kitchen and bathroom cabinets but to protect my Honey Can Do wire shelves for the 14 inch deep ones. I purchased a different brand that is basically the same for the 18 inch deep wire shelves at my local BJ's since it was on sale for seven ninety nine with clip-less coupon and no limit. Now that I know the quality for this product I have recommended it to all my friends since it is not likely that it will ever have to be replaced. I thank the Warp Brothers for keeping their products reasonably priced and at a high quality level.

Yesterday I was shopping at costco and this item was being demonstrated. I had been turned off of coconut water from the 3 brands I had previously tried, but since it was free and it was chilled, I took a chance. IT WAS FANTASTIC! The flavor was not like the terrible Vita Coco brand I had also bought at costco nor the other brands I tried from the grocery store. This tasted exactly like fresh coconut water and I was quite surprised. The demonstrator warned me that even though it was a good seller, it was being cancelled by costco. For 4 of the 33.8 oz. containers it is twelve ninety seven. The expiration date is May 14, 2016 so I plan to stock up.According to the box on 33.8 oz. container is made from 5 organic coconuts and no sugar is added. For my taste buds, it is the perfect level of sweetness and I'm used to using Now or Kal organic stevia. This product is pasteurized which may turn off some people and frankly I would prefer it not to be but that won't stop me from purchasing it. I will likely add it to my S&S items on Amazon in the near future.From a health prospective fresh coconut has numerous beneficial health properties be it from the oil, water, or fruit.This water provides 1900 mg of potassium and 74 mg of magnesium per 33.8 oz. container. I eat coconut at least in one form daily and use it on my skin as it absorbs quickly. Let's Do Organic is my favorite brand of the coconut flakes which are thicker and larger than the standard shredded coconut. I put it in oatmeal, madras lentils, and eat it dry (and it is dry), but favorable and not sweetened with sugar. I also makes great dark chocolate coconut candy treats that easily satiate one's sweet tooth. Amazon thankfully has it on their S&S program so it is very cost effective.

First of all the quality and thickness of the cables are top shelf. I think it will take me a while, if ever, to break them.Thus far I've magically made my micro cables stop working although they were not kinked or visually injured. They also come in a nice storage box so it will be easy to find them, plus I like they are white vs. black since everything around my computers and tablet is black and it is easy to spot them if I didn't return them to the box.I keep one of the one foot cable in each car since they already have their own USB ports. No more excuses for not keeping cell phones or laptops charged.

This is one of the best purchases I have made on Amazon and I have bought quite a bit over the past 13 years. If you price compare this item with the blue or orange stores, you will be shocked at what a generous deal this is and the extremely low shipping cost. This very heavy box arrived in perfect condition which shocked me when smaller light weight boxes arrive crushed.I purchased this a year ago to redo the moisture barrier under two houses myself. It is so much thicker and of a better quality than when I had my pest control company redo it twice since they used a thinner plastic that was not durable and charged quite a bit of money to remove and install it while not doing a good job. That ended my 25 year relationship with them. It was a bit challenging for me due to the weight and to be honest I do not enjoy being in the crawl space as it is a little spooky. It looks great and I plan on using it on my outdoor shed marine grade wood flooring base then putting the plastic shed on top.

I have been a long term satisfied Tidy Cat pellet system user of 3 pans for 4 cats. During April 2015 I paid forty dollars and fifty three cents with subscribe and save for the 40 count pads which I had been doing for years. When I went to reorder the price increased by 50% which was unacceptable for my budget. I tried the other options and this brand by far was the winner of a permanent replacement unless Tidy Cat reverts back to their previous lower pricing. I contacted the manufacturer who promptly sent me a free sample and it is so close to Tidy Cat pads in absorption and odor control which my other alternative ALL-Absorb does not offer, that I bought this bulk package. My order came in a plain brown box with the pads neatly folded inside but not as the packaging shown in the picture which did not matter to me.

This was a very informative read that I learned quite more about the movers and shakers of that time period that sadly haven't changed much, and on some levels is the same or worse. It certainly made me more appreciative of  maverick women and from their legacy that I reap the bemnefit today.

This is the perfect grass containing bluegrass and rye grass for a yard that receives plenty of sun. If reseeding it will cover 1350 square feet and if starting a new lawn or bare areas it covers 675 square feet. As with all of Scotts' grass seed products that have Watersmart Plus, the benefits are the seed.absorbs twice as much water, contains a fertilizer that doesn't burn the seed, and is protected against disease with Apron XL fungicide (information is available at http://regulatoryinfo-sc.com). It takes about 5-10 days to grow and needs daily watering.until established at 2 inches tall. If you have any questions Scotts can be reached at 1-800-543-8873. It is available at both big orange and blue box stores and is currently on sale. As with all Watersmart Plus products, Scotts offer a "no quibble guarantee," just save your proof of purchase.

This is a well known brand sold in just about all home centersif you want to read the entire label before purchasing. It is an amazing garden product that is plant food and a weed killer combined, (for up to three weeks), yet.safe for most plants, but not to be used on lawns per the manufacturer. This 5.65# container will probably last me at least through two summer seasons. The entire container covers up to 900 square feet. Of course there are contact precautions especially for the eyes and skin, but as long as you where long sleeved tops, gloves, hat and safety goggles you should be fine.They also caution you NOT to reuse the plastic container. If you have any specific questions, please contact the manufacturer at 1-800-233-1067.

I received these today and they are a perfect fit. Only my Milwaukee adjustable fit safety glasses fit as well as these, but they fall off if I bend my head down. I think I have an average size female head and these glasses fit snugly while wearing them or moving them on top of my head. If you have a larger size head these will probably be too tight fitting. I especially like when I lower my head to bend over the glasses stay firmly on my face or on the top of my head. If you knew how many pairs of safety or reading glasses I go through then you would understand why I especially appreciate this feature.The other safety features include foam around the entire lenses and nose bridge which is very comfortable.I wish all safety glasses manufactures would do this. A head strap and storage bag is also included, but I will protect mine in a hard cover eyeglass case instead. Although the lenses are dark, you still see true colors unlike some sunglasses. I have a feeling I will be buying another pair for myself and as gifts for my gardener friends.

During December 2012, I purchased Hitachi C10FCE2 10-Inch Compound Miter Saw from Amazon for replacing the trim around the doors, flooring,and windows in a future rental property, so that was my only experience with a miter saw. So when I had a chance to own this beauty, I grabbed it. Although I'm only 5'1" and petite, I had no issue loading it while still in the box into my Camry and then into the rental house.When I took it out of the box and compared it to the Hitachi, well it was like a beginner's saw compared to a contractor's professional tool. Don't get me wrong, I've been happy with the Hitachi and have no complaints..However this DeWalt saw IS BEAUTIFUL and we all know DeWalt is a great brand for reliability.I own several other DeWalt tools: a planner,(which I admit it is so powerful I'm nerous when using it), drills, and the batterry operated screwdriver. Luckily I have a friend who will show me how to adjust it since it is somewhat different from the Hitachi..After I get finished with this property then I plan to add crown moulding to my house and some other upgrades which will require this saw. I will update this review after my training this weekend, but I doubt I will find any faults.

Although the Greenies are larger than dry cat food pieces, my four cats only chew once to break it in half and then swallow it, so I don't think they get the dental benefit. They go crazy when they see the bag and try to steal from each other like they are starving when there is wet and dry food available. Since the CET dental chews are bigger and require more chewing, I'm going back to that brand and will only use Greenies as treats.

Although I ordered the grade 6-7 book, I received the K to ! instead, so this review is on that book. This book will definitely help prepare your child for first grade. The skills it covers is reading, writing, math, science, social studies, fitness, character development, monthly goal setting and includes an answer section, flash cards, stickers, and a certificate of completion they can hang on their bedroom wall or put in a frame for their dresser. This book is very well designed and is sturdy so that several children should be able to use it in consecutive years before it requires replacement. I was surprised at the wonderful detail and is so colorful that it presents as fun versus school work.Other bonuses are teaching your child the value of mulch which includes a simple experiment,making a soap ship, learning road signs, telling time,growing a tree, and making a shoebox treasure chest. You may well find that even at this level, adults may learn something new too. For me it was making a ship out of soap!  I think this series of books presents learning in such a fun way that children will be eager to learn and quickly gain confidence in their abilities for future knowledge and skills.

This is an amazing, well organized book that provides academic learning,character development and fun physical exercises during summer vacation.I was surprised that I learned new things such as making "growing crystals" which was a fun experiment to do.This book includes an extensive summer reading list and writing practice which I was glad to see since the schools in our area no longer promote handwriting since computers/tablets are used. I was surprised at some of the topics that I thought would be for an older age group such as learning about the Supreme Court and other government levels, how the lungs work, data analysis, ratios, converting to the metric system, and analyzing a Robert Frost poem about choosing one's life path. Conveniently it provides an answer section which most parents will use, flash cards, and an attractive certificate of completion that could be framed and hung on a wall. This book is such a fantastic value that also offers additional free activities at summerlearningactivities.com/sba. All in all, this book really is a ten star product and I am so glad that I had the opportunity to learn about this series of books by reviewing this one.

This item arrived today and I was pleasantly surprised at how cute and well made it is. It is exactly as shown in the picture and as described in the narrative. It can function as a drying towel to a costume, or a special blankie like one of the Charlie Brown's characters uses. I hand washed it and then dried it in the dryer. No noticeable shrinkage or loose threads. The next time I'll wash it with the regular towel load since it has proven itself durable. If it suddenly falls apart which I strongly doubt, I'll write an update. I expect it will last longer than it will be needed in my household.

This is a sweet adolescent friendship story of Fan, a teenage Chinese migrant girl who had befriended Anna, an American teen of Chinese heritage, when Anna visited China. They stay in touch and a friendship develops. As fate would have it, Fan is eventually sponsored to come to America and attend high school for a year by Anna's close friend Andee's family who is half Chinese and very wealthy. Fan slowly adjusts to American culture although she is homesick, studies very diligently, and becomes like a sister to Anna and Andee. Later on her beloved grandfather, Gong Gong unexpectedly dies and Fan wants to go home. However her mother wants to stay and continue with her education until the Chinese Spring Festival, when if they can afford it will make the journey to visit her grandmother, the widow of Gong Gong. There is a surprise going away party for Fan prior to her return to China and a special poem is written for her by Anna and Andee to celebrate their sisterhood.I appreciated the subtle way social issues were addressed by this author and that she included a Chinese pronunciation guide.  I enjoyed practicing the words since one of my friends adopted two female Infants from China who are now eleven and thirteen and have recently learned some Chinese phrases. If you're interested in an adult version book about Chinese American women, please consider The Joy Luck Club by Amy Tan which was made into a fantastic movie of the same title. The Joy Luck Club book and movie provides a very strong positive message for all women. It is my favorite chick flick that I have watched at least a dozen times. I have it on its original release on videotape and DVD. It has some disturbing scenes that some may not want to watch, but keep in mind so does the daily news.

I am a big fan and owner of numerous Dummies books from plumbing to photography, to the Lost Books of the Bible, and the list goes on and on. Although they might not always go into the detail I desire, they have consistently been beneficial and steered me to other resources. This book is exceptionally thorough as seen in its comprehensive Table of Contents.  It explains that it isn't just a book, it's a process designed to guide you to your enhanced self-esteem and clarifying "Foolish Assumptions." After reading the introduction, I went to chapter 23, Ten Famous People Who Raised Their Self-Esteem. This surprising famous ten included Helen Keller, Thomas Edison, Harriet Tubman, Theodore Roosevelt, Albert Einstein, Mahatma Gandhi, Ralph Waldo Emerson, Abraham Lincoln, Frederick Douglass, and my number one feminist hero, Eleanor Roosevelt. This chapter definitely gives one inspiration to not only read the chapters in order, but to follow through with the recommendations to improve one's self-esteem which most of us could probably benefit regardless of age or status. I think this esteem enhancing book would make an excellent summer gift for twelve year olds prior to starting the seventh grade to offset hormonal changes and peer pressure. Actually I think everyone of any age could benefit from this book as it covers more than just esteem building techniques. For example it discusses eating healthy food, exercise, self-nurturing which includes taking control of a bad mood, relationships, relying on alcohol and or drugs, making the most of your skin tone,  improving sleep habits and so much more. This is not a book you rush through if you truly want to gain permanent benefits, although initially I skimmed through it and highlighted the areas most important to me. It also offers free online webinars and teleseminars (www.thereismoreinsideyou.com and www.self-esteem-course.com). Other online tools are www.dummies.com/cheatsheet/selfesteem for a quiz that helps you assess your current level of self-esteem and stop negative self-talk. You can listen to guided audio visualizations @www.dummies.com/go/selfesteem.The chapters are:1. The Nature of Self-Esteem.2. Understanding the Impacts of Low Self-esteem.3. Where Does Low Self-esteem Come From?4. Measuring Your Self-Esteem.5. Affirming and Visualizing Your Better Self.6. Nurturing Yourself to Create Happiness.7. Creating a Healthy Body Image.8. Dealing with Your Negative Self-Talk.9.  Analyzing Perfectionism.10. Dealing Positively with Perfectionism.11. Increasing Your Confidence through Self-Awareness.12. Moving Beyond the Fear That's Zapping Your Faith.13. Creating and Reaching Your Goals.14. Examining Your Role in Creating Conflicts in Your Relationships.15. Rewriting Your Love Story.16. Getting Beyond Loving Love.17. Improving Personal Relationships.18. Re-Creating Your Image for Professional Success.19. Managing Your Relationships at Work.20. Presenting with Confidence.21. Helping Family and Friends.22. Helping Children and Teens Achieve Healthy Self-Esteem.23. Ten Famous People Who Raised Their Self-Esteem.24. Ten Approaches to Pursuing Excellence.25. Ten Tips for Quickly Improving Your Self-Esteem.Reading and doing these exercises isn't exactly fun all the time, but you get to learn better self-control and self-appreciation as you learn to release or let go of hurt, anger, and negativity towards self and others. For the cost of this book and your time commitment, this is an incredible bargain. Best wishes for your success!

This shampoo has a pleasant scent and lathers well. It has added moisturizers and is supposed to alleviate hair frizz. I usually use a hair conditioner and another heat protection product while blow drying my hair, but I didn't with this product so I could tell how well it worked. Well, there was a lot of frizz. Maybe it works better if you use their conditioner that matches this shampoo. I will continue to use it but now I will add my conditioner and heat protector which does prevent frizzy hair. It's too soon to comment on my winter dandruff being resolved, but since I used this shampoo years ago and had positive results, I expect a repeat positive result.

I think this is a very reputable company and I like the products I've tried so far. This bar has a good chocolate flavor with a decent coconut flavor, but the cashew flavor is missing. There are tiny pieces of cashew you can see, but not enough to get the creamy nut taste, hence the one star deduction. The massive list of ingredients is impressive especially since quite a few are organic. I was very satisfied after eating this as a late afternoon  snack. It is made in Canada and they have a toll free number 1.866.839.8863 or check out their website myvega.com, you'll be impressed with this piece of vegan heaven.

These nice weight reinforced index and tab sheets help to organize for school or work. The front page has five spaces to write the overview of the sections. Each numerical section of 1-5 has three alphabetical subsections. All tabs and the punched holes have clear plastic protection which increases durability. You can easily organize by week days or whatever you choose. Avery offers free templates at avery.com/print and if desired you can watch a demonstration at Avery.com/readyindexdemo. As with all Avery products they offer a 100% satisfaction guarantee which they really do honor.

These five clear tab plastic pockets dividers can hold up to 70 pages of standard sized paper are very well made and should last for a long time. They are considerably better quality than the easy to tear clear no tab full sheet size protectors I have been using to store itemized lists and corresponding receipts for a house rehab project. The clear deep front pocket opening is angled to make retrieval of pages or loose receipts easy to access. The back of the pocket is opaque and appropriately stiff but still very flexible. The included 10 layers of 5 clear label dividers can be used in either a laser or ink jet printer and can be applied to one or both sides of the tabs. Mine are labeled for electrical, plumbing, flooring, etc. and I will eventually need another set as it seems once one project gets completed, other repairs/replacements are required.To view a demonstration of designing and formatting the easy apply labels visit Avery.com/demo/im. Avery also has design and print templates at avery.com/print.Two other sites to visit are avery.com/indexmaker and Avery.com/help. Avery is well know for quality products and their hassle free guarantee which is a rarity nowadays.

This book reminded me of the movies Gone with the Wind, Cold Mountain and Yentl in the sense that Josephine and Libby are strong southern women disguised as men. I know in Cold Mountain, Zellweger and Kidman weren't pretending to be men, nor was Scarlett, but they certainly performed stereotypical male activity for that time period. And who could forget Streisand's strong woman disguised as a male rabbis student performance in Yentl?Their story starts out in picturesque pre-war Winchester, VA, which is horse territory and still very beautiful today. Libby's husband, Arden is killed during the War Between The States, so the two sisters eventually end up fighting against the Union soldiers disguised as men under very harsh conditions. We share their heartbreak, anger, and revenge as well  as their commitment, ability to survive, hopes, and new love. It is an enjoyable well written story that any fan of the Confederacy or strong female characters would enjoy. History is truly brought to life through southern culture from two women's perspective of this tragic war and all that is lost and regained.

There is no special fragrance to this bag, just a plain paper scent. It works well in keeping fine dust enclosed as long as it is not over filled. I tape over the opening with clear packing tape when disposing of it to avoid fine powdery leaks. It is a decent quality and quantity for the current price point.

I like Quicken products and this is no exception. In my case it has a lot of features that I didn't need. This version provides a free ebook of Nolo's Encyclopedia of Everyday Law and an one year subscription to its Online Living Trust which I was glad it did. I also signed up to be a complete organ donor, the brain has to be donated separately, and I hope using my body to practice on helps to save the life of some creature. Another plus was the paperback book, The Legal Answer Book for Families, which I skimmed through since none of that information was needed at this time. They also offer another version of this product with a more comprehensive paperback that you may want to compare before purchasing. Keep in mind you can upgrade with this from previous versions of Quicken WillMaker, WillMaker Deluxe, and Quicken Lawyer Personal, from 2002 to 2014, as each is only valid for the year it was produced and each year has pertinent legal updates. Also these estate planning documents are not valid in Louisiana, U.S. Territories or Canada. For the amount of information you get for this price, it's a great deal. The only reason I deducted one star is I think the other book version is easier for those somewhat lacking in computer skills. Just take your time and you'll be glad like me that you chose one of their WillMaker products.

What a great erotic story that had my senses tingling from the very first page.  R.B. Greenfield obviously has a very naughty and creative imagination to be able to write such a sizzling story!  I instantly was attracted to the premise of this book as I am a big fan of erotic fiction, especially ones that have a different twist like this one.  So after I started reading I was definitely glad that I bought the book.  I loved the storyline and the dynamics & chemistry between Richie Greenfield and the different Amazon women that he engages with.  The storyline flows nice with the perfect balance of twists and turns and steamy sexcapades.  The sexual encounters are top notch and really get your juices flowing.  Now I really dont like to give away the plots from stories that I read as it would be criminal to ruin a good book like this for another reader.  But I will say that it is an extremely hot read that will have you blushing and wanting more.  Great book!  5 big stars!

What a brilliantly written, twisted and torrid tale that was filled with passion, mystery, suspense, and taboos!  I simply couldnt put it down once I started reading it.  I dont know why, but gay-themed romance stories have always intrigued me.  And this one is one of the best I have read.  It has lots of twists and unexpected turns, which keeps you on the edge of your seat as you read through each and every page.  Some parts will leave you guessing, and other parts will make your senses tingle.  Even though the theme of the book is a little taboo and erotic, the actual storyline is really good!  I dont like to give story plots away as I would hate to ruin a great read for someone else, but if you are a fan of stories that have a gay romance theme, then I think you will really like this book as much as I did.  The author obviously has great imagination as it is reflected all throughout this book!  I highly recommend you put this one on your summer reading list now!

What an intense and gripping fantasy thriller that had me on the edge of my seat and fully engaged from the very first page.  Shadows Of Humanity was amazing!  I absolutely loved it.  J. Armand is quickly moving to the top of my favorite authors list as he a very gifted writer who truly understands the elements that go into the making of a good Armageddon fantasy read.  The characters are extremely well developed and play off of each other perfectly which adds a lot of depth & believability to the story.  Especially Dorian the main character.  Since I am such a huge fan and avid reader of fantasy fiction of this genre, I have become quite a snob.  So a book really has to deliver in order for me to take the time to consider reviewing it.  I am happy to report that this one is a complete winner.  If you are looking for a good book to put on your summer reading list, then look no further.  This one will definitely impress you!  I give it 5 big stars!

Incredible!  What a great paranormal fantasy and mystery novel that kept me on the edge of my seat the entire time I was reading!  J. Armand is obviously a very gifted writer with an incredible imagination to be able to conceptualize and write such a great book.  The story is well developed, imaginative, and really flows.  The author brilliantly uses lots of twists & turns and carefully crafted cliff-hanger moments to really keep you guessing.  I loved the way he develops the characters in this book.  They are very strong & believable, and the interactions are great!  This really is an awesome read if you like this genre of fiction you're looking for a super interesting & thought provoking story to put on your summer reading list.  It really kept my imagination in high gear the whole time I was reading it. I would highly recommend this book to anyone.

Outstanding is the best word that I can think of to describe this book!  It is truly packed full of so many great recipe ideas!  Betty Barnes has really outdone herself with this fabulous book.  I never knew that using spices to enhance food could be so easy or so flavorful.  I love to cook and was looking on Amazon for something that would challenge me in the kitchen a bit.  I wanted to really learn to create dishes that would really wow my friends & family.  I am so happy I found this book during my search.  I have made several of the recipes since reading the book and I am happy to report that everything has been extremely delicious!  If you are looking for a way to take your cooking skills to the next level and wow your friends then do yourself a favor and get this great book!  You wont be sorry!

This book really touched my spirit!  Don Mardak is such a fantastic writer who is filled with so much wisdom.  The moment I started reading I was completely captivated and overcome with emotion.  The story is like a living parable that really guides you and causes you to look within yourself.  As I read, I was really inspired to think deeply and reflect upon the current state of my own spirituality & soul.  The second part of the book, The Gospel According to I AM, was incredible.  It was not only inspiring, but also fascinating.  The entire book is a masterpiece and I look forward to much more from this great author!  If you are looking for a great book that will move you, then I highly recommend you add this one to your preferred reading list.  5 big stars!

What an intense mystery thriller that immediately grabbed my attention and had me sitting on the edge of my seat the entire time I was reading.  Ken Rossignol has penned a creative masterpiece with this story.  I am a huge fan of mystery and suspense fiction, so I am quite critical when I read a book of this genre and review it. For me, the book really has to deliver and keep my attention. I am happy to report that this great book does both. I absolutely loved it. The author definitely understands the mechanics of what makes a good mystery novel. You will have to read it as I am NOT going to divulge any of the details from this book's plot.  That would be criminal of me... to ruin any of it for another reader. Everything about this book is great, especially Danny and Martha Jones, the main characters.  They are a cross between Jonathan and Jennifer Hart from TV's Hart to Hart series... and Mickey Spillane's Mike Hammer. If you are a big fan of mystery fiction like I am, then I highly recommend you purchase and read this great book. Hats off to the author!

What a dark and torrid tale that drew me in and kept me guessing from the very first page. I absolutely loved it! Emily Lamcott just moved to the top of my favorite authors list. I am a huge fan of mysteries, especially vampire themed ones. This story has so many dimensions and twists & turns that you really don't know what is going to happen next. Being able to pull this kind of suspense off in a story is an art form that this author has been gifted with.  The story contains moments of suspense, eerie bone-chilling fear, light-hearted humor and sarcasm, and carefully crafted cliff-hanger moments that keep you hanging on the edge. If you are a fan of vampire themed stories or mystery thrillers, then I would seriously consider adding this great book to your summer reading list. I can't say enough good things about the book or the author.

What an epic saga that is filled with drama and adventure. I was literally on the edge of my seat and biting my nails the entire time I was reading. This story is so well written and full of depth. The author has created a brilliant masterpiece that really kept me engaged and anticipating each and every turn of the page. Victor Fox obviously has a very creative and deep-thinking imagination to be able to write such a great story. The characters are very well developed and I completely sympathized with each of the main characters plights and turmoil.  I really don't like to give away the details of the plot for the stories that I review... As I would never want to ruin such a great book for another reader.  But if you love epic saga themed stories... especially ones that are set if foreign lands & cultures... Then you will absolutely love this book! I give it 5 out of 5 stars.

What a helpful and eye-opening book! Sophie Lee provides detailed and easy methods for achieving a clean and tidy home. She has an easy style writing that makes cleaning feel a pleasure. I always loved clean and spotless houses, but I don't really enjoy cleaning and scrubbing floors. I prefer to work and do other things than waste my time on cleaning. I hate it when the house is a mess, but with all the work and the pressure I hardly have the time to make my house look the way I would like it to be. To most of us who have busy lives, housecleaning is an overwhelming job and unfortunately is done infrequently. This book is filled with great information and tips and it is really helpful. It is so easy to read and understand and it has helped me to be more clean and organized! It also gives useful tips and ideas on how to keep your home ready for guests and stress free. I definitely recommend this book to all the moms and women out there who are horrified that someone will drop by unexpectedly! Really useful! Highly recommended!

This was a completely educational and eye-opening book!  It is packed full of so much useful information that it is more like a reference book than just a simple diet & cookbook.  Vanessa Brown is obviously quite an expert on this subject and quite the healthy chef.  She does a great job of really explain the nuts & bolts of this diet in a very easy to understand way, instead of complicated medical diet jargon.  How refreshing indeed!  The recipes she provides are excellent.  There are so many that youll never run out of good things to prepare & eat.  I have tried several of the recipes since I got the book and I am happy to report that they have all been delicious so far.  So if you, or someone you know, is looking for a great book that will help them conquer the inflammation problems & ailments through diet instead of medication, then I highly recommend that you get this book.  It has been life changing for me!

This was one high powered, hot and steamy book that has added a new level of fun & excitement to me and my boyfriends sex life!  This book should definitely be on the nightstand of every couple.  The book explains in easy-to-follow detail each sexual position and how it is arousing.  The pictures and illustrations are also great making it very easy to start playing.  Lilly Taylor obviously has a tremendous appetite and aptitude for sexual enhancement.  She is truly an expert in Kamasutra if Ive ever saw one.  Some of the positions are really easy, and some are much more complicated and intense.  But imagine how fun it will be to work your way up to the hard ones!  Me and my boyfriend have tried several positions in the book and have has mind blowing orgasms.  We have made it into a game to where we try a different new position each night.  If you are looking for the perfect book to help spice up your sex life, then look no further!  This one is it!

What a dynamic story that had me feeling so many emotions as I read along.  I laughed out loud a couple times and I also had to wipe away tears.
